parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Holiness

1. Name an item in your home that only your father or mother is permitted to use and not anyone else.
2. Is there a cup in your house that only your father or mother can drink from?
3. Is that cup set apart from all other cups in your house?
4. Is there a bowl in your house that only your father or mother can eat from?
5. Is that bowl exclusive to your father and mother and set apart from all other bowls?
6. Is there a chair in your home that only your father is permitted to sit on?
7. Is that chair set apart from all other chairs in your home for your father's use only?
8. When do you say that something is Holy? Leviticus 20:26
> 26 You are to be holy to me because I, the Lord, am holy, and I have set you apart from the nations to be my own.
9. When a child is standing in muddy water and you wish to clean them up, what is the first thing you will do?
10. What will you do after taking them out of the muddy water? 
11. After God has set you apart, making you holy, does he also purify and sanctify you?
12. What will happen to the good tomatoes when you put good and rotten tomatoes together in the same basket?
13. If you wish to preserve the good tomatoes, what will you have to do?
14. What do you do with rotten tomatoes?
15. Do you wish to become like rotten tomatoes?
16. What do you have to do if you do not wish to become like rotten tomatoes?
17. Why did God instruct Abraham to leave his family? Genesis 12:1
> The Lord said to Abram, “Leave your country, your relatives, and your father's home, and go to a land that I am going to show you.
18. Do all men live by God's laws and principles?
19. What kind of people do you have to separate yourselves from?
20. What are some *common* things people do that you don't have to do if you wish to be holy?
21. Should you join people to do something because *everyone* is doing it?
22. Can an object be holy and set apart for God's use only?
23. How does an object become Holy? Leviticus 27:28
> 28 None of you may sell or buy back what you have unconditionally dedicated to the Lord, whether it is a human being, an animal, or land. It belongs permanently to the Lord.
24. Can the ground become Holy? Exodus 3:5
> 5 God said, “Do not come any closer. Take off your sandals, because you are standing on holy ground.
25. How does the ground become Holy?
26. Can your body become Holy?
27. How does your body become Holy? 
28. Is God holy?
29. Does God want all his children to be holy as well?
30. Is God common?
31. Does God also want his children to be uncommon?
32. Is God ordinary?
33. Should his children be ordinary?
34. Is God special?
35. Does God want his children also to be special?
36. Does God have laws for his holy ones to live by, which will make them different from the common people? Leviticus 20:7-8
> 7 Keep yourselves holy, because I am the  Lord your God. 8 Obey my laws, because I am the  Lord and I make you holy.
37. When do you say that something is sacred?
38. Give examples of sacred things.
39. Is worship sacred?
40. Is marriage sacred?
41. Should sacred things be approached with awe and reverence?
42. When do you say that something is *secular*?
43. Are there songs that are not sinful but do not also glorify God?
44. Give examples of secular things.
45. When do you say that something is *sinful*?
46. Give examples of sinful things.
47. Are there sinful songs?
48. When a song causes sinful passions to grow in you, is it sinful?
49. Are there sinful jokes?
50. When a joke makes you think sinful thoughts, is it sinful?
51. Are there conversations that corrupt?
52. Do you wish to become holy?
53. Are you willing to live by God's laws and principles?
54. Dedicate yourself to God. Tell God "Heavenly Father, I give you my heart, I give you my mind, I give you my body, in the name of Jesus."
55. Study these laws: [Be Human](https://civility-institute.com/en/learning-sheets/Be%20Human)

sections.question: Name an item in your home that only your father or mother is permitted to use and not anyone else.
Is there a cup in your house that only your father or mother can drink from?
Is that cup set apart from all other cups in your house?
Is there a bowl in your house that only your father or mother can eat from?
Is that bowl exclusive to your father and mother and set apart from all other bowls?
Is there a chair in your home that only your father is permitted to sit on?
Is that chair set apart from all other chairs in your home for your father's use only?
When do you say that something is Holy? Leviticus 20:26
sections.body: > 26 You are to be holy to me because I, the Lord, am holy, and I have set you apart from the nations to be my own.

sections.question: When a child is standing in muddy water and you wish to clean them up, what is the first thing you will do?
What will you do after taking them out of the muddy water?
After God has set you apart, making you holy, does he also purify and sanctify you?
What will happen to the good tomatoes when you put good and rotten tomatoes together in the same basket?
If you wish to preserve the good tomatoes, what will you have to do?
What do you do with rotten tomatoes?
Do you wish to become like rotten tomatoes?
What do you have to do if you do not wish to become like rotten tomatoes?
Why did God instruct Abraham to leave his family? Genesis 12:1
sections.body: > The Lord said to Abram, “Leave your country, your relatives, and your father's home, and go to a land that I am going to show you.

sections.question: Do all men live by God's laws and principles?
What kind of people do you have to separate yourselves from?
What are some *common* things people do that you don't have to do if you wish to be holy?
Should you join people to do something because *everyone* is doing it?
Can an object be holy and set apart for God's use only?
How does an object become Holy? Leviticus 27:28
sections.body: > 28 None of you may sell or buy back what you have unconditionally dedicated to the Lord, whether it is a human being, an animal, or land. It belongs permanently to the Lord.

sections.question: Can the ground become Holy? Exodus 3:5
sections.body: > 5 God said, “Do not come any closer. Take off your sandals, because you are standing on holy ground.

sections.question: How does the ground become Holy?
Can your body become Holy?
How does your body become Holy?
Is God holy?
Does God want all his children to be holy as well?
Is God common?
Does God also want his children to be uncommon?
Is God ordinary?
Should his children be ordinary?
Is God special?
Does God want his children also to be special?
Does God have laws for his holy ones to live by, which will make them different from the common people? Leviticus 20:7-8
sections.body: > 7 Keep yourselves holy, because I am the  Lord your God. 8 Obey my laws, because I am the  Lord and I make you holy.

sections.question: When do you say that something is sacred?
Give examples of sacred things.
Is worship sacred?
Is marriage sacred?
Should sacred things be approached with awe and reverence?
When do you say that something is *secular*?
Are there songs that are not sinful but do not also glorify God?
Give examples of secular things.
When do you say that something is *sinful*?
Give examples of sinful things.
Are there sinful songs?
When a song causes sinful passions to grow in you, is it sinful?
Are there sinful jokes?
When a joke makes you think sinful thoughts, is it sinful?
Are there conversations that corrupt?
Do you wish to become holy?
Are you willing to live by God's laws and principles?
Dedicate yourself to God. Tell God "Heavenly Father, I give you my heart, I give you my mind, I give you my body, in the name of Jesus."
Study these laws: [Be Human](https://civility-institute.com/en/learning-sheets/Be%20Human)

parts.title: II
parts.markdown:
# Holiness II

1. During creation, whom did God appoint to rule over the day? Genesis 1:16
> God made two great lights—the greater light to govern the day and the lesser light to govern the night. He also made the stars.
2. Whom did God appoint to rule over the night?
3. Does the moon have a light of its own, or does the moon only reflect the light of the sun?
4. Does the day and night already have their ruler?
5. What are the two kingdoms of this world? Matthew 12:26-30
> 26 And if Satan cast out Satan, he is divided against himself; how shall then his kingdom stand?
6. How many kingdoms will attempt to civilize you when you are born into the world?
7. How many governments will attempt to rule over your life when you are born into the world?
8. Who rules over the Kingdom of Light?
9. Does the Kingdom of Light live by a different set of rules, and does it have its own way of dressing, music, movies, language, marriage, etc.? Matthew 6:33
> But seek first the kingdom of God and his righteousness, and all these things will be added to you. 
10. Does the Kingdom of God have it's right way of doing things?
11. Must the believer seek this right way of doing things and attempt to live by them?
12. Describe music in the Kingdom of Light.
13. Describe dressing in the Kingdom of Light.
14. Who rules over the Kingdom of Darkness?
15. Does the Kingdom of Darkness live by a different set of rules, and does it have its way of dressing, music, movies, language, marriage, etc.?
16. Describe music in the Kingdom of Darkness.
17. Describe dressing in the Kingdom of Darkness.
18. Describe sex in both kingdoms.
19. In what ways does the language of the Kingdom of Darkness differ from the Kingdom of Light?
20. Is *fornication and adultery* in the Kingdom of Light called *cheating* in the Kingdom of Darkness?
21. Does the Kingdom of Light practice _courtship_ before marriage, wheras the Kingdom of Darkness practices _dating_, which involves sampling other humans, before marriage?
22.  Is _dating_ beneath a person who has been civilized by God?
23. What is the source of your civilization?
24. When you enter the Kingdom of Light who becomes your ruler?
25. How do you enter the Kingdom of Light? John 3:3
> Jesus replied, “Very truly I tell you, no one can see the kingdom of God unless they are born again.”
18.. When you enter the Kingdom of Darkness who becomes your ruler?
26. How do you enter the Kingdom of Darkness?
27. Can you belong to both kingdoms at the same time?
28. Who do you wish to be your ruler?
29. Which kingdom do you wish to belong to?
30. What is the story of Samson?
31. Which kingdom did Samson belong to at his birth?
32. What was God's purpose for sending Samson into the world? Judges 13:5
> 5 You will become pregnant and have a son whose head is never to be touched by a razor because the boy is to be a Nazirite, dedicated to God from the womb. He will take the lead in delivering Israel from the hands of the Philistines.
33. List the ways the Kingdom of Darkness treated Samson after he discovered the Spirit had left him, in the order in which they happened. Judges 16:21
> 21 Then the Philistines seized him, gouged out his eyes and took him down to Gaza.  Binding him with bronze shackles, they set him to grinding grain in the prison. 
34. How do you suppose they took out his eyes?
35. How will you be treated like Samson when you step out of the light into the Kingdom of Darkness?
36. Will you be bound?
37. Will your vision and purpose for life be taken from you?
38. Will your strengths and talents be wasted and used for the benefit of the Kingdom of Darkness?
39. Will you be harmed in a way that will make it difficult for you to return to the light, and even if you did, you will be useless in the hands of God? 
40. Will the Kingdom of Darkness use you for entertainment? Judges 16:25
> And when their hearts were merry, they said, “Call Samson, that he may entertain us.” So they called Samson out of the prison, and he entertained them. They made him stand between the pillars.
41. Are there humans bound by unclean spirits, because they did not stay in the light and remain holy? Matthew 12:43-45
> 43 “When an evil spirit leaves a person, it goes into the desert, seeking rest but finding none.  44 Then it says, ‘I will return to the person I came from.’ So it returns and finds its former home empty, swept, and in order.  45 Then the spirit finds seven other spirits more evil than itself, and they all enter the person and live there. And so that person is worse off than before. That will be the experience of this evil generation.”
42. Are those humans tormented day and night?
43. Does God brag about his children to his enemies? Job 1:8
> Then the Lord said to Satan, “Have you noticed my servant Job? No one else on earth is like him. He is an honest man and innocent of any wrong. He honors God and stays away from evil.”
44. Will you be used to mock God and bring dishonor to his name? Judges 16:23
> Now the lords of the Philistines gathered to offer a great sacrifice to Dagon their god and to rejoice, and they said, “Our god has given Samson our enemy into our hand.”
45. Do you want God to be mocked because you refused to stay in the light?
46. Is the story of Samson about the betrayal of a woman, or is the story about what happens to a child of the light when they decide to experiment with darkness?
47. Did Samson's fall start as a joke to him? Judges 16:10-12
> 10 Then Delilah said to Samson, “You have made a fool of me;  you lied to me. Come now, tell me how you can be tied.”
>
>11 He said, “If anyone ties me securely with new ropes  that have never been used, I’ll become as weak as any other man.”
>
>12 So Delilah took new ropes and tied him with them. Then, with men hidden in the room, she called to him, “Samson, the Philistines are upon you!”  But he snapped the ropes off his arms as if they were threads.
48. Did Samson know that his bronze shackles had already been prepared?
49. Is it for your safety that God instructs you to separate yourself from the Kingdom of Darkness and be holy?
50. Repent from anything you have taken from the Kingdom of Darkness and ask God to take you back and sanctify you.

parts.title: III
parts.markdown:
# Holiness III

1. Are there holy *things*? Ezekiel 22:26
> Her priests do violence to my law and profane my holy things; they do not distinguish between the holy and the common; they teach that there is no difference between the unclean and the clean; and they shut their eyes to the keeping of my Sabbaths, so that I am profaned among them.
2. How do things or objects become holy? Leviticus 27:28
> 28 None of you may sell or buy back what you have unconditionally dedicated to the Lord, whether it is a human being, an animal, or land. It belongs permanently to the Lord.
3. Does God have standards the worshipper must meet to make the worshipper compatible with God?
4. Does the priest stand between man and God to enable the worshipper to meet those standards?
5. Does God distinguish between the *holy* and the *common*?
6. When something is not *holy*, what is it?
7. When two or more people have access to the same thing, is it *holy* or *common*?
8. When you make that which is *holy*, *common*, have you profaned it?
9. When you dedicate yourself or something to God, does it make God the only one who has access to you or that thing, making it *holy*?
10. When you do not learn God's laws and attempt to live by them, are you *holy*? Leviticus 21:13-15
> 13 “‘The woman he marries must be a virgin.  14 He must not marry a widow, a divorced woman, or a woman defiled by prostitution, but only a virgin from his own people,  15 so that he will not defile his offspring among his people. I am the  Lord, who makes him holy.’”
11. Does God distinguish between the *clean* and the *unclean*?
12. When something is not *clean*, what is it?
13. When a *common* person has been defiled by sin, are they *clean* or *unclean*?
14. What are some *unclean* things or things that make you *unclean*? 
15. Does sexual immorality defile you and make you unclean?
16. Are there jokes that are unclean and also make you unclean?
17. Are there dances that corrupt and make you unclean?
18. Are there songs that are *unclean* and can corrupt or defile your mind, making it unclean?
19. Are there unclean conversations that can make you unclean as well?
20. Are there videos and pictures that defile you and make you unclean?
21. What was the requirement for the woman who would carry Jesus Christ in her womb and give birth to him? Isaiah 7:14
> 14 Therefore the Lord himself will give you a sign. Behold, the virgin shall conceive and bear a son, and shall call his name Immanuel.
22. Did the promise specify the name of the virgin?
23. If Mary had made herself unclean by defiling herself and losing her virginity, would she have qualified to host Jesus Christ in her womb, and give birth to him or another virgin who had kept herself undefiled?
24. Are you useful to God when you are unholy and unclean?
25. Can your body host God for God to fulfill his purposes in you when you have been defiled?
26. What does the enemy have to do if he wants to disqualify you and make you useless to God?
27. What is the difference between *holy*, *common*, and *unclean*?
28. How do you make something that is *holy*, *common*?
29. In what way is God profaned and made *common*?
30. When you fail to observe God's Sabbath, have you profaned him?
31. When you have a child outside a proper marriage, have you profaned God's marriage covenant? Deuteronomy 23:2
> A bastard shall not enter into the congregation of the LORD; even to his tenth generation shall he not enter into the congregation of the LORD.
32. How do you make something that is *common*, *unclean*?
33. Are there people who are clean and holy?
34. Describe them.
35. Do they live by God's laws and principles and refuse to defile themselves no matter what?
36. Are there people who are clean and unholy?
37. Describe them.
38. Can they be influenced by different kinds of spirits, both good and bad?
39. Are there people who are *unclean*?
40. Describe them. 
41. Are they permanently influenced by bad spirits?
42. Are you holy, *common*, or *unclean*?
43. Is the *unclean* always looking for ways to pollute the clean and profane the *holy*?
44. In what ways does the *unclean* attempt to pollute the *clean* and the *holy*?
45. When an *unclean* person is bragging to you about the *unclean* things they have done, what are they suggesting to you?
46. Can the *holy*, take what is *common* and make it *holy*?
47. What is the reason for your answer?
48. Can you fellowship with a Holy God, and benefit from your fellowship when you are not holy yourself?
49. Does holiness make you compatible with God who is holy?
50. Does holiness give you access to God?
51. Why does God want his children to be holy?
52. Pray and ask God to cleanse you from every filth of the flesh, every filth of the spirit, sanctify you, and make you holy.
53. Should there be an area of a holy person's life that is not holy?
54. Dedicate every area of your life to God; family, friends, education, business, etc.
55. What did God want to achieve with the nation of Israel? Exodus 19:4-6
> 4 ‘You yourselves have seen what I did to Egypt,  and how I carried you on eagles’ wings and brought you to myself.  5 Now if you obey me fully and keep my covenant,  then out of all nations you will be my treasured possession.  Although the whole earth  is mine,  6 you will be for me a kingdom of priests  and a holy nation.’  These are the words you are to speak to the Israelites.”
56. Has God called you to be his treasured possession, set apart from other humans, a priest, and a king, or have you been called to be like everyone else?
57. Do you want to be God's prized possession, holy and set apart to God, or do you want to blend in and be accepted by everyone else?
58. Does living a life of purity and holiness demonstrate to others that they can also be pure and holy?
59. Can purity and holiness be used to wage spiritual warfare?
60. What is the reason for your answer?
61. Does holiness make man compatible with his God?
62. Was Noah able to keep himself undefiled when the whole earth had turned away from God? Genesis 6:9-11
> 9-10 This is the story of Noah. He had three sons, Shem, Ham, and Japheth. Noah had no faults and was the only good man of his time. He lived in fellowship with God, 11 but everyone else was evil in God's sight, and violence had spread everywhere.
63. How did Noah achieve this? 
64. Can you also keep yourself undefiled by the world through close fellowship with God?

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# I Am a Little Seed

1. What is a seed?
2. Does a mango seed look like a mango tree?
3. Does the mango tree come from the mango seed?
4. When God wants to start something big, does he start small or does he start big?
5. When you find a mango seed, and you throw it away, what have you actually thrown away?
6. What do you do to make a seed grow?
7. What do you do about the weeds?
8. Do you know that you are a seed?
9. What is the reason for your answer?
10. Can God put a lot of potential in a person that is not immediately noticeable at their birth? Jeremiah 1:5
> Before I formed you in the womb I knew you, before you were born  I set you apart; I appointed you as a prophet to the nations.
11. What do you have to do to grow?
12. If you are the seed, then who are the weeds?
13. What do you do about the people who try to prevent you from growing?
14. When a seed has grown into a mighty tree, what can we get from the tree?
15. When you have grown into a mighty person, how can you become medicine to other people?
16. When you have grown into a mighty person, how can you bear fruits?
17.  When you have grown into a mighty person, how can you become a shelter for others?
18. When you have grown into a mighty person, how can you offer shade to others?
19. When you have grown up yet you are not a medicine to anyone, you do not bear fruits, and you are also not a shelter for anyone, are you a mighty person?
20. Which is easier to destroy, the tree and the seed?
21. What was so fearful about a baby that the dragon wanted to destroy it as soon as it was born? Revelation 12:3-4
> 3 Another mysterious sight appeared in the sky. There was a huge red dragon with seven heads and ten horns and a crown on each of his heads. 4 With his tail he dragged a third of the stars out of the sky and threw them down to the earth. He stood in front of the woman, in order to eat her child as soon as it was born.
22. Can you easily be destroyed when you are little or when you are an adult?
23. What are some things that can destroy you, and prevent you from growing into a mighty person?
24. How do you prevent yourself from getting destroyed?

Does a mango seed look like a mango tree?
Does the mango tree come from the mango seed?
When God wants to start something big, does he start small or does he start big?
When you find a mango seed, and you throw it away, what have you actually thrown away?
What do you do to make a seed grow?
What do you do about the weeds?
Do you know that you are a seed?
What is the reason for your answer?
Can God put a lot of potential in a person that is not immediately noticeable at their birth? Jeremiah 1:5

parts.title: II
parts.markdown:
# I Am a Little Seed II

1. Who is speaking? **Mathew 5:48**
> 48 You must be perfect—just as your Father in heaven is perfect.
2. Who is God speaking to?
3. What does God expect from every man?
4. Is it possible to become perfect?
5. Is it possible to become like God?
6. What does it mean to be perfect?
7. Are you perfect when you are not respectful?
8. Are you perfect when you are not kind?
9. If you wish to become like someone, what do you have to do?
10. How does a man become perfect like God?
11. Read **Psalm 82** twice.
> 1 God presides in the great assembly;  
he renders judgment  among the “gods”:
>
> 2 “How long will you defend the unjust and show partiality to the wicked? 
> 3 Defend the weak and the fatherless;  uphold the cause of the poor and the oppressed.   
> 4 Rescue the weak and the needy;   deliver them from the hand of the wicked.
> 
> 5 “The ‘gods’ know nothing, they understand nothing. They walk about in darkness;   all the foundations of the earth are shaken.
> 
> 6 “I said, ‘You are “gods”;   you are all sons of the Most High.’   
> 7 But you will die  like mere mortals;   you will fall like every other ruler.”
> 
> 8 Rise up,  O God, judge the earth,   for all the nations are your inheritance.
12. What is judgment?
13. Which people have gathered?
14. Who is leading the gathering?
15. In verse 2, what are the gods doing wrong?
16. What does God expect from the gods in verse 3?
17. What does God expect from the gods in verse 4?
18. Who is the Most High in verse 6?
19. Why does God have to remind the gods that "I said, ‘You are “gods”; you are all sons of the Most High?"
20. Read  **John 10:30-36**.
> 30 I and the Father are one.”
> 
> 31 Again his Jewish opponents picked up stones to stone him,  32 but Jesus said to them,  “I have shown you many good works from the Father. For which of these do you stone me?”
> 
> 33 “We are not stoning you for any good work,” they replied, “but for blasphemy, because you, a mere man, claim to be God.”
> 
> 34 Jesus answered them,  “Is it not written in your Law,  ‘I have said you are “gods”’?  35 If he called them ‘gods,’ to whom the word of God came—and Scripture cannot be set aside—  36 what about the one whom the Father set apart as his very own and sent into the world?  Why then do you accuse me of blasphemy because I said, ‘I am God’s Son’?
21. In verse 33, why did the Jews try to stone Jesus?
22. What is blasphemy?
23. In verse 34, which part of the bible was Jesus referring to?
24. In verse 35, who are the gods?
25. Read  Psalm 82 again
26. In verse 5, Why does God say that "The ‘gods’ know nothing, they understand nothing...?"
27. Do the gods know that they are gods?
28. Do the gods know that they are all sons of the Most High, and can become like God?
29. What happens to you when you walk in a place without light?
30. When do we say that a person is living in darkness?
31. In verse 5, why does God say that the gods walk about in darkness?
32. Is the earth a school?
33. What is the purpose of a school?
34. What are the gods supposed to learn before they leave the earth?
35. When a person walks into a school and comes out worse than they entered it, is the school serving its purpose?
36. When all the people who walk into a school, come out worse than they entered it, and bad has now become good, is the school serving its purpose?
37. Why does God say that the earth has gone out of course?
38. Even though men are children of the Most High, what will happen to them if they do not conduct themselves like sons of God?
39. Did the Jews understand Psalm 82 at the time of Jesus?
40. Do the people around you know and understand Psalm 82?
41. What are you going to do about it?
42. Read **Numbers 18:20**.
>  20 The Lord said to Aaron, “You will have no inheritance in their land, nor will you have any share among them; I am your share and your inheritance among the Israelites.
43. *The children of Israel had settled down and divided the lands among themselves. Aaron asks God what his share will be and God tells him that He, God, will be his share and inheritance.*
44. How does God become your share and your portion?
45. When you become like God, can you also do the things that God can do?
46. Do you want God or the things that God has created?
47. How do you inherit someone?
48. How do you inherit God, who will not die?
49. Who received the greatest gift among the children of Israel?

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# In a Nutshell
Christ in a Nutshell

To really get who Christ is, you need to understand the Trinity. John explains it best in John 1.

In the Old Testament, people only knew about God, but it turns out there are multiple spirit personalities that are also God. Christ is one of them, and He’s actually the creator of the world and everything in it.

God doesn't exist; He is, and He brings everything into existence. Christ has always existed, even before He came to earth. This confused a lot of people who thought they knew all about His birth and family. John 8:48-59.

Christ didn’t want people to recognize Him just by His words but wanted them to figure it out through His actions and understanding of the scriptures.

Christ had the power to forgive sins and had been doing so long before His crucifixion. Luke 5:24.

The whole idea of atonement tries to make sense of His brutal death on the cross. Even so, He told the Jews not to weep for Him as He was about to be crucified because He knew that what would happen to them after His death and resurrection would be worse than dying on the cross. Luke 23:27-28.

Before His death, Christ said many things that were hard for people to accept. John 11:20-26. He didn’t just have the power to bring people back to life; He is the resurrection. This means that if you become like Christ by following Him through the Holy Spirit, you’ll be like a balloon that won’t sink in water. Even if you get pushed down, you’ll rise again. You’ll never really die; if you’re killed, you’ll come back to life.

Many people thought Christ was possessed, called Him a Samaritan, a madman, and didn’t take Him seriously. He knew that for people to believe, He had to show them a sign. Matthew 12:38-42.

When it was time for Him to be crucified, His enemies, including the devil, thought they could humiliate Him. But they didn’t know that the Father planned to use this to glorify the Son and spread His message. Stay with me here.

If Christ hadn’t died publicly, His resurrection wouldn’t have meant much to anyone. His public humiliation, death on the cross, burial, and resurrection on the third day made it clear to everyone that Christ, the carpenter’s son, was telling the truth. This shook the devil and convinced people who were unsure about His teachings. This is what made Christ's message spread and take root in people’s hearts to the point where they were willing to die for it. Even His disciples didn’t believe it at first and needed proof, like seeing the marks on His palms.

Christ is the key to the Father’s house. He is the way, the truth, and the life. Become like Christ, and you will live. Through Him, more people can become like Christ, and then they can ascend. The Holy Spirit is here to help with that. You can’t live a Christian life without the Holy Spirit. To be like Christ is to have Christ. I can’t stress this enough. Believing in the Son of God means acting on His every word, not just saying you believe. That’s how you become.

The path is narrow because many people try to find their own way into God’s kingdom without changing themselves.

Matthew 5:48. The only way to become like God is to imitate Him. There’s no other way. Christ is our role model and standard. After taking on human nature, He can now help humans overcome their limitations and reach the Father’s mark of perfection.

parts.title: II
parts.markdown:
# In a Nutshell II
Eternal Life in a Nutshell

Matthew 5:48
> 48 You must be perfect—just as your Father in heaven is perfect.

- To be perfect is to be like God
- God expects all his children to become perfect, so perfection is possible
- Humans cannot make you perfect
- Your Pastor cannot make you perfect
- Your Evangelist, Prophet, Teachers, Apostle, Parents, Angels, etc do not have what it takes to make perfect
- Following the laws only makes you human, not perfect
- They are to bring you to the point where you are *human* and help you establish a *living* fellowship with the Father
- To be perfect, man has to walk with God
- It is personal, not social
- Only God can make a man perfect, and that is why God has placed his Spirit in you, it is by taking steps with God directly, that one obtains Eternal Life
- Eternal life is God's way of life

John 17:3
> 3 Now this is eternal life: that they know you, the only true God, and Jesus Christ, whom you have sent.

Matthew 19:16-22

> 16 Now behold, one came and said to Him, “Good Teacher, what good thing shall I do that I may have eternal life?”
>
> 17 So He said to him, “Why do you call Me good? No one _is_ good but One, _that is,_ God. But if you want to enter into life, keep the commandments.”
>
> 18 He said to Him, “Which ones?”
>
> Jesus said, “‘You shall not murder,’ ‘You shall not commit adultery,’ ‘You shall not steal,’ ‘You shall not bear false witness,’ 19 ‘Honor your father and _your_ mother,’ and, ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself.’ ”
>
> 20 The young man said to Him, “All these things I have kept from my youth. What do I still lack?”
>
> 21 Jesus said to him, “If you want to be perfect, go, sell what you have and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven; and come, follow Me.”
>
> 22 But when the young man heard that saying, he went away sorrowful, for he had great possessions.

The rich young ruler must follow three steps:
- Follow all the commandments
- Give all that he has to the poor
- Follow Christ (for it is by following and imitating God that a man becomes like God)

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Judgement
God's Judgement

1. What is judgment?
2. When you receive the reward for your actions, have you been judged?
3. What is Evil?
4. When you do the wrong thing without knowing that it is wrong, have you committed Evil?
5. What is God's judgement for Evil?
6. How does God's judgment for Evil affect your heart tree and mind tree?
7. Did the boy intend to kill the butterfly?
> A young boy notices some butterflies fluttering around and thinks they are really beautiful. He wants to keep one for himself so he can admire its beauty all the time, so he catches one and puts it in a clear jar. However, it doesn't take long before the butterfly stops moving and dies.
8. Did you intend to ruin your mother's soup?
> Your mom is cooking up some soup and asks you to grab the salt. Both the salt and sugar are in similar jars, and you accidentally hand her the sugar instead. Without noticing, she adds it to the soup and ends up ruining it. Now she has to toss the whole thing out. Oops!
9. Give examples of Evil.
10. What is Sin?
11. When you do the wrong thing knowing very well that it is wrong, have you committed Sin? James 4:17, John 15:22
> 17 So then, if we do not do the good we know we should do, we are guilty of sin.
> 
> John 15:22
> If I had not come and spoken to them, they would not be guilty of sin; but now they have no excuse for their sin.
12. What is God's judgement for Sin? Ezekiel 18:20-21
>20 The one who sins is the one who will die.  The child will not share the guilt of the parent, nor will the parent share the guilt of the child. The righteousness of the righteous will be credited to them, and the wickedness of the wicked will be charged against them.
>
>21 “But if  a wicked person turns away from all the sins they have committed and keeps all my decrees  and does what is just and right, that person will surely live; they will not die.
13. How does God's judgment for Sin affect your heart tree and mind tree?
14. When your mother labels the salt and sugar jars with their names and you still go ahead to return the sugar jar instead of the salt jar, have you sinned?
15. Give examples of Sin.
16. What is the difference between Sin and Evil?
17. Can something Evil for one person, become a Sin for another? 
18. What is the reason for your answer, and give examples?
19. What is Iniquity?
20. When you sin, and continue to do it even after other people have prompted you, are you committing Iniquity?
21. What is God's judgement for Iniquity?
22. How does God's judgment for Iniquity affect your heart and mind trees?
23. What was God's response to the sins of the people of Nineveh? Jonah 1:1
> The word of the  Lord  came to Jonah  son of Amittai:  2 “Go to the great city of Nineveh  and preach against it, because its wickedness has come up before me.”
24. When Jonah preached to them did they repent? Jonah 3:4-6
> 4 Jonah began by going a day’s journey into the city, proclaiming,  “Forty more days and Nineveh will be overthrown.”  5 The Ninevites believed God. A fast was proclaimed, and all of them, from the greatest to the least, put on sackcloth.
>
>6 When Jonah’s warning reached the king of Nineveh, he rose from his throne, took off his royal robes, covered himself with sackcloth and sat down in the dust.
25. If the city of Nineveh had not repented, would they be committing Sin or Iniquity?
26. What was God's response to David's sin, after he had taken another man's wife and killed her husband? 2 Samuel 12:1-4
> 12 The Lord sent Nathan to David.  When he came to him,  he said, “There were two men in a certain town, one rich and the other poor.  2 The rich man had a very large number of sheep and cattle,  3 but the poor man had nothing except one little ewe lamb he had bought. He raised it, and it grew up with him and his children. It shared his food, drank from his cup and even slept in his arms. It was like a daughter to him.
>
>4 “Now a traveler came to the rich man, but the rich man refrained from taking one of his own sheep or cattle to prepare a meal for the traveler who had come to him. Instead, he took the ewe lamb that belonged to the poor man and prepared it for the one who had come to him.”
27. Did David repent or continue in his sin? 2 Samuel 12:13
> 13 Then David said to Nathan, “I have sinned  against the  Lord.”
>
>Nathan replied, “The  Lord has taken away your sin.  You are not going to die.
28. If David had not repented, would he be committing Sin or Iniquity?
29. Give examples of Iniquity.
30. What is the difference between Sin and Iniquity?
31. What is Righteousness, *right*-ness, *right*-doing?
32. Is righteousness doing things the right way?
33. Is righteousness doing things according to the will of God?
34. Is righteousness doing things, God's way?
35. What is God's judgement for Righteousness?
36. Give examples of Righteousness
37. What is the right way to sweep your house?
38. What is the right way to produce children?
39. What is the right way to respond to a person who has offended you?
40. Who is a Righteous Man?
41. How do you seek God's Righteousness daily? Matthew 6:33, Luke 11:1
>Matthew 6:33
>But seek first his kingdom and his righteousness, and all these things will be given to you as well.
>
>Luke 11:1
>One day Jesus was praying in a certain place. When he finished, one of his disciples said to him, “Lord, teach us to pray, just as John taught his disciples.”
42. Does the Kingdom of God have its right way of doing things? Matthew 6:5-7
>5 “And when you pray, do not be like the hypocrites, for they love to pray standing  in the synagogues and on the street corners to be seen by others. Truly I tell you, they have received their reward in full.  6 But when you pray, go into your room, close the door and pray to your Father,  who is unseen. Then your Father, who sees what is done in secret, will reward you.  7 And when you pray, do not keep on babbling  like pagans, for they think they will be heard because of their many words.
43. When you surrender your heart to God each day, is God able to reveal his righteousness to you in order to do it?
44. Can we seek God's righteousness on specific matters when we pray?
45. Is Righteousness the same as repentance?
46. What is the difference between Righteousness and repentance?
47. Is Righteousness something that you do or something that you do not do?
48. Is repentance something that you do or something that you do not do?
49. What is the cure for Evil?
50. In what ways did Christ fight and uproot Evil?
51. What is the cure for Sin?
52. Does Christ ask you to pray for your enemies because they need prayers, or because you cannot pray for a person and hate them at the same time, and one will have to displace the other? Matthew 5:43-44
> 43 “You have heard that it was said, ‘Love your neighbor and hate your enemy.’  44 But I tell you, love your enemies and pray for those who persecute you,
53. Does praying for your enemies, change the posture of your heart towards them, and make it easy for you to minister love to them?
54. Do you practice righteousness when you ignore your enemies, or do you practice righteousness when you pray for them?
55. Why does the righteousness of God require that to become the greatest, you must first be the least? Matthew 23:11
>The greatest among you must be a servant.
56. Is Righteousness God's food for his children?
57. What is the reason for your answer?
58. What did Jesus mean by our daily bread, and how do we eat it? Matthew 6:11
 >Give us today our daily bread.
59. Do you eat your spiritual food daily, weekly, or monthly?
60. What is Jesus' special food, and how does he eat it? John 4:30-32
>30 They came out of the town and made their way toward him.
>31 Meanwhile his disciples urged him, “Rabbi,  eat something.”
>32 But he said to them,  “I have food to eat  that you know nothing about.”
61. Why does Jesus ask God to forgive them? Luke 23:34
> Jesus said, “Father, forgive them, for they do not know what they are doing.
62. Did they commit Sin or Evil?
63. When Adam and Eve ate from the forbidden tree, did they commit Sin or Evil?
64. What is the reason for your answer?
65. What is the story? Genesis 4:3-7
> 3 In the course of time Cain brought some of the fruits of the soil as an offering to the  Lord.  4 And Abel also brought an offering—fat portions from some of the firstborn of his flock.  The  Lord looked with favor on Abel and his offering,  5 but on Cain and his offering he did not look with favor. So Cain was very angry, and his face was downcast.
> 
> 6 Then the  Lord said to Cain, “Why are you angry?  Why is your face downcast?  7 If you do what is right, will you not be accepted? But if you do not do what is right, sin is crouching at your door;  it desires to have you, but you must rule over it.”
66. In verse 7, where is Sin?
67. What is the posture of Sin?
68. Are you born with Sin?
69. Do you choose to Sin?
70. What will Sin do to you when you let it in through the door?

> 4 Jonah began by going a day’s journey into the city, proclaiming,  “Forty more days and Nineveh will be overthrown.”  5 The Ninevites believed God. A fast was proclaimed, and all of them, from the greatest to the least, put on sackcloth.
>
>6 When Jonah’s warning reached the king of Nineveh, he rose from his throne, took off his royal robes, covered himself with sackcloth and sat down in the dust.

sections.question: If the city of Nineveh had not repented, would they be committing Sin or Iniquity?
What was God's response to David's sin, after he had taken another man's wife and killed her husband? 2 Samuel 12:1-4
sections.body:
> 12 The Lord sent Nathan to David.  When he came to him,  he said, “There were two men in a certain town, one rich and the other poor.  2 The rich man had a very large number of sheep and cattle,  3 but the poor man had nothing except one little ewe lamb he had bought. He raised it, and it grew up with him and his children. It shared his food, drank from his cup and even slept in his arms. It was like a daughter to him.
>
>4 “Now a traveler came to the rich man, but the rich man refrained from taking one of his own sheep or cattle to prepare a meal for the traveler who had come to him. Instead, he took the ewe lamb that belonged to the poor man and prepared it for the one who had come to him.”

sections.question: Did David repent or continue in his sin? 2 Samuel 12:13
sections.body:
> 13 Then David said to Nathan, “I have sinned  against the  Lord.”
>
>Nathan replied, “The  Lord has taken away your sin.  You are not going to die.

sections.question: If David had not repented, would he be committing Sin or Iniquity?
Give examples of Iniquity.
What is the difference between Sin and Iniquity?
What is Righteousness, *right*-ness, *right*-doing?
Is righteousness doing things the right way?
Is righteousness doing things according to the will of God?
Is righteousness doing things, God's way?
What is God's judgement for Righteousness?
Give examples of Righteousness
What is the right way to sweep your house?
What is the right way to produce children?
What is the right way to respond to a person who has offended you?
Who is a Righteous Man?
How do you seek God's Righteousness daily? Matthew 6:33, Luke 11:1
sections.body:
>Matthew 6:33
>But seek first his kingdom and his righteousness, and all these things will be given to you as well.
>
>Luke 11:1
>One day Jesus was praying in a certain place. When he finished, one of his disciples said to him, “Lord, teach us to pray, just as John taught his disciples.”

sections.question: Does the Kingdom of God have its right way of doing things? Matthew 6:5-7
sections.body: >5 “And when you pray, do not be like the hypocrites, for they love to pray standing  in the synagogues and on the street corners to be seen by others. Truly I tell you, they have received their reward in full.  6 But when you pray, go into your room, close the door and pray to your Father,  who is unseen. Then your Father, who sees what is done in secret, will reward you.  7 And when you pray, do not keep on babbling  like pagans, for they think they will be heard because of their many words.

sections.question: When you surrender your heart to God each day, is God able to reveal his righteousness to you in order to do it?
Can we seek God's righteousness on specific matters when we pray?
Is Righteousness the same as repentance?
What is the difference between Righteousness and repentance?
Is Righteousness something that you do or something that you do not do?
Is repentance something that you do or something that you do not do?
What is the cure for Evil?
In what ways did Christ fight and uproot Evil?
What is the cure for Sin?

Does Christ ask you to pray for your enemies because they need prayers, or because you cannot pray for a person and hate them at the same time, and one will have to displace the other? Matthew 5:43-44
sections.body: > 43 “You have heard that it was said, ‘Love your neighbor and hate your enemy.’  44 But I tell you, love your enemies and pray for those who persecute you,

sections.question: Does praying for your enemies, change the posture of your heart towards them, and make it easy for you to minister love to them?
Do you practice righteousness when you ignore your enemies, or do you practice righteousness when you pray for them?
Why does the righteousness of God require that to become the greatest, you must first be the least? Matthew 23:11
sections.body: >The greatest among you must be a servant.

sections.question: Is Righteousness God's food for his children?
What is the reason for your answer?
What did Jesus mean by our daily bread, and how do we eat it? Matthew 6:11
sections.body: >Give us today our daily bread.

sections.question: Do you eat your spiritual food daily, weekly, or monthly?
What is Jesus' special food, and how does he eat it? John 4:30-32
sections.body:
>30 They came out of the town and made their way toward him.
>31 Meanwhile his disciples urged him, “Rabbi,  eat something.”
>32 But he said to them,  “I have food to eat  that you know nothing about.”

sections.question: Why does Jesus ask God to forgive them? Luke 23:34
sections.body: > Jesus said, “Father, forgive them, for they do not know what they are doing.

sections.question: Did they commit Sin or Evil?
When Adam and Eve ate from the forbidden tree, did they commit Sin or Evil?
What is the reason for your answer?
What is the story? Genesis 4:3-7
sections.body:
> 3 In the course of time Cain brought some of the fruits of the soil as an offering to the  Lord.  4 And Abel also brought an offering—fat portions from some of the firstborn of his flock.  The  Lord looked with favor on Abel and his offering,  5 but on Cain and his offering he did not look with favor. So Cain was very angry, and his face was downcast.
> 
> 6 Then the  Lord said to Cain, “Why are you angry?  Why is your face downcast?  7 If you do what is right, will you not be accepted? But if you do not do what is right, sin is crouching at your door;  it desires to have you, but you must rule over it.”

sections.question: In verse 7, where is Sin?
What is the posture of Sin?
Are you born with Sin?
Do you choose to Sin?
What will Sin do to you when you let it in through the door?

parts.title: II
parts.markdown:
# Judgement II
Man's Judgement

1. What is judgment?
2. What is evil?
3. What is the cure for evil?
4. What is sin?
5. What is the cure for sin?
6. Where does God's judgment take place?
7. How does God's judgment for Evil, Sin, Iniquity, and Righteousness, affect the leaves in the **mind tree** and the **heart tree**?
8. Has the sinner already paid for their sin?
9. Has the righteous already received the reward of their righteousness? Matthew 19:21
>Jesus answered, “If you want to be perfect, go, sell your possessions and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come, follow me.”
10. When a person sins or commits evil and God has already judged them, is there a need for other humans to also judge them again, or rather, cure them?
11. When a person starts sinning, does God punish them immediately, or warn them first? 
12. Should humans also attempt to guide other humans to repentance? Ezekiel 3:18
> When I say to a wicked person, ‘You will surely die,’ and you do not warn them or speak out to dissuade them from their evil ways in order to save their life, that wicked person will die for their sin, and I will hold you accountable for their blood.
13. When a person does something wrong and is later found to have committed evil, what does God expect other humans to do? 
14. When a person does something wrong and is later found to have sinned, what does God expect other humans to do?
15. Would the person commit evil had they been taught?
16. How can you cure a person of evil?
17. Would the person sin had they practiced God's righteousness until it had become part of them?
18. How can you cure a person of sin?
19. Name some sins and their righteous opposites.
20. When a person *knowingly* destroys other people's things, do they commit sin or evil?
21. What can you do to cure such a person?
22. When a person steals, do they commit sin or evil?
23. What can you do to cure such a person?
24. When a person wishes to stop insulting but ends up insulting other people anyway, do they commit sin or evil?
25. What can you do to cure such a person?
26. Did the man commit sin or evil?
> A man sets a trap for an animal in the forest and ends up trapping the leg of an old woman who is almost blind. The old woman eventually dies. 
27. What can you do to cure such a person?
28. When the man goes to set a trap there again knowing very well that other humans might be passing there, and he traps the leg of a human, did he commit sin or evil?
29. What can you do to cure such a person?
30. Did you commit sin or evil?
> Your friend informs you that her mother beats her in the house every day. You go to her house to talk to the mother with the hope that her mother might stop beating her. Her mother rather gets angry and starts beating her even more. 
31. What might be a possible cure to prevent you from making the same mistake again?
32. Did the man commit sin or evil?
> A man wants to build a house. He first has to clear the land so he cuts down a few trees that are growing on the land. After building the house he falls sick and prays to God. God tells him that the medicine that will cure his sickness can only be found in the tree that he had cut whiles building his house. 
33. What can be done to cure him so he does not make the same mistake again?
34. Give other examples of evil, sin, and iniquity, and how they can be cured.

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Know Your Foe

1. **Important**: There are spiritual forces at work, determined to keep people in darkness. These powers will try to distract you, discourage you, or convince you that these lessons are not meant for you. Resist the urge to dismiss them—stay focused and remain open, even if they don’t seem to apply to you right now. Ephesians 6:12
> For we do not wrestle against flesh and blood, but against the rulers, against the authorities, against the cosmic powers over this present darkness, against the spiritual forces of evil in the heavenly places.
2. Pray vocally:
> Heavenly Father,  
I come before You in the mighty name of Jesus Christ, the Light of the world. Lord, I confess that at times I have walked in darkness, confusion, or ignorance of Your truth. I repent of every sin, disobedience, and compromise that has given the enemy access to cloud my vision.
>
>Father, Your Word says that the god of this world blinds the minds of unbelievers so they cannot see the light of the gospel (2 Corinthians 4:4). Today, I renounce every veil of darkness, deception, doubt, and spiritual blindness in my life. Let every scale fall from my eyes as You opened the eyes of Saul on the Damascus road.
>
>Lord Jesus,
Shine Your light into every hidden corner of my soul. Expose lies I have believed, destroy false mindsets, and release the Spirit of truth into my heart. I declare that I will no longer stumble in darkness but will walk in the light as You are in the light.
>
>Holy Spirit,
Anoint my eyes with spiritual sight. Give me discernment to recognize what is from You and what is not. Teach me to see myself, others, and every situation through the lens of Your Word.
>
>From today, I break free from confusion, deception, and spiritual blindness. I receive clarity, wisdom, and revelation in the name of Jesus. My steps are ordered by the Lord, and I will walk in His light all the days of my life.
>
>Thank You, Father, for opening my eyes.
In Jesus’ name, Amen.
3. What do you observe? Matthew 12:22-29
> 22 Then they brought him a demon-possessed man who was blind and mute, and Jesus healed him, so that he could both talk and see.  23 All the people were astonished and said, “Could this be the Son of David?”
> 
> 24 But when the Pharisees heard this, they said, “It is only by Beelzebul,  the prince of demons, that this fellow drives out demons.”
> 
> 25 Jesus knew their thoughts and said to them,  “Every kingdom divided against itself will be ruined, and every city or household divided against itself will not stand.  26 If Satan drives out Satan, he is divided against himself. How then can his kingdom stand?  27 And if I drive out demons by Beelzebul,  by whom do your people drive them out? So then, they will be your judges.  28 But if it is by the Spirit of God that I drive out demons, then the kingdom of God has come upon you.
> 
> 29 “Or again, how can anyone enter a strong man’s house and carry off his possessions unless he first ties up the strong man? Then he can plunder his house.
4. In verse 22, what was the man suffering from because he had demons living in him?
5. Can demons make a man blind and mute?
6. What happened to the man after the demons had left him?
7. In verse 24, who do the Pharisees claim to be possessed by Beelzebul?
8. Who is Beelzebul?
9. Does Satan have a kingdom?
10. Is Beelzebul in Satan's kingdom?
11. Is Satan's kingdom organized, or divided against itself?
12. Does Jesus drive out demons because he is possessed by the prince of demons?
13. In verse 28, by what means does Jesus drive out demons?
14. Who brought about the driving out of demons? Matthew 9:32-33
> 32 While they were going out, a man who was demon-possessed  and could not talk  was brought to Jesus.  33 And when the demon was driven out, the man who had been mute spoke. The crowd was amazed and said, “Nothing like this has ever been seen in Israel.”
15. Who exposed Satan's kingdom, which had been hidden from men because it was invisible?
16. In verse 29, who is the strongman?
17. What is the strongman's house?
18. Why does Jesus drive out demons?
19. Who held the woman bound? Luke 13:10-16
> 10 On a Sabbath Jesus was teaching in one of the synagogues,  11 and a woman was there who had been crippled by a spirit for eighteen years. She was bent over and could not straighten up at all.  12 When Jesus saw her, he called her forward and said to her,  “Woman, you are set free from your infirmity.”  13 Then he put his hands on her,  and immediately she straightened up and praised God.
> 
> 14 Indignant because Jesus had healed on the Sabbath,  the synagogue leader said to the people, “There are six days for work.  So come and be healed on those days, not on the Sabbath.”
> 
> 15 The Lord answered him,  “You hypocrites! Doesn’t each of you on the Sabbath untie your ox or donkey from the stall and lead it out to give it water?  16 Then should not this woman, a daughter of Abraham,  whom Satan  has kept bound for eighteen long years, be set free on the Sabbath day from what bound her?”
20. Can demons cripple your spine and give you back problems?
21. Can you do the will of God when you have demons?
22. Can you serve God well when you have demons?
23. Can you successfully teach the word of God to other people when they have demons?
24. Why did Christ drive out demons everywhere he went? Mark 1:34, Mark 1:39
>Mark 1:34
And He healed many who were ill with various diseases, and cast out many demons; and He was not permitting the demons to speak, because they knew who He was.
>
> Mark 1:39
So he traveled throughout Galilee, preaching in their synagogues and driving out demons.
25. Who is your foe? 
26. How many kingdoms exist in this world?
27. Can you belong in both kingdoms at the same time?
28. Do both kingdoms have the same culture?
29. Describe dressing in both kingdoms.
30. Describe marriage in both kingdoms.
31. Describe sex in both kingdoms.
32. Describe music in both kingdoms.
33. Which animal best describes the Kingdom of Darkness?
34. Which animal best describes the Kingdom of Light?
35. Which kingdom do you belong to?
36. What is the reason for your answer?
37. Write down 5 ways the Kingdom of Light differs from the Kingdom of Darkness.
38. Can demons come in even if you are a believer? Mark 1:39
> So he traveled throughout Galilee, preaching in their synagogues and driving out demons.
39. In what ways do demons come in? John 5:14
> 14 Afterward, Jesus found him in the Temple and said, “Listen, you are well now; so stop sinning or something worse may happen to you.”
40. Can demons come in because of sin?
41. Confess every known sin to God. Proverbs 28:13
> 13 You will never succeed in life if you try to hide your sins. Confess them and give them up; then God will show mercy to you.
42. Can demons come in because of your involvement in the occult?
43. Pray, renouncing every involvement in the occult, and get rid of every item connected to it.
44. Pray with faith:
> Heavenly Father,  
I come to You in the name of Jesus Christ, Your only Son, my Lord and Savior. I acknowledge that You alone are the true and living God. I humbly confess that I or my ancestors have participated in practices that are an abomination to You—whether knowingly or unknowingly—including witchcraft, the occult, divination, spiritism, and other forbidden spiritual activities.
>
>Father, I repent for every act of rebellion, curiosity, or ignorance that led me away from Your truth and into darkness. I renounce every form of the occult—sorcery, casting spells, consulting mediums, tarot, astrology, horoscopes, numerology, Ouija boards, fortune-telling, ancestral worship, and all counterfeit spiritual practices.
>
>In the name of Jesus, I cancel every curse, spell, ritual, blood covenant, dedication, or spiritual agreement made through these practices. I renounce Satan and every demonic influence in my life. I break all soul ties and generational links to the occult, and I sever every chain that binds me to darkness.
>
>By the authority of Jesus Christ and the power of His blood, I command every unclean spirit associated with the occult or witchcraft to leave me now and never return. I close every door that was opened to the enemy, and I seal it by the blood of Jesus.
>
>Holy Spirit, come and fill every area of my life—my heart, my mind, and my spirit. Cleanse me with Your fire. Restore what the enemy tried to steal. Replace every lie with Your truth, and give me a hunger for Your Word and Your presence.
>
>I declare that I am a child of God. I belong to Jesus Christ alone. He is my Lord, my Redeemer, and my Deliverer. I commit my life fully to Him and to walk in His light all the days of my life.
>
>Thank You, Father, for Your mercy, Your grace, and the power of deliverance through Jesus Christ.
>
>In Jesus’ mighty name I pray,  
>Amen.
45. Can demons come in because of unforgiveness?
46. When you do not forgive others, are you holding them prisoners?
47. When you do not release your prisoners because of unforgiveness, will God also forgive and release you from your prison?
48. Can demons come in because of a trauma you experienced while you were a child?
49. Forgive everyone who has offended you or caused you some form of trauma.
50. Vocally say this prayer:
>"Lord Jesus,
Your Word declares in Romans 10:13 that _‘Whosoever shall call upon the name of the Lord shall be saved.’_  
Today, I call upon Your name—Jesus, my Savior, my Redeemer, my Deliverer.  
I ask You to deliver me from every bondage, every torment, every trap of the enemy.  
Rescue me from the darkness and bring me into Your marvelous light.
>
>I renounce every tie, agreement, or influence that does not come from You.  
I break every chain in the mighty name of Jesus.  
Let every demonic power be rendered powerless, and every curse be reversed.
>
>Jesus, I surrender fully to You.  
Save me. Deliver me. Heal me.  
Fill me with Your Holy Spirit and surround me with Your presence.  
I receive Your salvation and freedom, for I have called upon Your name.
>
>In Jesus’ name,  
Amen."
51. Vocally say this prayer:
>"Heavenly Father,
In the name of Jesus Christ, I come before You with a repentant and open heart.  
Your Word says in Mark 16:18 that _‘if they drink any deadly thing, it shall not hurt them.’_  
I stand on that promise and declare that every spiritual food or drink I have consumed in any dream—knowingly or unknowingly—is now flushed out by the blood of Jesus.
>
>I reject and renounce every satanic covenant or initiation associated with that food.  
I command every evil deposit in my body, soul, or spirit to be uprooted and destroyed by fire, in Jesus’ name.  
Let the blood of Jesus flow through every part of my body and purge me completely.
>
>Every poison, delay, sickness, curse, or manipulation introduced through that food—I nullify you now by the power in the name of Jesus.
>
>Thank You, Lord, for restoring me to wholeness and divine health.  
I walk in freedom and victory.
>
>In Jesus’ name I pray, Amen."
