sections.question: In what ways do demons come in? John 5:14
sections.body: > 14 Afterward, Jesus found him in the Temple and said, “Listen, you are well now; so stop sinning or something worse may happen to you.”

sections.question: Can demons come in because of sin?
Confess every known sin to God. Proverbs 28:13
sections.body: > 13 You will never succeed in life if you try to hide your sins. Confess them and give them up; then God will show mercy to you.

sections.question: Can demons come in because of your involvement in the occult?
Pray, renouncing every involvement in the occult, and get rid of every item connected to it.
Pray with faith:
sections.body:
> Heavenly Father,  
I come to You in the name of Jesus Christ, Your only Son, my Lord and Savior. I acknowledge that You alone are the true and living God. I humbly confess that I or my ancestors have participated in practices that are an abomination to You—whether knowingly or unknowingly—including witchcraft, the occult, divination, spiritism, and other forbidden spiritual activities.
>
>Father, I repent for every act of rebellion, curiosity, or ignorance that led me away from Your truth and into darkness. I renounce every form of the occult—sorcery, casting spells, consulting mediums, tarot, astrology, horoscopes, numerology, Ouija boards, fortune-telling, ancestral worship, and all counterfeit spiritual practices.
>
>In the name of Jesus, I cancel every curse, spell, ritual, blood covenant, dedication, or spiritual agreement made through these practices. I renounce Satan and every demonic influence in my life. I break all soul ties and generational links to the occult, and I sever every chain that binds me to darkness.
>
>By the authority of Jesus Christ and the power of His blood, I command every unclean spirit associated with the occult or witchcraft to leave me now and never return. I close every door that was opened to the enemy, and I seal it by the blood of Jesus.
>
>Holy Spirit, come and fill every area of my life—my heart, my mind, and my spirit. Cleanse me with Your fire. Restore what the enemy tried to steal. Replace every lie with Your truth, and give me a hunger for Your Word and Your presence.
>
>I declare that I am a child of God. I belong to Jesus Christ alone. He is my Lord, my Redeemer, and my Deliverer. I commit my life fully to Him and to walk in His light all the days of my life.
>
>Thank You, Father, for Your mercy, Your grace, and the power of deliverance through Jesus Christ.
>
>In Jesus’ mighty name I pray,  
>Amen.

sections.question: Can demons come in because of unforgiveness?
When you do not forgive others, are you holding them prisoners?
When you do not release your prisoners because of unforgiveness, will God also forgive and release you from your prison?
Can demons come in because of a trauma you experienced while you were a child?
Forgive everyone who has offended you or caused you some form of trauma.
Vocally say this prayer:
sections.body:
>"Lord Jesus,
Your Word declares in Romans 10:13 that _‘Whosoever shall call upon the name of the Lord shall be saved.’_  
Today, I call upon Your name—Jesus, my Savior, my Redeemer, my Deliverer.  
I ask You to deliver me from every bondage, every torment, every trap of the enemy.  
Rescue me from the darkness and bring me into Your marvelous light.
>
>I renounce every tie, agreement, or influence that does not come from You.  
I break every chain in the mighty name of Jesus.  
Let every demonic power be rendered powerless, and every curse be reversed.
>
>Jesus, I surrender fully to You.  
Save me. Deliver me. Heal me.  
Fill me with Your Holy Spirit and surround me with Your presence.  
I receive Your salvation and freedom, for I have called upon Your name.
>
>In Jesus’ name,  
Amen."

sections.question: Vocally say this prayer:
sections.body:
>"Heavenly Father,
In the name of Jesus Christ, I come before You with a repentant and open heart.  
Your Word says in Mark 16:18 that _‘if they drink any deadly thing, it shall not hurt them.’_  
I stand on that promise and declare that every spiritual food or drink I have consumed in any dream—knowingly or unknowingly—is now flushed out by the blood of Jesus.
>
>I reject and renounce every satanic covenant or initiation associated with that food.  
I command every evil deposit in my body, soul, or spirit to be uprooted and destroyed by fire, in Jesus’ name.  
Let the blood of Jesus flow through every part of my body and purge me completely.
>
>Every poison, delay, sickness, curse, or manipulation introduced through that food—I nullify you now by the power in the name of Jesus.
>
>Thank You, Lord, for restoring me to wholeness and divine health.  
I walk in freedom and victory.
>
>In Jesus’ name I pray, Amen."

parts.title: II
parts.markdown:
# Know Your Foe II

1. What do you observe? Luke 11:14
> Jesus was driving out a demon that was mute. When the demon left, the man who had been mute spoke, and the crowd was amazed.
2. Was the demon mute?
3. Was the man also mute?
4. When the demon left the man, could he speak?
5. What caused the man to be mute?
6. What caused the woman to be bent over? Luke 13:10-13
>10 On a Sabbath Jesus was teaching in one of the synagogues,  11 and a woman was there who had been crippled by a spirit for eighteen years.  She was bent over and could not straighten up at all.  12 When Jesus saw her, he called her forward and said to her,  “Woman, you are set free from your infirmity.”  13 Then he put his hands on her,  and immediately she straightened up and praised God.
7. What happened to the woman when the demon was sacked?
8. How long did it take for the woman to straighten up?
9. Can a demon make you physically sick?
10. What are some sicknesses that demons can cause?
11. Can demons cause boils, headaches, epilepsy, skin diseases, etc? Mark 9:17-22
> 17 A man in the crowd answered, “Teacher, I brought you my son, who is possessed by a spirit that has robbed him of speech.  18 Whenever it seizes him, it throws him to the ground. He foams at the mouth, gnashes his teeth and becomes rigid. I asked your disciples to drive out the spirit, but they could not.”
>
>19 “You unbelieving generation,”  Jesus replied,  “how long shall I stay with you? How long shall I put up with you? Bring the boy to me.”
>
>20 So they brought him. When the spirit saw Jesus, it immediately threw the boy into a convulsion. He fell to the ground and rolled around, foaming at the mouth.
>
>21 Jesus asked the boy’s father,  “How long has he been like this?”
>
>“From childhood,” he answered.  22 “It has often thrown him into fire or water to kill him. But if you can do anything, take pity on us and help us.”
12. Can a person have demons from childhood?
13. Can a sickness caused by a demon be treated using traditional medicine? 
14. Is your foe visible or invisible?
15. How does this make it difficult for humans to deal with them?
16. When a demon is present in you, does it rule over you and make you do things that you don't want to do, or rather, allow you to rule over it?
17. Can the presence of a demon in a person cause them to develop a problem?
18. Can the presence of a demon in a person cause them to develop the same problem that the demon has?
19. Does the presence of a demon always put the individual in a bad condition? Matthew 12:43-45
> 43 “When an evil spirit goes out of a person, it travels over dry country looking for a place to rest. If it can't find one, 44 it says to itself, ‘I will go back to my house.’ So it goes back and finds the house empty, clean, and all fixed up. 45 Then it goes out and brings along seven other spirits even worse than itself, and they come and live there. So when it is all over, that person is in worse shape than at the beginning. This is what will happen to the evil people of this day.”
20. What other problems can a person develop due to the presence of a demon in them?
21. Can you control your anger when a demon of anger lives in you?
22. Can you overcome your fear when a spirit of fear lives in you?
23. Can you stop lusting when a demon of lust lives in you?
24. Can you speak good words when a vulgar spirit lives in you?
25. Can you break your addiction to smoking, alcohol, etc., when a demon is the strongman of your body?
26. Can a demon enslave you and give you addictions?
27. What are some addictions that you can have?
28. Do demons make you do things outside your control, such as uncontrollable eating, talking, drinking, etc?
29. Do demons tempt you to do evil?
30. Do demons torment you, especially with the fear of insanity, guilt, unworthiness, etc.?
31. Do demons defile you and make you feel dirty, unclean, and inject impure thoughts, bad words, and pictures into your mind?
33. Do demons harass you by following you around and using other people to attack you during your weakest moments, such as fear, anger, etc?
34. Can a demon give you bad habits?
35. What bad habits do you wish to stop but always keep returning to?
36. Do demons put you in a cycle of defeat where you are constantly rising and falling in specific areas of your life?
37. Can demons remind you about things that you have done in the past to make you feel guilty and draw you away from God, parents, teachers, etc.?
38. Are all thoughts in your head yours?
39. Should you ignore thoughts the enemy tries to plant in your head?
40. How do you deal with thoughts from the enemy?
41. Vocally say this prayer:
> Heavenly Father,  
I come before You in the name of Jesus Christ, the One who has all authority in heaven and on earth. I thank You for giving me weapons that are not of this world but mighty through God for the pulling down of strongholds.
>
>Right now, Lord, I take authority over every thought, imagination, and argument that rises up against the knowledge of who You are and who You say I am. I cast down every lie, fantasy, fear, doubt, and accusation that does not align with Your truth. I reject every thought that leads to sin, shame, confusion, or despair.
>
>In the name of Jesus, I take every thought captive to the obedience of Christ. I declare that my mind belongs to You, O God. Let the words of Christ dwell richly in me. Let my thoughts be pure, honorable, true, and aligned with Your Word.
>
>Holy Spirit, guard my mind. When the enemy tries to whisper lies or stir up anxiety, bring Your truth to my remembrance. Teach me to discern between Your voice and every counterfeit. Strengthen me to stand firm and not entertain any thought that leads me away from You.
>
>I choose to renew my mind with Your Word daily. I choose to meditate on what is good, lovely, and of good report. Fill my heart with peace, and let my mind be steadfast, trusting in You alone.
>
>I declare that I have the mind of Christ. I walk in the freedom and victory that Jesus has already won for me.
>
>In Jesus’ powerful name I pray,  
Amen.
42. Do demons have an offensive odour that humans can sometimes detect?
43. Do demons deceive you by tempting you away from the truth with trick questions to make you stumble in your walk with God?
44. Do demons make you feel restless?
45. How do you deal with a sickness, addiction, or bad habit that is caused by a demon?
46. What is the story of the demon-possessed man? Mark 5:1-20
47. Where was the man living because of the unclean spirits in him?
48. What did he do to himself because of the unclean spirits?
49. Where does he get the strength to destroy the chains that bind him?
50. In verses 6-7, can unclean spirits talk?
51. In verse 8, how did Jesus drive out the demon?
52. In verse 7, what happened to the demons when Jesus asked them to come out of the man?
53. Do unclean spirits have feelings and emotions and feel pain?
54. In verses 11-13, can unclean spirits go into animals?
55. In verse 13, how did the unclean spirits going into the pigs affect the pigs?
56. Can demons make you suicidal, depressed, etc?
57. Do demons make you feel tired even though you have done no work?
58. How far is a demon willing to go to hide their presence or prevent you from detecting their presence?
59. Can a demon send numerous distractions your way, sometimes through other people, making you always busy for the wrong reasons, just so you do not detect their presence and sack them?
60. In what ways do demons distract the humans they inhabit to avoid detection?
61. Can demons sometimes pretend to be God, giving you false dreams, visions, and even prophecies, sending you to perform religious activities, just to avoid detection?
62. What is the story? Matthew 16:21-23
> 21 From that time on Jesus began to explain to his disciples that he must go to Jerusalem  and suffer many things  at the hands of the elders, the chief priests and the teachers of the law,  and that he must be killed and on the third day be raised to life.
> 
> 22 Peter took him aside and began to rebuke him. “Never, Lord!” he said. “This shall never happen to you!”
> 
> 23 Jesus turned and said to Peter,  “Get behind me, Satan!  You are a stumbling block to me; you do not have in mind the concerns of God, but merely human concerns.”
63. What is a rebuke?
64. Who took Jesus aside to rebuke him?
65. Who did Jesus rebuke in return?
66. Who was truly talking to Jesus, Peter, or Satan?
67. Is every person who speaks to you actually the one speaking?
68. How would you know that the person speaking with you is truly the person speaking with you, or some evil spirit?
69. How can you tell if a person speaking to you is speaking by an evil spirit? 1 John 4:1-3
> 4 My dear friends, do not believe all who claim to have the Spirit, but test them to find out if the spirit they have comes from God. For many false prophets have gone out everywhere. 2 This is how you will be able to know whether it is God's Spirit: anyone who acknowledges that Jesus Christ came as a human being has the Spirit who comes from God. 3 But anyone who denies this about Jesus does not have the Spirit from God. The spirit that he has is from the Enemy of Christ; you heard that it would come, and now it is here in the world already.
70. Can you test the spirit directly?
> "Do you confess that Jesus Christ has come in the flesh?"
71. What sample prayers can you pray to know if a spirit is from God or not?
> Heavenly Father, in the name of Jesus Christ, I come before You seeking truth and discernment. You are the God of light, and in You there is no darkness. I ask for the help of the Holy Spirit to test the spirit before me.
>
>If this spirit is from You, Lord, let it confess that Jesus Christ has come in the flesh and glorifies Your name alone. If it is not from You, I ask You to expose it and drive it away from me. I stand on Your Word, which says to test every spirit, and I trust You to protect me with Your truth.
>
>Let no deception take root in my heart, and let me walk only in the path of righteousness and truth. In Jesus’ name I pray,  Amen.
72. Pray and ask God to give you the spirit of discernment to be able to tell the difference between spirits.
73. Can demons come in because of a generational spirit in your bloodline? Matthew 27:20-25
> 20 But the chief priests and the elders persuaded the crowd to ask for Barabbas and to have Jesus executed.
>
>21 “Which of the two do you want me to release to you?” asked the governor.
>
>“Barabbas,” they answered.
>
>22 “What shall I do, then, with Jesus who is called the Messiah?”  Pilate asked.
>
>They all answered, “Crucify him!”
>
>23 “Why? What crime has he committed?” asked Pilate.
>
>But they shouted all the louder, “Crucify him!”
>
>24 When Pilate saw that he was getting nowhere, but that instead an uproar  was starting, he took water and washed his hands  in front of the crowd. “I am innocent of this man’s blood,”  he said. “It is your responsibility!”
>
>25 All the people answered, “His blood is on us and on our children!”
74. Can a person be lawfully bound by demons, making the demons have access to them even though they worship God? Isaiah 49:24–26
> 24 Shall the prey be taken from the mighty, or the lawful captive delivered?
>
>25 But thus saith the  Lord, Even the captives of the mighty shall be taken away, and the prey of the terrible shall be delivered: for I will contend with him that contendeth with thee, and I will save thy children.
>
>26 And I will feed them that oppress thee with their own flesh; and they shall be drunken with their own blood, as with sweet wine: and all flesh shall know that I the  Lord  am thy Saviour and thy Redeemer, the mighty One of Jacob.
75. Is God able to free such a person despite their parents or ancestors legally granting access to evil spirits, knowingly or unknowingly?
76. Vocally say this prayer based on Isaiah 49:24–26:
> Heavenly Father,
>
>I come before You in the mighty name of Jesus Christ—my Redeemer, my Deliverer, and the Lord of Hosts. I stand upon the truth of Your Word in Isaiah 49:24–26, which declares that even the captives of the mighty shall be taken away, and the prey of the terrible shall be delivered.
>
>Lord, I acknowledge that no power in heaven, on earth, or under the earth is greater than You. You are the God who breaks chains, sets the oppressed free, and defends the cause of the afflicted.
>
>Today, I lift up every area of bondage in my life—every spiritual captivity, every stronghold, every oppression of the enemy. Whether from the hand of the mighty or the grip of the terrible, I declare that I am delivered in the name of Jesus.
>
>Father, You promised:
>
> _“I will contend with those who contend with you, and I will save your children.”_
>
>So now, O Lord, rise up and contend with every force that contends with me—every demonic influence, every generational curse, every lie of the enemy. Let Your mighty arm be revealed. Let Your vengeance be seen upon every spiritual adversary, and let them know that You, the Lord, are my Savior and my Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob.
>
>I declare and decree that the captives are being released, the oppressed are going free, and the prey of the ruthless is being rescued. I claim freedom in my mind, peace in my soul, and healing in my body.
>
>Father, let all who war against me be confounded.
Let every plan of darkness be reversed.  
Let the blood of Jesus silence every accusation and break every chain.
>
>Thank You, Lord, for Your covenant promise of deliverance. I trust in You, and I stand in victory today, knowing that You have spoken, and You will perform it.
>
>In Jesus’ mighty name, I pray. Amen.

> Heavenly Father,
>
>I come before You in the mighty name of Jesus Christ—my Redeemer, my Deliverer, and the Lord of Hosts. I stand upon the truth of Your Word in Isaiah 49:24–26, which declares that even the captives of the mighty shall be taken away, and the prey of the terrible shall be delivered.
>
>Lord, I acknowledge that no power in heaven, on earth, or under the earth is greater than You. You are the God who breaks chains, sets the oppressed free, and defends the cause of the afflicted.
>
>Today, I lift up every area of bondage in my life—every spiritual captivity, every stronghold, every oppression of the enemy. Whether from the hand of the mighty or the grip of the terrible, I declare that I am delivered in the name of Jesus.
>
>Father, You promised:
>
> _“I will contend with those who contend with you, and I will save your children.”_
>
>So now, O Lord, rise up and contend with every force that contends with me—every demonic influence, every generational curse, every lie of the enemy. Let Your mighty arm be revealed. Let Your vengeance be seen upon every spiritual adversary, and let them know that You, the Lord, are my Savior and my Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob.
>
>I declare and decree that the captives are being released, the oppressed are going free, and the prey of the ruthless is being rescued. I claim freedom in my mind, peace in my soul, and healing in my body.
>
>Father, let all who war against me be confounded.
Let every plan of darkness be reversed.  
Let the blood of Jesus silence every accusation and break every chain.
>
>Thank You, Lord, for Your covenant promise of deliverance. I trust in You, and I stand in victory today, knowing that You have spoken, and You will perform it.
>
>In Jesus’ mighty name, I pray. Amen.

parts.title: III
parts.markdown:
# Know Your Foe III

1. What signs shall follow the believer? Mark 16:17-18
> 17 And these signs shall follow them that believe; In my name shall they cast out devils; they shall speak with new tongues;
> 
> 18 They shall take up serpents; and if they drink any deadly thing, it shall not hurt them; they shall lay hands on the sick, and they shall recover.
2. What does it mean to believe?
3. What authority has Jesus given to the believer?
4. Does the believer exercise his authority in the name of Jesus or the blood of Jesus?
5. Does the believer have the authority to force out demons?
6. Does the believer have the authority to heal normal sicknesses that are not caused by demons?
7. How did Jesus force out demons? Mark 5:8
>8 For Jesus had said to him, “Come out of this man, you impure spirit!”
8. Did Christ ask the Father to remove the evil spirits, or did he sack them himself?
9. Do you ask God to remove an evil spirit or do you command the evil spirit to leave, using your authority in the name of Jesus?
10. Do you instruct evil spirits as you would another person? 
11. How do you force a demon out of a person?
12. Repeat 10 times
> Unclean spirits, come out in the name of Jesus
13. How did Christ heal normal sicknesses not caused by demons? Luke 4:38-40
>38 Jesus left the synagogue and went to Simon's home. Simon's mother-in-law was sick with a high fever, and they spoke to Jesus about her. 39 He went and stood at her bedside and ordered the fever to leave her. The fever left her, and she got up at once and began to wait on them.
>40 After sunset all who had friends who were sick with various diseases brought them to Jesus; he placed his hands on every one of them and healed them all.
14. How do you heal a person suffering from a sickness not caused by a demon?
15. Lay your hand on another person and repeat 10 times.
> Sickness, leave now in the name of Jesus
16. Before teaching the word of God to people, should you first sack every unclean spirit out of them?
17. Deliver yourself from every unclean spirit.
> I am free from every power of the enemy In the name of Jesus. I command the spirit behind my addiction, sickness, anger, etc. to leave and never return in the name of Jesus.
18. Deliver yourself from every curse.
> Lord Jesus, deliver me from every curse and power of the enemy
19. When forcing out an unclean spirit is proving difficult what else can you do? Mark 5:9
>9 Then Jesus asked him,  “What is your name?” “My name is Legion,”  he replied, “for we are many.”
20. Can you force out a demon by first asking their name, and then referring to them by name to come out in the name of Jesus?
21. How do you ensure the demon does not enter the person again? Mark 9:25
> 25 When Jesus saw that a crowd was running to the scene, he rebuked the impure spirit. “You deaf and mute spirit,” he said, “I command you, come out of him and never enter him again.”
22. What do you do with thoughts that the devil tries to put in your head? James 4:7
> Submit yourselves, then, to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.
23. How do you resist the devil in your thoughts?
24. Should you silently ignore these thoughts?
25. Should you vocally rebuke these thoughts and command them to leave you in the name of Jesus?
26. Repeat three(3) times:
> Let every unclean thought depart from me in the name of Jesus
27. Should you watch what you see with your eyes if you do not want to be troubled by evil spirits?
28. What is the reason for your answer?
29. Should you watch what you hear with your ears if you do not want to be troubled by evil spirits?
30. What is the reason for your answer?
31. Should you watch what you say with your tongue if you do not want to be troubled by evil spirits?
32. What is the reason for your answer?
33. Should you watch what you do with your body if you do not want to have trouble with evil spirits?
34. What is the reason for your answer?
35. Should you watch what you bring into your home if you do not want to invite evil spirits? Deuteronomy 7:26
> Make sure you set fire to their carved gods. Don’t get greedy for the veneer of silver and gold on them and take it for yourselves—you’ll get trapped by it for sure. GOD hates it; it’s an abomination to GOD, your God. And don’t dare bring one of these abominations home or you’ll end up just like it, burned up as a holy destruction. No: It is forbidden! Hate it. Abominate it. Destroy it and preserve GOD’s holiness.
36. What is the reason for your answer?
37. Should you discuss with evil spirits?
38. Should you entertain evil spirits?
39. Should you be afraid of evil spirits?
40. What do you do when you come across an evil spirit?
41. Pray, asking God to reveal every secret. hidden thing about yourself, your family, that is fighting you? Jeremiah 33:3
> Call to me and I will answer you and tell you great and unsearchable things you do not know.’
42. Pray with faith:
> Heavenly Father,  
You have invited me to call upon You, and You have promised to answer.  
Today I lift my voice to You — not in doubt, but in faith — knowing that You are near to those who seek You with an honest heart.
>
>Lord, open my ears to hear Your voice clearly.  
Reveal to me the great and hidden things that I do not know —  
the mysteries of Your will, the purpose for my life,  
and the truth that sets my soul free.
>
>Where my understanding falls short, grant me insight.  
Where my path is uncertain, give me revelation.  
Where I have been blind to spiritual realities, open my eyes to see beyond the surface.
>
>Teach me to discern Your hand in all things.  
Let wisdom flow like a river into my heart,  
that I may walk in Your ways with confidence and peace.
>
>Thank You, Father, for Your promise that when I call, You will answer.  
Thank You for the assurance that Your words will never return empty.  
I rest in Your faithfulness and wait expectantly for Your revelation.
>
>In Jesus’ mighty name,  
Amen.
43. Are you prepared for warfare?
44. >“I am a child of God, redeemed by the blood of Jesus. The enemy has no claim over my life.” (John 1:12, Colossians 1:13–14)
45. >_“I declare that I am seated with Christ in heavenly places, far above all powers and principalities.”_  (Ephesians 2:6, Ephesians 1:21)
46. >_“I have been given power to tread upon serpents and scorpions, and over all the power of the enemy.”_  (Luke 10:19)
47. >_“No weapon formed against me shall prosper, and every tongue that rises against me in judgment I condemn.”_  (Isaiah 54:17)
48. >_“I plead the blood of Jesus over my mind, my body, my family, and my home.”_  (Exodus 12:13, Revelation 12:11)
49. >_“The angel of the Lord encamps around me and delivers me from all harm.”_  (Psalm 34:7)
50. >_“I declare total deliverance from every bondage and stronghold. Whom the Son sets free is free indeed.”_  (John 8:36)
51. >_“Every chain of addiction, depression, or oppression is broken off me now in Jesus’ name.”_  (Nahum 1:13, Isaiah 10:27)
52. >_“I renounce every generational curse and declare that I am a new creation in Christ Jesus.”_ (Galatians 3:13, 2 Corinthians 5:17)
53. >_“I take every thought captive to obey Christ. I reject fear, anxiety, and confusion.”_ (2 Corinthians 10:4–5)
54. >_“God has not given me a spirit of fear, but of power, love, and a sound mind.”_  (2 Timothy 1:7)
55. >_“I put on the helmet of salvation and declare mental clarity, peace, and truth over my mind.”_ (Ephesians 6:17)
56. >_“I declare victory over temptation. Sin shall not have dominion over me.”_  (Romans 6:14)
57. >_“I walk in the Spirit and do not fulfill the lust of the flesh.”_ (Galatians 5:16)
58. >_“The Lord is faithful and delivers me from every snare of the evil one.”_  (1 Corinthians 10:13, 2 Thessalonians 3:3)
59. >_“I declare that the peace of God reigns in my heart and my home. Confusion has no place in my life.”_ (Philippians 4:7, 1 Corinthians 14:33)
60. >_“Every spirit of chaos, disorder, and strife is bound and cast out in Jesus’ name.”_  (Mark 3:27, James 3:16)
61. >_“I speak peace to the storm and calm to every spiritual disturbance around me.”_ (Mark 4:39)
62. >_“I declare divine health. Every attack on my body is defeated by the blood of Jesus.”_ (Isaiah 53:5, 3 John 1:2)
63. >_“No sickness or plague shall come near my dwelling. My body is the temple of the Holy Spirit.”_ (Psalm 91:10, 1 Corinthians 6:19)
64. >_“I receive supernatural strength to overcome weariness and burnout.”_ (Isaiah 40:31)
65. >_“I break the spirit of lack and poverty. The Lord supplies all my needs abundantly.”_ (Philippians 4:19, Deuteronomy 28:11)
66. >_“I declare open heavens over my finances. Every devourer is rebuked in Jesus’ name.”_ (Malachi 3:10–11)
67. >_“I walk in divine favor and abundance. I am blessed to be a blessing.”_ (Psalm 5:12, Genesis 12:2)
68. >_“I declare that my household is covered and protected. We serve the Lord together in unity and love.”_ (Joshua 24:15)
69.  >_“No weapon formed against my marriage, children, or legacy shall prosper.”_ (Isaiah 59:21)
70. >_“The plans of the enemy to divide, discourage, or destroy my family are nullified by the power of God.”_ (John 10:10, Psalm 127:1)
71. >_“I declare that I am advancing in the Spirit. I grow daily in wisdom, power, and discernment.”_ (Colossians 1:10, Ephesians 1:17–18)
72. >_“Every spiritual blockage, delay, and stagnation is removed. I walk in acceleration and divine timing.”_ (Isaiah 60:22, Amos 9:13)
73. >_“I will not backslide or grow weary. I press forward in faith, victory, and unshakable hope.”_ (Hebrews 10:39, Philippians 3:14)
74. What are some signs that indicate that a demon is leaving a person?
75. Do they experience coughing, yawning, burping, or vomiting as a demon leaves?
76. Does shaking, trembling, or feeling something “lift off” the body sometimes occur?
77. Does a simple thing, such as deep sighs or suddenly feeling lighter in the body, occur when a demon is leaving?

parts.title: IV
parts.markdown:
# Know Your Foe IV

1. How did the giants of old come into existence? Genesis 6:1-8
> 6 When people had spread all over the world, and daughters were being born, 2 some of the heavenly beings saw that these young women were beautiful, so they took the ones they liked. 3 Then the  Lord said, “I will not allow people to live forever; they are mortal. From now on they will live no longer than 120 years.” 4 In those days, and even later, there were giants on the earth who were descendants of human women and the heavenly beings. They were the great heroes and famous men of long ago.
> 
> 5 When the  Lord saw how wicked everyone on earth was and how evil their thoughts were all the time, 6 he was sorry that he had ever made them and put them on the earth. He was so filled with regret 7 that he said, “I will wipe out these people I have created, and also the animals and the birds, because I am sorry that I made any of them.” 8 But the  Lord was pleased with Noah.
2. Did the heavenly beings defile themselves by having children with both humans and animals, giving birth to all kinds of abominable creatures such as giants, mermaids, etc?
3. Did humans worship these heavenly beings and their children as gods?
4. Who taught humans how to abort babies in the womb?
5. Who taught women how to paint their faces and use charms? 2 Kings 9:30
> When Jezebel, the queen mother, heard that Jehu had come to Jezreel, she painted her eyelids and fixed her hair and sat at a window.
6. Who taught humans how to fight wars?
7. How did God get rid of the giants?
8. How did God deal with their parents, the heavenly beings?
9. What spirits came out of these giants after the flood had destroyed their bodies in the days of Noah?
10. Do evil spirits die?
11. Do evil spirits have names and behave like people with personalities?
12. Do they thirst and hunger yet eat no food or drink water?
13. When will evil spirits be completely wiped out from the earth?
14. Until the great judgment, will evil spirits continue to fight the children of God?
15. Was hell made for these fallen spirits and their children or humans? Matthew 25:41
>41 “Then he will say to those on his left, ‘Depart from me, you who are cursed, into the eternal fire prepared for the devil and his angels.
16. Do evil spirits work with the devil to fight the children of God?
17. Who is the head of the family of evil spirits? Matthew 10:23-26
> 23 When you are persecuted in one place, flee to another. Truly I tell you, you will not finish going through the towns of Israel before the Son of Man comes.
> 
> 24 “The student is not above the teacher, nor a servant above his master.  25 It is enough for students to be like their teachers, and servants like their masters. If the head of the house has been called Beelzebul,  how much more the members of his household!
> 
> 26 “So do not be afraid of them, for there is nothing concealed that will not be disclosed, or hidden that will not be made known.
18. Which individuals *actually* persecuted Christ and continue to persecute his followers?
19. What is the meaning of the name Beelzebul?
> chief spirit of evil and adversary of God; tempter of mankind; master of Hell.
20. Have demons already been judged and know where they will go and what will happen to them at the appointed time? Matthew 8:28-29
> 28 When he arrived at the other side in the region of the Gadarenes, two demon-possessed men coming from the tombs met him. They were so violent that no one could pass that way.  29 “What do you want with us,  Son of God?” they shouted. “Have you come here to torture us before the appointed time?”
21. Until the appointed time, will you be tempted by evil spirits?
22. Will you be persecuted by humans under the influence of evil spirits?
23. Should you be afraid of the kingdom of darkness?
24. Pray to God to deliver you from every temptation.
25. Is spiritual warfare the most important warfare of your life, with the highest rewards when you win?
26. What is the reason for your answer?
27. Boldly pray:
> Heavenly Father,  
In the name of Jesus Christ, I come before You today, acknowledging You as the Author of my life, my destiny, and my prosperity. I believe that You formed me with purpose, and that Your plans for me are to prosper me and not to harm me—to give me a future and a hope (_Jeremiah 29:11_).
>
>Lord, I repent for every sin, known and unknown, in my life or in my bloodline that has opened the door to captivity or delay. I plead the blood of Jesus over my soul, my destiny, and every area of my life.
28. *Father, in the name of Jesus, I call forth my soul from every spiritual prison.*
> “Return to your rest, O my soul, for the Lord has dealt bountifully with you.”_ (Psalm 116:7)
29. *I call forth my destiny from every demonic altar, coven, or place of delay.*
> “Oh Lord, You are my portion and my inheritance; You hold my lot. The lines have fallen to me in pleasant places.”_ (Psalm 16:5-6)
30. *I call forth my prosperity and provision from the north, south, east, and west.*
> “Wealth and riches are in my house, and my righteousness endures forever.”_ (Psalm 112:3)
31. *Every blessing that was buried, stolen, or hijacked, I now retrieve by the authority of Jesus’ name.*
32. *I command every padlock, prison, or chain binding my soul, destiny, or prosperity to be broken now in Jesus’ name.*
> “He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death, and broke their chains in pieces.”_ (Psalm 107:14)
33. *Every demonic force or familiar spirit holding what belongs to me, release it now! I take back what the enemy has stolen.*
> “When the thief is found, he must restore sevenfold.” (Proverbs 6:31)
34. *I declare: My life is back in alignment with Heaven.*
> My soul is restored, my mind renewed, my purpose awakened, and my blessings loosed!
35. Declare boldly:
> Father, I receive the keys of David that open what no one can shut.  
I walk into my divine appointments, open doors, healthy relationships, and favor from heaven and earth.  
Let every delay turn into divine acceleration. Let every curse be turned into a blessing.  
Let every spiritual blockage now become a breakthrough.  
Let every dry place become an oasis.
>
>I declare boldly:
>_"O my destiny, arise and shine! My soul shall not be caged. My purpose shall not be aborted. My season of restoration is here."_  
In the mighty name of Jesus Christ, I pray.  
Amen.

Who taught women how to paint their faces and use charms? 2 Kings 9:30
sections.body: > When Jezebel, the queen mother, heard that Jehu had come to Jezreel, she painted her eyelids and fixed her hair and sat at a window.

sections.question: Who taught humans how to fight wars?
How did God get rid of the giants?
How did God deal with their parents, the heavenly beings?
What spirits came out of these giants after the flood had destroyed their bodies in the days of Noah?
Do evil spirits die?
Do evil spirits have names and behave like people with personalities?
Do they thirst and hunger yet eat no food or drink water?
When will evil spirits be completely wiped out from the earth?
Until the great judgment, will evil spirits continue to fight the children of God?
Was hell made for these fallen spirits and their children or humans? Matthew 25:41
sections.body: >41 “Then he will say to those on his left, ‘Depart from me, you who are cursed, into the eternal fire prepared for the devil and his angels.

sections.question: Do evil spirits work with the devil to fight the children of God?
Who is the head of the family of evil spirits? Matthew 10:23-26
sections.body:
> 23 When you are persecuted in one place, flee to another. Truly I tell you, you will not finish going through the towns of Israel before the Son of Man comes.
> 
> 24 “The student is not above the teacher, nor a servant above his master.  25 It is enough for students to be like their teachers, and servants like their masters. If the head of the house has been called Beelzebul,  how much more the members of his household!
> 
> 26 “So do not be afraid of them, for there is nothing concealed that will not be disclosed, or hidden that will not be made known.

sections.question: Which individuals *actually* persecuted Christ and continue to persecute his followers?
What is the meaning of the name Beelzebul?
sections.body: > chief spirit of evil and adversary of God; tempter of mankind; master of Hell.

sections.question: Have demons already been judged and know where they will go and what will happen to them at the appointed time? Matthew 8:28-29
sections.body: > 28 When he arrived at the other side in the region of the Gadarenes, two demon-possessed men coming from the tombs met him. They were so violent that no one could pass that way.  29 “What do you want with us,  Son of God?” they shouted. “Have you come here to torture us before the appointed time?”

sections.question: Until the appointed time, will you be tempted by evil spirits?
Will you be persecuted by humans under the influence of evil spirits?
Should you be afraid of the kingdom of darkness?
Pray to God to deliver you from every temptation.
Is spiritual warfare the most important warfare of your life, with the highest rewards when you win?
What is the reason for your answer?
Boldly pray:
sections.body:
> Heavenly Father,  
In the name of Jesus Christ, I come before You today, acknowledging You as the Author of my life, my destiny, and my prosperity. I believe that You formed me with purpose, and that Your plans for me are to prosper me and not to harm me—to give me a future and a hope (_Jeremiah 29:11_).
>
>Lord, I repent for every sin, known and unknown, in my life or in my bloodline that has opened the door to captivity or delay. I plead the blood of Jesus over my soul, my destiny, and every area of my life.

sections.question: *Father, in the name of Jesus, I call forth my soul from every spiritual prison.*
sections.body: > “Return to your rest, O my soul, for the Lord has dealt bountifully with you.”_ (Psalm 116:7)

sections.question: *I call forth my destiny from every demonic altar, coven, or place of delay.*
sections.body: > “Oh Lord, You are my portion and my inheritance; You hold my lot. The lines have fallen to me in pleasant places.”_ (Psalm 16:5-6)

sections.question: *I call forth my prosperity and provision from the north, south, east, and west.*
sections.body: > “Wealth and riches are in my house, and my righteousness endures forever.”_ (Psalm 112:3)

sections.question: *Every blessing that was buried, stolen, or hijacked, I now retrieve by the authority of Jesus’ name.*
*I command every padlock, prison, or chain binding my soul, destiny, or prosperity to be broken now in Jesus’ name.*
sections.body: > “He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death, and broke their chains in pieces.”_ (Psalm 107:14)

sections.question: *Every demonic force or familiar spirit holding what belongs to me, release it now! I take back what the enemy has stolen.*
sections.body: > “When the thief is found, he must restore sevenfold.” (Proverbs 6:31)

sections.question: *I declare: My life is back in alignment with Heaven.*
sections.body: > My soul is restored, my mind renewed, my purpose awakened, and my blessings loosed!

sections.question: Declare boldly:
sections.body:
> Father, I receive the keys of David that open what no one can shut.  
I walk into my divine appointments, open doors, healthy relationships, and favor from heaven and earth.  
Let every delay turn into divine acceleration. Let every curse be turned into a blessing.  
Let every spiritual blockage now become a breakthrough.  
Let every dry place become an oasis.
>
>I declare boldly:
>_"O my destiny, arise and shine! My soul shall not be caged. My purpose shall not be aborted. My season of restoration is here."_  
In the mighty name of Jesus Christ, I pray.  
Amen.

parts.title: V
parts.markdown:
# Know Your Foe V

1. Did Christ make much effort to expose the Kingdom of Darkness?
2. Name instances where Christ exposes the nature of the Kingdom of Darkness.
3. Should the follower of Christ also attempt to expose the Kingdom of Darkness, ignore it, or pretend it does not exist?
4. Was the Devil hidden from humans for most of the Old Testament?
5. Were many incidents in the Old Testament attributed to God, because God was all the Israelites knew? 2 Samuel 24:1, 1 Chronicles 21:1
> 2 Samuel 24:1
> Again the anger of the Lord burned against Israel, and he incited David against them, saying, “Go and take a census of Israel and Judah.”
>
>1 Chronicles 21:1
> Satan rose up against Israel and incited David to take a census of Israel.
6. Give other examples of evil being attributed to God in the Old Testament.
7. Is Christ the most accurate representation of the Character of the Father? John 14:9
> 9 Jesus answered: “Don’t you know me, Philip, even after I have been among you such a long time? Anyone who has seen me has seen the Father.  How can you say, ‘Show us the Father’?
8. What is the reason for your answer?
9. If the person ruling a country has a demon, who is ruling the country?
10. Why should you pray for the people in authority?
11. Pray for the people in authority where you live
12. Is God speaking to a man or superhuman? Ezekiel 28:1-10
13. Who is the man in Tyre?
14. In verse 5, what did the man do wrong?
15. Why is the man filled with Pride? 
16. When do you say that a person has Pride?
17. Can pride make you blind to the obvious?
18. In what ways does Pride make you blind to the obvious?
19. Is God speaking to a man or superhuman? Ezekiel 28:11-19
20. Who is the person in Tyre?
21. In verse 17, what did the person do wrong?
22. Why is the person filled with Pride?
23. Is the ruler of Tyre and the King of Tyre the same person?
24. Who is the ruler of Tyre, and who is the King of Tyre?
25. In verse 13, is the King of Tyre a created being?
26. In verse 14, what was the King of Tyre created to do?
27. Why does God state that the King of Tyre is a created being, and even describe how he was created?
28. What does it mean to trade in something?
29. In verse 16, what was the King of Tyre trading in?
30. Was the King of Tyre perfect in beauty?
31. Was the King of Tyre full of Wisdom?
32. Was the King of Tyre's wisdom corrupted?
33. How did the King of Tyre corrupt his wisdom?
34. Pray to God to take every form of pride away from you.
35. Who was the first rebel?
36. Who is the ruler of all rebels?
37. I used to work for a king, but after a while, I didn’t like the way he ruled. So, I secretly turned his own men against him. In the end, I used force to remove him and made myself king instead. But if my own men ever stop liking my rule, what will they do to me?
38. Does Satan use force and fear to rule the members of his kingdom?
39. Does the Kingdom of Darkness attempt to live without God?
40. Do the people who worship God know who they worship? John 4:22
> 22 You worship what you do not know; we know what we worship, for salvation is of the Jews.
41. Do the people who worship the devil know who they worship?
42. In what ways do people indirectly worship the devil or do as he does?
43. What is witchcraft?
44. If a person attempts to control another person with the help of an evil spirit, is the person practicing witchcraft?
45. Does witchcraft attempt to manipulate, intimidate, dominate, or control another individual through supernatural powers?
46. Does witchcraft attempt to use things like casting spells, love potions, etc, on other people?
47. When a witch is unable to gain access to you spiritually to control you, will they send someone to you who will provoke you to anger, after which they can connect their tentacles of control to you? 
48. Why is anger called the *Puppet Master*? Ephesians 4:26-27
> 26 “In your anger do not sin”: Do not let the sun go down while you are still angry,  27 and do not give the devil a foothold.
49. Pray boldly:
> In the name of Jesus, I break away from every form of witchcraft control or bewitchment
50. Also, pray boldly:
> Heavenly Father,
>
>I come before You in the name of Jesus Christ, my Lord and Savior. I acknowledge Your sovereignty, Your holiness, and Your power over all creation. You alone are God, and there is no other.
>
>Lord, I renounce and break every form of witchcraft, sorcery, divination, and occult influence that has sought to gain control over my life—knowingly or unknowingly. I break every curse, spell, incantation, hex, and enchantment spoken or written against me. I declare by the blood of Jesus that no weapon formed against me shall prosper (Isaiah 54:17).
>
>In the name of Jesus, I sever every tie—spiritual, emotional, or physical—that has connected me to the works of darkness. I reject all agreements, covenants, or pacts made on my behalf that are not of You. I cancel their power and authority in my life by the authority of Christ, who triumphed over all powers and principalities (Colossians 2:15).
>
>Holy Spirit, fill every place in my heart and mind that was occupied by deception, fear, or bondage. Let Your light drive out every shadow and lie. Replace every falsehood with Your truth. I receive Your freedom, for whom the Son sets free is free indeed (John 8:36).
>
>Lord, I ask for Your protection. Surround me with Your presence. Cover me with the blood of Jesus. Guard my mind, body, and soul from every spiritual attack. Let every plan of the enemy be exposed and destroyed.
>
>I commit myself fully to You. I declare that I belong to Jesus Christ—spirit, soul, and body. I choose to walk in obedience, in truth, and in the power of the Holy Spirit. Strengthen me to resist the enemy, stand firm in faith, and walk boldly in Your light.
>
>Thank You, Father, for delivering me. Thank You for Your victory. I give You all the glory, honor, and praise.
>
>In the mighty name of Jesus Christ,  
Amen.
51. In what ways do people practice witchcraft where you live?
52. What is divination?
53. If a person tries to obtain knowledge with the help of an evil spirit, is the person practicing divination?
54. In what ways do people practice divination where you live
55. What is sorcery?
56. If a person uses an object, music, or a drug to transmit demonic power, is the person practicing sorcery?
57. Give examples of how people practice sorcery where you live
58. When you lose control of yourself, can evil spirits easily come in?
59. Why is alcohol called spirits?
60. Does God want you to have self-control or not?
61. Is anything that makes you lose your self-control ungodly?
62. Did David and Goliath's fight start *spiritually* or *physically*? 1 Samuel 17:41-45
> 41 Meanwhile, the Philistine, with his shield bearer in front of him, kept coming closer to David.  42 He looked David over and saw that he was little more than a boy, glowing with health and handsome,  and he despised him.  43 He said to David, “Am I a dog,  that you come at me with sticks?” And the Philistine cursed David by his gods.  44 “Come here,” he said, “and I’ll give your flesh to the birds  and the wild animals!”
>
>45 David said to the Philistine, “You come against me with sword and spear and javelin,  but I come against you in the name of the  Lord  Almighty, the God of the armies of Israel, whom you have defied.
63. Does the Kingdom of Darkness have the power to curse?
64. Who won the fight between David and Goliath?
65. Does the Kingdom of Darkness attempt to produce its version of every marvelous thing God does? 1 John 4:1
> Dear friends, do not believe every spirit, but test the spirits to see whether they are from God, because many false prophets have gone out into the world.
66. Give examples of attempts by the Kingdom of Darkness to produce its version of things that God has done.
67. Vocally say this prayer:
>Heavenly Father,  
	In the mighty name of Jesus Christ, I come before You today asking for complete deliverance from every form of bewitchment, manipulation, and spiritual bondage. I renounce any connection to occult powers—whether known or unknown, inherited or acquired.
	>
	>I plead the blood of Jesus over my life, spirit, soul, and body.  
	Every chain of witchcraft, every spell, every curse, every incantation spoken against me—I break it now in the name of Jesus.
	Let every spiritual arrow fired against my destiny backfire by the power of the Holy Ghost.
	>
	>Lord, Your Word says:  
	_"No weapon formed against me shall prosper, and every tongue that rises against me in judgment I shall condemn."_ (Isaiah 54:17)  
	I stand on this promise and declare total freedom in Jesus’ name.  
	Amen.
68. Vocally say this prayer:
>Lord Jesus,  
I thank You for being my refuge and my strong tower. I ask You to cover me with Your precious blood and surround me with Your angels (Psalm 91).  
Let no hex, spell, charm, or divination affect me.  
Shield my home, my mind, my family, and all that concerns me from any form of demonic interference.
	>
	> I declare that Jesus is Lord over my life, and every dark power must bow to His authority.  
		Let light shine in every dark area around me, and let confusion fall upon every gathering of witches or sorcerers assigned to harm me.  
		In Jesus’ name, I pray. Amen.
69. Vocally say this prayer:
> In the name of Jesus,  
I declare that every altar of witchcraft erected against me shall be destroyed by Holy Ghost fire.  
Every monitoring spirit, spiritual husband or wife, familiar spirit, or agent of darkness—I command you to flee now!
	>
	>I break every covenant made on my behalf without my knowledge.  
	I release myself from the grip of every evil covenant and cancel every agreement that contradicts God’s will for my life.  
	By the authority of Jesus Christ, I am set free!  
	Amen.
70. Vocally say this prayer:
> Heavenly Father,  
I pray Psalm 35 and Psalm 91 over my life today.
	>
	> _“Contend, Lord, with those who contend with me; fight against those who fight against me. Take up shield and armor; arise and come to my aid.”_ (Psalm 35:1-2)  
	> _“Whoever dwells in the shelter of the Most High will rest in the shadow of the Almighty.”_ (Psalm 91:1)
	>
	>I dwell under Your shadow. I am safe. Every plan of darkness is nullified, and Your divine light surrounds me.  
	Amen.
71. Witchcraft in Action:
> Witchcraft is about dominating other people—controlling them and making them do things they would never do in their right minds. You must understand that Satan is the originator of this behavior. It’s a craft—something that’s learned—and there’s always a spirit backing it.
>
>Let me give you a scenario. You attend prayer meetings regularly at your church. Then one day, a woman starts coming to those meetings. She claims she's afflicted by evil spirits and needs deliverance, so naturally, you feel compassion. She draws close to you and begins whispering in your ear that she has a prophetic gift. She tells you that most people in the church are filled with demons or have some hidden evil in them. You begin to listen, and slowly, both of you stop going to the prayer meetings. Eventually, you start pulling away from the church altogether.
>
>Around the same time, your father has a sore on his leg that just won’t heal. Then your mother travels for three days. During her absence, the same woman comes to your house and offers some kind of medicine for your father’s sore—and it works. You're impressed by her spiritual abilities, and so is your father. She then tells both of you that your mother—the very woman who raised you—is actually the cause of the sore that wouldn’t heal.
>
>When your mother returns home, you and your father treat her with suspicion and hostility. Suddenly, things begin to “make sense” to you. You remember how she sometimes acted strangely, especially when you were fasting. You start blaming her for your struggles in life—why you couldn’t finish school, why nothing seems to work for you. One day, you go so far as to drag her out of the house and slap her.
>
>And this isn’t like you at all. You were once a strong believer, even preparing to become a pastor or preacher, though academics were never your strong suit.
>
>Your mother is kicked out of the house and goes to live with your older sister. Meanwhile, the woman moves in with her eight children—after leaving her own husband—and eventually becomes pregnant by you.
>
>You now believe you're a junior prophet and she is the senior prophet. Together, you begin praying for and “healing” people. When someone visits you and you step outside to talk, you find yourself telling them that the woman will reveal everything you’ve just said once you go back inside. You even feel something pressing against your skull while you're speaking.
>
>To cut a long story short: your father’s sore comes back. His leg is amputated, and eventually, he dies. The baby you have with the woman doesn’t survive. Then you leave town with her and her children to live in a distant community. Your mother still mourns those three days she traveled, saying if she had known what would unfold, she would never have gone.
