One day, you go so far as to drag her out of the house and slap her.
>
>And this isn’t like you at all. You were once a strong believer, even preparing to become a pastor or preacher, though academics were never your strong suit.
>
>Your mother is kicked out of the house and goes to live with your older sister. Meanwhile, the woman moves in with her eight children—after leaving her own husband—and eventually becomes pregnant by you.
>
>You now believe you're a junior prophet and she is the senior prophet. Together, you begin praying for and “healing” people. When someone visits you and you step outside to talk, you find yourself telling them that the woman will reveal everything you’ve just said once you go back inside. You even feel something pressing against your skull while you're speaking.
>
>To cut a long story short: your father’s sore comes back. His leg is amputated, and eventually, he dies. The baby you have with the woman doesn’t survive. Then you leave town with her and her children to live in a distant community. Your mother still mourns those three days she traveled, saying if she had known what would unfold, she would never have gone.

parts.title: VI
parts.markdown:
# Breaking Addictions

Addiction is one of the enemy's most effective strategies to keep God's children in bondage. The Bible identifies three major snares: _the lust of the flesh_, _the lust of the eyes_, and _the pride of life_. These are the pathways through which many fall into captivity.

At a certain point, addiction moves beyond the physical and psychological—it becomes spiritual. A demonic presence enters and binds the individual, trapping them in a cycle of guilt, repentance, and repeated failure. You find yourself despising what you do, yet returning to it time and again. This inner conflict stems from the pure spirit within you resisting the darkness you’ve allowed in. Jesus refers to this demonic force as _the strongman_.

> Mark 3:27
> _"In fact, no one can enter a strong man’s house without first tying him up. Then he can plunder the strong man’s house."_

But there is good news: Christ has given every believer real authority over the powers of darkness.

> Luke 10:19
> _"I have given you authority to trample on snakes and scorpions and to overcome all the power of the enemy; nothing will harm you."_

> Mark 16:17-18 
> _“And these signs shall follow them that believe; In my name shall they cast out devils; they shall speak with new tongues;  
> They shall take up serpents; and if they drink any deadly thing, it shall not hurt them; they shall lay hands on the sick, and they shall recover.”_

Notice: _the believer_, not God, casts out devils. God has given _you_ authority in the name of Jesus. It is now your responsibility to use that authority.

Speak boldly and pray with faith:

>Heavenly Father,  
I come before You with a humble heart, confessing my sins of pornography, masturbation, and every form of addiction that has taken hold of my life. I acknowledge that these things have separated me from Your presence and defiled the purity You desire for me. Lord, I repent sincerely and turn away from them. Wash me clean by the blood of Jesus and renew my mind and body to honor You alone.
>
>Father, I also choose to forgive every person who has hurt, offended, or betrayed me. I release them into Your hands and let go of all bitterness, anger, and pain. Heal my heart and fill me with Your peace, love, and strength to walk in holiness and freedom.
>
>Holy Spirit, help me to stay pure, disciplined, and devoted to You. May my body, my thoughts, and my desires bring glory to Your name.
>
>In Jesus’ mighty name I pray,  
Amen.

> _“In the name of Jesus, I command every spirit of lust, pornography, masturbation,[insert sin] to leave me now and never return.”_

Then consecrate yourself to God daily:

> _“Heavenly Father, I give You my heart, my mind, my body, and my soul. Let them be Yours today and always, in the name of Jesus.”_

Let this be your daily declaration and commitment. Remember, freedom is not just possible—it’s promised for those who believe and act on the Word.

**Porn, Masturbation:**
There are spiritual forces that operate like soul ties, bonding themselves to individuals through sexual sin. Some describe them as demons that “marry” a person in the spirit, obsessively working to isolate them from real, godly relationships. These forces can plant thoughts and desires—especially for porn and masturbation—while manifesting as sexual dreams. They use these to keep you bound, distracted, and disconnected from your purpose.

Their goal? To destroy your ability to form healthy, lasting relationships. They can sabotage romantic prospects, disrupt your marriage, and even cause division in your family line. Many experience spiritual stagnation, financial hardship, and a weakened relationship with God as a result. It’s a cycle of spiritual oppression masked as pleasure and “harmless” indulgence.

If you’re serious about your spiritual growth and future, learn to hate what keeps you bound. Porn isn't a release—it’s a chain.

Vocally pray with faith:
> Heavenly Father,  
I come before You today with a broken and contrite heart. I confess my sin of giving in to lust, pornography, and masturbation. I have allowed my eyes, heart, and body to be defiled by things that do not glorify You. I have opened doors that should have remained shut, and I have grieved Your Holy Spirit.
>
>Lord, Your Word says in 1 John 1:9 that _"if we confess our sins, You are faithful and just to forgive us our sins and to cleanse us from all unrighteousness."_ I bring my sin before You now—not hiding, not excusing, not minimizing—but laying it all at Your feet in repentance. Cleanse me, O God.
>
>I renounce every agreement I have made with the spirit of lust. I break every soul tie, mental image, and spiritual bond I’ve formed through pornography and impurity. Let every demonic foothold in my life be broken by the power of the blood of Jesus.
>
>Jesus, Your blood was shed not only to forgive me but to set me free. According to Romans 6:14, sin shall no longer have dominion over me. I declare that I am not a slave to these habits. I am not bound to shame, guilt, or condemnation. I am a new creation in Christ—old things have passed away, behold, all things have become new.
>
>Renew my mind, Lord. Teach me to guard my eyes, my heart, and my thoughts. Teach me to flee temptation. Fill every empty space with Your presence, Your truth, and Your love. Replace lust with purity, addiction with discipline, and shame with grace.
>
>Holy Spirit, I invite You into every part of my life. Convict me quickly, strengthen me daily, and guide me always. Surround me with godly accountability and help me walk in the light.
>
>Thank You, Father, for never giving up on me. Thank You, Jesus, for Your mercy. Thank You, Holy Spirit, for empowering me to live holy.
>
>In Jesus’ name,  
Amen.

parts.title: VII
parts.markdown:
# Breaking Altars

Altars—both physical and spiritual—are powerful spiritual systems of covenant and sacrifice. In families, demonic altars are often erected by ancestors or individuals through rituals, sacrifices, or agreements with dark powers. These altars serve as platforms through which demonic spirits operate, and they can destroy individuals and entire family lines if not broken.

Here’s how altars are used in families to destroy people and destinies:

**1. Altars Establish Evil Covenants**

An altar is where covenants are made. When someone in your lineage makes a pact with spirits—whether for protection, wealth, fertility, or power—they often raise an altar (knowingly or unknowingly). That altar becomes a legal ground for demons to operate across generations, binding descendants to the original agreement.

-   **Example**: A grandfather dedicates the family to a shrine for wealth. Generations after him suffer cycles of sudden death, barrenness, or madness because the demonic covenant was never broken.

**2. Altars Demand Sacrifices (Including Lives)**

Demonic altars often require regular sacrifices—blood, suffering, or acts of sin. When those demands aren’t met, the spirits behind the altar attack family members to extract it.

-   **Signs**: Repeated miscarriages, premature deaths, accidents at the same age, poverty, and mental illness.

**3. Altars Enforce Evil Patterns**

Family altars are responsible for recurring negative patterns—cycles that repeat in each generation despite efforts to break free.

-   **Examples**:
    -   No one gets married or stays married.
    -   Men die before 50.
    -   No one rises above a certain level financially or academically.
    -   Alcoholism or sexual perversion follows the bloodline.

These are spiritual systems programmed through altars.

**4. Altars Imprison Destinies**

Altars can be used to capture and delay destinies. They spiritually bind a person's purpose and gifts, making them ineffective or hidden. A person may have potential, but never realize it due to an altar speaking limitation.

-   **Examples**: Someone with high intellect but always fails exams. A gifted singer never gets an opportunity. A visionary always meets closed doors.

**5. Altars Attract Familiar Spirits**

Altars become access points for familiar spirits—demons assigned to monitor and manipulate family members. These spirits know your patterns, weaknesses, and history, and they work to maintain bondage.

-   They influence choices, relationships, dreams, and even emotions, keeping people under the influence of the altar.

**6. Altars Accuse and Block Prayers**

Altars serve as legal grounds for accusation in the spirit realm. They can block prayers, hinder deliverance, or delay blessings because of unresolved ancestral covenants.

-   **Revelation 12:10** speaks of the "accuser of the brethren." Altars often function through demonic accusation.

**7. Altars are Reinforced through Family Practices**

Family traditions (e.g., idol worship, ancestral festivals, pouring libations, certain names) can renew and reinforce the power of the altar unknowingly.

-   Participating in these seemingly harmless rituals can reactivate dormant altars.

**8. Altars Operate Through Bloodlines**

Even if you never participated, you can be affected if you’re part of the bloodline tied to the altar. This is why people suffer from things they can’t trace, because of bloodline covenants.

**How to Break Free**

-   Repentance & Renunciation (1 John 1:9)
-   Blood of Jesus (Hebrews 12:24)
-   Deliverance Prayers & Fasting (Mark 9:29)
-   Holy Communion – to spiritually disconnect from evil altars
-   Raising a godly altar – worship, prayer, sacrifice unto God (Genesis 12:7)

### **Prayer to Break Generational Altars and Covenants**

>Heavenly Father,
In the name of Jesus Christ, I come before You as Your child, redeemed by the blood of Jesus. I stand on the finished work of the cross, and I declare that I belong to You—spirit, soul, and body.
>
>Lord, I renounce and break every generational altar raised by my ancestors, knowingly or unknowingly, that speaks against my destiny. Every blood sacrifice, every dedication, every evil covenant made on my behalf or by my bloodline—I reject and renounce it now in Jesus’ name.
>
>I declare that Jesus Christ is the only altar I am connected to. His blood speaks better things than the blood of Abel. Let the voice of the blood of Jesus silence every evil voice crying from family altars that seek to keep me in bondage.
>
>I break every spiritual chain, every curse, every covenant, every legal ground the enemy has used through these ancestral altars. I declare by the authority in the name of Jesus that I am delivered permanently from their power.
>
>Father, send Your fire to destroy every evil altar speaking against my life, my marriage, my children, my career, my health, and my destiny. Let every point of contact between me and those altars be consumed now by the fire of the Holy Ghost.
>
>I bind every familiar spirit operating through these altars. I cast them out in Jesus’ name. Let them never return.
>
>By the blood of Jesus, I rewrite my spiritual DNA. I disconnect myself and my future generations from every evil foundation and reconnect us to the covenant of life, blessing, and righteousness through Christ.
>
>I decree:
>-   No more backwardness.
>-   No more sickness or untimely death.
>-   No more poverty or shame.
>-   No more spiritual stagnation.
>
>I seal this deliverance with the blood of Jesus, and I declare that every broken altar shall never rise again. From today, I walk in freedom, victory, and divine favor, in Jesus’ mighty name.
>
>Amen.

**You can pray this multiple times**, as led by the Holy Spirit, especially during fasting. Include Scripture like:

-   Hebrews 12:24 – “...the blood of sprinkling that speaks better things than that of Abel.”
-   Galatians 3:13-14 – “Christ has redeemed us from the curse of the law...”
-   Jeremiah 1:10 – “...to root out, to pull down, to destroy, and to throw down, to build and to plant.”
-   Colossians 2:14-15 – “...having wiped out the handwriting of requirements that was against us...”

parts.title: VIII
parts.markdown:
# Daily Spiritual Checklist of Prayers

### 1. **Morning Dedication Prayer**

> _"Commit your day to God." (Proverbs 3:5–6)_

**Prayer:**

> Heavenly Father, I dedicate this day to You. Let my thoughts, actions, and words align with Your will. Lead me by Your Spirit and protect me from any evil assignments, distractions, or manipulations. I surrender my mind, body, and soul to You. In Jesus’ name, amen.

### 2. **Prayer of Repentance and Cleansing**

> _"Create in me a clean heart, O God." (Psalm 51:10)_

**Prayer:**

> Lord, I repent of any sin, known or unknown, that could open doors to the enemy. Wash me with the blood of Jesus and purify me from all unrighteousness. Break any legal rights the enemy may try to use against me. I receive Your forgiveness and cleansing. Amen.

### 3. **Prayer for Deliverance from Evil**

> _"Deliver us from the evil one." (Matthew 6:13)_

**Prayer:**

> Father, in the name of Jesus, I come against every evil spirit assigned to my life. I break every chain, curse, or bondage operating in my life. I command every spirit of manipulation, witchcraft, confusion, fear, or oppression to leave now by the power of the Holy Spirit. I declare I am free and covered by the blood of Jesus. Amen.

### 4. **Declaration of Identity in Christ**

> _"You are a new creation." (2 Corinthians 5:17)_

**Declare:**

-   I am a child of God.
-   I am seated with Christ in heavenly places.
-   I am redeemed by the blood of Jesus.
-   I have authority over all the power of the enemy.
-   No weapon formed against me shall prosper.
-   The Holy Spirit lives in me, and greater is He who is in me than he who is in the world.

### 5. **Prayer to Cancel Evil Dreams and Assignments**

> _"No weapon formed against you shall prosper." (Isaiah 54:17)_

**Prayer:**

> Father, I cancel every evil dream, covenant, or manipulation formed against me in the night. I reject and renounce any spiritual transactions done while I slept. I nullify them with the blood of Jesus and declare they shall not prosper. I speak peace over my mind, spirit, and home. Amen.

### 6. **Covering Prayer with the Blood of Jesus**

> _"They overcame him by the blood of the Lamb." (Revelation 12:11)_

**Prayer:**

> Lord Jesus, I plead Your blood over my life, my family, my home, my work, and my mind. Let Your blood be a shield against all evil. Let it speak better things over me than any accusation or curse. Amen.

### 7. **Spiritual Armor Activation (Ephesians 6:10–18)**

> _"Put on the full armor of God."_

**Prayer:**

> I put on the helmet of salvation, the breastplate of righteousness, the belt of truth, the shoes of peace, the shield of faith, and the sword of the Spirit. I stand firm in Your power and declare I will not be shaken.

### 8. **Prayer for Discernment and Wisdom**

> _"If any of you lacks wisdom, let him ask of God." (James 1:5)_

**Prayer:**

> Father, give me spiritual discernment today. Help me recognize the schemes of the enemy and walk in Your truth. Let the Holy Spirit guide my choices and reveal anything hidden that I need to be aware of. In Jesus’ name, amen.

### 9. **Prayer to Command Your Morning**

> _"Have you commanded the morning since your days began, and caused the dawn to know its place?" (Job 38:12)_

**Prayer:**

> Heavenly Father, I thank You for the gift of life today. I declare that this is the day that You have made, and I will rejoice and be glad in it.
>
>I command this morning to align with Your perfect will for my life. Let the light of Your presence shine upon me and scatter every darkness. I decree that no weapon formed against me shall prosper, and every tongue that rises in judgment against me is condemned.
>
>I speak favor, open doors, and divine opportunities into this day. Let my steps be ordered by the Lord, and let my hands be blessed with fruitfulness. I call forth peace, joy, and strength to follow me throughout this day.
>
>I rebuke every plan of the enemy assigned against me today, and I declare that I walk in victory, power, and authority through Jesus Christ.
>
>Lord, go before me, cover me with Your blood, and let Your angels encamp around me. I declare that this morning and the rest of the day shall work together for my good.
>
>In Jesus’ mighty name, Amen.
> 
### 10. **Evening Prayer of Thanksgiving and Protection**

> _"In peace I will lie down and sleep." (Psalm 4:8)_

**Prayer:**

> Thank You, Lord, for Your protection today. I entrust my night into Your hands. I rebuke every spirit of fear, torment, and attack. Let angels stand guard around me and my household. I will sleep in peace under Your covering. Amen.

✅ **Additional Daily Habits**

-   Read at least one chapter of Scripture (e.g., Psalms, Proverbs, or Gospels)
-   Play worship music during your routine
-   Journal any dreams or spiritual impressions
-   Meditate on one verse or promise from the Bible daily

parts.title: IX
parts.markdown:
# Neat Tricks of the Devil

### **1. Distraction:**
Imagine a thief wanting to steal from you in broad daylight. First, they create a distraction because as long as you're paying attention, they can't take anything. They might notice where you keep your money. If it's in your left pocket, they might tap you on your right shoulder and then sneak their hand into your left pocket to steal your money without you noticing.

Think about a hen. She's usually calm and harmless, but if you try to take one of her chicks or get too close, she'll defend them fiercely. So, if you wanted to steal one of her chicks without a fight, you'd need a distraction.

When you're focused on a goal, sometimes you don't notice other important things slipping away. It's like a trick to keep you distracted from what truly matters.

In the past, a husband and wife would agree on who does what at home. The husband would go to work and earn money, while the wife took care of the house and kids. This way, the kids were always looked after, and any bad behavior was quickly noticed and corrected. The parents could guide their kids' upbringing.

But then, the wife might hear a little voice saying, "You're being cheated! You can make as much money as your husband. You're wasting your life at home while he gets to have a career. What if something happens to him? How will you take care of the kids?"

So, the wife gets a job and hands over her responsibilities to someone else. While she's busy working, guess who's left vulnerable? The kids, and the one who comes to take advantage of this is the devil.

When couples start fighting, it's often because the devil is trying to distract them so he can influence their kids. He's not interested in the husband or wife; his target is the children.

If a husband suddenly finds other women showing interest in him, he shouldn't think it's because he's become more attractive. Let the husband know that when a snake holds his gaze at a frog, it is not because the frog is handsome or pretty, the snake is just being a snake and frogs are what they eat. It's just a distraction to ruin his family. I asked a young wife who was spying on her husband to gather evidence of cheating: while she was doing that, who was looking after her kids? When she got back, would her kids still be the same?

Think about the hen and her chicks. As long as she's alert, no one can steal her chicks. But if she gets distracted, what then?

### **2. Forbidden Knowledge:**
The devil used to be in heaven, so he knows a lot. And people are curious. Wouldn't it be cool to know how angels live in heaven, how they show up on Earth, or how to make them do stuff for you? What about talking to your dead mom? This curiosity makes some people join cults to learn secret things and try to get an edge over others.

But here's the catch: the leader of these cults is in chains, and the same thing happens to anyone who climbs the ranks. Knowledge without wisdom can mess you up.

In Revelation 2:24, it says:

> *24 “But the rest of you in Thyatira have not followed this evil teaching; you have not learned what the others call ‘the deep secrets of Satan.’ I say to you that I will not put any other burden on you.*

Occult books never use the real names of demons because of Christ. Instead, they use names from the Bible or call them saints. People who read these books often end up messed up. Let God's spirit help you decide what to read and what to avoid.

Remember the Garden of Eden? The devil tricked Adam and Eve with knowledge: Genesis 3:11

> _And he said, “Who told you that you were naked? Have you eaten from the tree that I commanded you not to eat from?”_

Movies often make witchcraft look cool, but it only leads to destruction.
The devil is really good at taking the truth and twisting it to lead you astray.

### **3. Masks**

When Jesus began to tell His disciples that He must go to Jerusalem and die, Peter pulled Him aside and said, “Never, Lord! This shall never happen to You.” But Jesus turned and rebuked not Peter—but the one _behind the mask._

 **Matthew 16:21–23 (NIV):**  
> 21 From that time on Jesus began to explain to his disciples that he must go to Jerusalem and suffer many things at the hands of the elders, the chief priests and the teachers of the law, and that he must be killed and on the third day be raised to life.  
> 22 Peter took him aside and began to rebuke him. “Never, Lord!” he said. “This shall never happen to you!”  
> 23 Jesus turned and said to Peter, “Get behind me, Satan! You are a stumbling block to me; you do not have in mind the concerns of God, but merely human concerns.”

The devil rarely shows his true face. He prefers masks—human faces through which he speaks, reasons, and persuades. When he wanted to discourage Jesus, he did not appear with horns and smoke. He wore Peter’s face. Peter’s concern seemed friendly, even loving, but it carried a poison designed to derail God’s plan. Jesus saw past the mask.

Satan’s art of deception lies in his ability to **hide behind familiarity**. He can speak through a friend who tells you, “Live a little—try this,” or through a teacher who mocks your faith to make you feel small. He can wear the face of a parent, a mentor, or a leader. You hear the voice, you recognize the person—but if you listen closely, the words don’t sound like them anymore. The tone shifts, the motive twists, and suddenly you’re dealing with something ancient and unholy wearing human skin.

That is why 1 John 4:1–3 warns us:

 **1 John 4:1–3 (GNT):**  
> My dear friends, do not believe all who claim to have the Spirit, but test them to find out if the spirit they have comes from God. For many false prophets have gone out everywhere.  
> This is how you will be able to know whether it is God's Spirit: anyone who acknowledges that Jesus Christ came as a human being has the Spirit who comes from God.  
> But anyone who denies this about Jesus does not have the Spirit from God. The spirit that he has is from the Enemy of Christ; you heard that it would come, and now it is here in the world already.

Evil spirits wear people like masks—not always by possession, but through influence. They whisper thoughts into a mind until that person begins to speak those thoughts aloud. They wear a smile but speak destruction. They wear charm but carry manipulation. The mask looks human, but the intent is not.

Even rulers and powerful leaders have worn these masks unknowingly. Paul wrote in **1 Corinthians 2:8**,

> “None of the rulers of this age understood it, for if they had, they would not have crucified the Lord of glory.”

The devil’s masks are everywhere—in politics, entertainment, religion, and even friendship. The goal is the same: to trick believers into fighting flesh and blood instead of recognizing the spirit behind the mask.

To see through the mask, you must look beyond the face and listen for the source of the words.  
Does it draw you closer to Christ or away from Him?  
Does it feed your pride or humble your heart?  
Does it carry peace or provoke confusion?

The devil’s power lies in his disguise, but the Spirit of God gives discernment to those who seek it. Once you can see the mask, you can speak as Jesus did—**not to the person, but to the spirit behind it: “Get behind me, Satan.”**

### **4. The Pressure of Urgency**

> _“Be still, and know that I am God.” — Psalm 46:10_

One of the devil’s favorite tricks is **false urgency**—the pressure to act _now_ before you can think, pray, or discern. He knows that when you rush, you reason less, and when you reason less, you hear God less.

The enemy wraps his lies in time limits. He whispers, _“Decide now, or you’ll lose it.”_ He pushes you into choices that bypass peace. His goal is to make you react, not reflect—to move your feet before your spirit catches up.

Every deception feels urgent; every divine leading feels patient. God is never in a hurry. The devil always is. The Spirit invites; the enemy pressures.

So when you feel that anxious rush, that sudden _“you must act now”_ voice, pause. Breathe. Say, _“Let me think about it,”_ or _“Let me pray about it.”_ Heaven never punishes patience.

Delays that make room for discernment often save destinies. Even Jesus waited for the Father’s timing. Learn to recognize that sacred stillness. It’s in the pause that truth reveals itself.

You need to learn to say, "Let me think about it." Or, "Let me pray about it." Get used to checking in with God before you make decisions. Give yourself some time to think things through before you act.

### **5. Counterfeits:** 
The enemy is a master of imitation, producing counterfeits of everything God has established. Just as there are true prophets, apostles, teachers, and the genuine work of the Holy Spirit, Satan raises up false versions of each. One of the most dangerous counterfeits is the false spirit often referred to as the Kundalini. This deceptive spirit mimics the movements of God’s power but leads people away from the truth of Christ.

Those under the influence of the Kundalini spirit often display unsettling signs. These may include uncontrollable shaking, spasms, or strange body movements that resemble disorder rather than the peace of God. Some experience unbiblical mystical trances, so-called “energy awakenings,” or even out-of-body encounters that bear no grounding in Scripture. Others may manifest animal-like sounds, bursts of uncontrollable laughter, or a constant craving for spiritual highs and displays of “fire” or power without the fruit of humility, love, or obedience. Instead of drawing closer to Christ, such experiences often lead to resistance against Scripture, repentance, and true worship. The fruit that follows reveals its true nature—pride, confusion, restlessness, and sensuality rather than the character of the Holy Spirit.

Freedom from the Kundalini spirit requires turning away from all false teachings, occult practices, and spiritual pride that give it access. Renouncing every false impartation, including connections to new age practices, yoga, or any other open doors, is essential. In the authority of Jesus’ name, the believer must command the Kundalini spirit to depart and never return. Deliverance is not complete without inviting the Spirit of truth to fill every part of life, as Ephesians 5:18 urges. Only the true Holy Spirit can cleanse, restore, and empower believers to walk in the purity of God’s power.

### **6. Provocation:**
The devil uses provocation as one of his subtle but deadly traps against the believer. It is rarely just an impulsive moment; often it is a carefully staged scenario designed to stir up emotions and push the believer from walking in the Spirit to reacting in the flesh. By stirring up offense, insult, or injustice, the enemy engineers an environment where self-control becomes harder and the believer feels cornered emotionally. The aim of provocation is not just to make a believer angry but to shift their focus, cloud their judgment, and weaken their ability to pray or discern rightly. When provoked, many believers forget that their true struggle is not against flesh and blood but against principalities and powers, and in that blindness they direct their anger toward people instead of the real enemy.

When provocation succeeds, the chain reaction is predictable. Anger rises, self-control weakens, words are spoken hastily, actions are taken rashly, guilt and regret follow, and the believer becomes discouraged and ashamed. In this way, provocation turns a simple moment into a cycle of sin, condemnation, and spiritual dullness. The trap is further reinforced when the believer feels justified in their reaction—believing they had every right to respond harshly or fight back. This false sense of justification blinds them to repentance and keeps their heart hardened, allowing bitterness to grow. The ultimate goal is to block the flow of grace, disrupt prayer, and cut off the believer’s spiritual momentum.

This trap plays out in everyday life in many ways. At work, a colleague may deliberately take credit for your labor. The devil whispers that you must lash out and expose them, but in doing so you damage your testimony before others. In marriage or family, a sharp word from a spouse can tempt you to respond in kind, escalating a small disagreement into division and bitterness. In church, being overlooked or criticized can stir pride and push you toward withdrawal from fellowship, isolating you from the covering of the body. On the road, a careless driver can push you into reckless anger. On social media, a negative comment can stir the urge to clap back and defend your name before strangers. In each scenario, the person or event is not the real battle but only the bait; the devil waits for your reaction. The believer is not trapped until they choose to react in the flesh.

The Bible offers many examples of this trap. Moses, provoked by the constant complaints of the Israelites, struck the rock in anger instead of speaking to it as God commanded, and as a result lost the privilege of entering the Promised Land. Peter, provoked by fear and zeal when Jesus was arrested, cut off the ear of the high priest’s servant, only to be rebuked by the Lord. King Saul, provoked by the women’s song that praised David above him, gave in to jealousy and bitterness, which ultimately led to his downfall. Job’s wife, in his suffering, urged him to curse God and die, yet Job resisted the provocation and held his integrity. At the cross, Jesus Himself endured the sharpest provocation as He was mocked and challenged to prove Himself, but He chose silence and forgiveness, fulfilling God’s plan and breaking the enemy’s hold. These case studies show how provocation can bring down even great men of God when they react, but also how victory comes when the trap is resisted.

The key lesson is that provocation is like bait on a hook. The fish is not trapped until it bites, and the believer is not trapped until they react in the flesh. The safeguard is awareness, humility, and Spirit-led self-control. Recognize that the real enemy is unseen, pause and pray before reacting, guard your heart, and forgive quickly. To overcome provocation, believers must choose to respond in the Spirit rather than in the heat of the moment, for in that choice lies the difference between falling into the devil’s snare and walking in victory.

### **7. Flattery:**
The devil often uses flattery as a subtle weapon to disarm and manipulate. Unlike open attack or provocation, flattery approaches softly, stroking the ego and feeding pride. By pretending to admire what you admire and like what you like, he creates the illusion of agreement and support. This shared interest lowers a believer’s guard, because human nature naturally trusts those who affirm us or seem to understand us. Flattery whispers, _“You are special… you deserve more… no one else appreciates you like I do.”_ It mimics encouragement but carries poison beneath the sugar.

The danger is that flattery blinds discernment. When the enemy pretends to share your tastes or passions, he positions himself as a companion, an ally, or even a friend. Once trust is gained, manipulation follows. The believer who yields to flattery begins to make decisions not based on truth or principle, but on the desire to keep the praise flowing. Pride grows quietly, and with it, compromise. What begins as harmless compliments soon becomes leverage, as the enemy nudges you toward choices you would have resisted if you had been on guard.

The Bible warns of this tactic. Proverbs 29:5 says, _“A man who flatters his neighbor spreads a net for his feet.”_ Flattery is not love; it is bait. The devil used it in Eden when he told Eve, _“You will be like God, knowing good and evil”_ (Genesis 3:5). He made her feel elevated, as though God was withholding something she deserved. Her desire for wisdom and likeness was twisted through flattery into disobedience. The same spirit was at work when Herod accepted the crowd’s flattery calling him a god (Acts 12:22–23). Instead of giving glory to God, Herod’s pride swelled, and judgment fell immediately.

In daily life, flattery may come through people who echo your likes, your ambitions, or your struggles — but not to strengthen you, rather to control or exploit you. A friend who always agrees with your weaknesses, a colleague who praises your shortcuts, a suitor who admires only your looks but not your faith — these can be tools in the enemy’s hand. The more you drink from the well of flattery, the more blind you become to truth, correction, and God’s guidance.

The safeguard against this trap is humility and discernment. A heart anchored in God’s approval is not swayed by excessive human praise. A believer who listens for God’s voice above man’s voice will recognize when affirmation crosses the line into manipulation. Gratitude for compliments is not sin, but dependence on them is dangerous. The devil knows that what he cannot provoke through anger, he may seduce through praise.

parts.title: X
parts.markdown:
# Wet Dreams

This is a topic not often discussed in the Church, but it affects many believers, especially young men and women pursuing purity. I want to share a perspective rooted in scripture and personal conviction: wet dreams are not spiritually neutral or normal for those walking with Christ.

In secular culture, they're often seen as a normal biological response. But from a biblical perspective, they can indicate deeper spiritual issues—specifically unclean spirits or what's known in deliverance circles as _spirit spouses_ (incubi/succubi).

These are demonic entities that attempt to forge counterfeit soul ties through sexual dreams or sensations during sleep. They often manifest as seductive dreams or arousal during sleep, leading to ejaculation or orgasm. Over time, these dreams can:

- **Defile your spirit and body**, as 1 Corinthians 6:18 warns: “Flee from sexual immorality…”
- **Open doors to torment and bondage**, especially in your thought life and relationships.
- **Weaken your spiritual authority and clarity**, making it harder to hear God or walk in freedom.
    
**Signs You May Be Affected**:

-   Recurrent sexual dreams with a consistent figure or presence.
-   Feelings of shame, guilt, or spiritual heaviness after waking.
-   Patterns of relationship sabotage or disinterest in marriage.
-   Night terrors or sleep paralysis with sexual overtones.
-   Sudden or unexplained financial dryness where income is hindered, opportunities dry up, or resources seem blocked despite effort. This is often overlooked but biblically consistent with demonic interference (see Haggai 1:6).

**Breaking Free**:

1.  **Repentance and Renunciation**  
    Ask God for forgiveness for any past sexual sin (including masturbation, pornography, fornication, etc.) and renounce any spiritual agreements made knowingly or unknowingly.
	> _Heavenly Father, I come before You in humility and repentance. I confess every sin of sexual immorality—whether in thought, word, or deed. I renounce pornography, masturbation, fornication, lust, and every doorway I’ve opened to the enemy knowingly or unknowingly. I break every soul tie and covenant with spirit spouses, incubi, succubi, or any unclean spirit in Jesus’ name. I declare that I belong to Jesus Christ—spirit, soul, and body. Cleanse me with the blood of Jesus. I receive Your forgiveness, freedom, and healing. In Jesus’ name, amen._

2.  **Spiritual Warfare & Deliverance Prayer**  
    Bind and cast out any spirit of lust, incubus/succubus, or spiritual spouse in the name of Jesus. Declare your body and spirit belong to Christ alone (1 Corinthians 6:19-20).
	> _In the name of Jesus Christ, I take authority over every spirit of lust, incubus, succubus, spiritual spouse, or unclean demon that has accessed my life. I break every covenant, spiritual marriage, and soul tie with you by the power of the blood of Jesus. I command you to leave me now and never return. I bind you and cast you into the abyss, in the mighty name of Jesus. I declare my dreams are protected, my mind is renewed, and my body is a temple of the Holy Spirit. I plead the blood of Jesus over my bed, my dreams, and my subconscious. From this day forward, I walk in freedom. Amen._

3.  **Fasting and Prayer**  
    Some breakthroughs require deeper consecration (Mark 9:29). Set aside time to fast and seek God's deliverance.
4.  **Close Doors**  
    Remove materials, music, or media that feed lust or open demonic doors.
5.  **Cover Yourself Before Sleep**  
    Pray Psalm 91 aloud, plead the blood of Jesus over your dreams, and declare your sleep is protected.
6. **Anoint Yourself with Oil:** Anointing yourself with consecrated oil (e.g., olive oil prayed over) is a biblical act of sanctification (James 5:14, Exodus 30:30). Place a drop on your forehead and declare:
	> _"I consecrate myself—spirit, soul, and body—to the Lord Jesus Christ. Let this anointing be a sign of the Holy Spirit's presence and power over my life. No defilement, no demon, and no spirit spouse has any place in me. I am covered by the blood of Jesus and sealed by the Holy Spirit. In Jesus’ name, amen."_

This might sound intense or strange to some, but the spiritual realm is real, and our bodies are temples of the Holy Spirit. If this resonates with you, I urge you not to ignore it. You’re not alone, and freedom is possible in Christ.

You may want to hear others' experiences, wisdom, or scriptures that have helped in this area.

**Spirit Spouses Are Intelligent and Deceptive**

One thing many people don’t realize is that spirit spouses are not just sexual; they are highly intelligent, manipulative spirits. Their ultimate goal is not just to defile your body, but to keep you in spiritual bondage, away from true intimacy with God and healthy, God-ordained relationships.

These spirits often operate under deep deception, even masquerading as divine or religious voices. Remember, Satan himself can appear as “an angel of light” (2 Corinthians 11:14). In some cases, they will:

-   **Instruct you to do religious activities** (like fasting, praying a certain way, or isolating from others), not to grow closer to God, but to keep you busy, misdirected, and proud in your spiritual acts, all while they remain undetected.
-   **Convince you it’s God speaking**, urging you toward actions that seem holy but actually lead to legalism, spiritual dryness, or confusion.
-   **Distract you from discerning their presence**, using emotional manipulation, false visions, or seduction masked as “comfort” or “spiritual dreams.”
    
This is why discernment and deliverance are vital. We must test every spirit (1 John 4:1) and ask the Holy Spirit to expose any unclean spirit pretending to be of God.

Don’t fall for the trap of thinking that because you’re doing religious things, you’re immune. If something is feeding off your energy, robbing your peace, or hiding in secrecy, it needs to be confronted in the name of Jesus Christ.

**Spirit Spouses Can Distort Gender Identity**

Another often-overlooked effect of spirit spouses is how they can distort a person’s perception of their own gender or sexuality. These spirits don’t just bring lust or defilement — they bring confusion. As with all demonic assignments, the goal is to attack God’s original design for identity, relationships, and the human body.

Spirit spouses may:

-   **Cause a man to feel emasculated**, emotionally unstable, or sexually passive — struggling with confidence, fatherhood, or healthy masculinity.
-   **Cause a woman to feel overly dominant**, aggressive, or disconnected from her feminine identity — struggling with submission, nurture, or intimacy.
-   Introduce **same-sex dreams, fantasies, or confusion** even if the person has never consciously invited such thoughts.
-   Exploit childhood trauma or abuse to reinforce gender dysphoria or discomfort in one’s biological sex.
    

These attacks are intentional and spiritual. They're meant to uproot your God-given identity and replace it with one shaped by spiritual bondage and lies.

But the good news is: Jesus came to restore us — spirit, soul, and body (1 Thessalonians 5:23). When these spirits are renounced and cast out, clarity, peace, and a healthy sense of gender identity can return by the power of the Holy Spirit.

**Spirit Spouses and Waking Up in Anger**
One of the more subtle but destructive effects of spirit spouses is the emotional disturbance they bring — especially waking up in sudden, unexplainable anger.

Many believers experience mornings where they wake up irritated, agitated, or even furious, despite having no clear reason why. This is not just emotional or physical — it is often spiritual warfare in the realm of dreams.

Spirit spouses can:

- **Influence your emotions while you sleep**, planting unrest, conflict, or bitterness through dreams.
- **Stir up feelings of rejection, jealousy, or rage**, especially if your soul is entangled with these spirits.
- Use anger as a way to set the tone for your day, disrupting your peace, prayer life, and relationships from the moment you rise.
- Mimic the feeling of spiritual oppression, making it difficult to even **want to pray or seek God** when you wake up.

This kind of attack is not from God. James 1:20 says, _“The anger of man does not produce the righteousness of God.”_ If you find yourself consistently waking up angry or emotionally off-balance, it’s worth asking the Holy Spirit to reveal any spiritual cause — including the presence of spirit spouses.

Deliverance brings peace. When the stronghold is broken, mornings can once again become a time of joy, clarity, and communion with God.

Stay pure and stay free.

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Marriage

1. What is the purpose of marriage? Malachi 2:15
> Has not the one God made you? You belong to him in body and spirit. And what does the one God seek? Godly offspring. So be on your guard, and do not be unfaithful to the wife of your youth.
2. Was Eve inside Adam in the beginning? Genesis 2:23
> The man said, “This is now bone of my bones and flesh of my flesh; she shall be called ‘woman,’ for she was taken out of man.”
3. When God wanted to give Adam a helper, did God take Eve out of Adam, or form Eve from elsewhere?
4. Were Adam and Eve one flesh in the beginning?
5. Which two individuals come together to form a marriage?
6. Which two individuals make up Man, in a marriage? Matthew 19:4-6
>4 “Haven’t you read,”  he replied,  “that at the beginning the Creator ‘made them male and female,’  5 and said, ‘For this reason a man will leave his father and mother and be united to his wife, and the two will become one flesh’?  6 So they are no longer two, but one flesh...”
7. Why must Husband and Wife become one Man before getting married to God?
8. If the children in a marriage do not know God, nor love God, is the marriage successful?
9. When you have not been able to teach every good thing in you to the children of the marriage, is the marriage a success?
10. When the children of the marriage do not fear God, is the marriage serving its purpose?
11. How is marriage like a factory?
12. When you build a factory, do you judge the quality of the factory by the beauty of the factory or by the quality of the product of the factory?
13. Do you build a factory that produces nothing?
14. Is a marriage useful when it is not raising new spirits in the image of God?
15. Can Man do something for God or with God? 
16. What is the reason for your answer?
17. Give examples of how Man works with God. 
18. Does Man raise the new spirits by themselves or with God?
19. Give examples of how Man can raise new spirits with God.
20. How do the Father, Son, and Spirit work together as one? Genesis 1:26 
> Then God said, “Let us make mankind in our image, in our likeness...
21. Does the Father say to the other Gods "I am the head, everything that I say is final?"
22. If you exist today, what made it possible?
23. Should humans do their things like God?
24. Is the Husband the head of the marriage?
25. Is the Wife the head of the marriage? 
26. Who is the head of the marriage?
27. How many wives did God give Adam?
28. How many partners do you need to make Man in a marriage?
29. How do the Husband and Wife become one Man?
30. Is the Husband and the Wife one Man because they wear matching clothes? 
31. Is the Husband and the Wife one Man because they live in the same house? 
32. Is the Husband and the Wife one Man because they sleep in the same bed? 
33. Is the Husband and the Wife one Man because they have made promises to each other? 
34. How can the Husband and the Wife work together as one Man when it comes to punishing their children?
35. Can the child run to one of the parents when both have agreed that the child must be punished?
36. How can the Husband and the Wife work together as one Man to find a school for their child?
37. How can the Husband and the Wife work together as one Man when it comes to finding a school for their child when they both do not agree on the school that their child should attend?
38. How can the Husband and the Wife work together as one Man to decide the best way to raise their children?
39. What are the benefits of two joining together as one Man, in marriage?
40. Give examples of how two becoming one Man in marriage makes the Husband and the Wife safe.
41. Give examples of how two becoming one Man in marriage makes the Husband and the Wife more likely to achieve their purpose in the marriage.
42. If Eve had told Adam about the serpent and waited for Adam to agree, would she have eaten the forbidden fruit?

parts.title: II
parts.markdown:
# Marriage II

1. When the Husband and the Wife have become one Man, what is the glue that will keep them together, and prevent them from getting separated?
2. Can the two stay together as one Man when they do not know how to forgive each other?
3. Can the two stay together as one Man when they do not have self-control?
4. Can the two stay together as one Man when they do not know how to make sacrifices?
5. Can the two stay together as one Man when they are not tolerant?
6. Can your two legs walk together in the same direction when they cannot agree on where they are going?
7. How do you develop character?
8. How do you strengthen character?
9. Is the best time to develop character, when you are a child or an adult?
10. When you drag your feet while walking, what can go wrong with your character when you grow up?
11. When you sleep a lot and wake up when you want, what could go wrong with your character when you grow up?
12. When you can do something today, yet you say to yourself that you will do it tomorrow, what could go wrong with your character when you grow up?
13. When you respond to every disagreement with an insult or your fist, what could go wrong with your character when you grow up?
14. When you complain when you ask your parents for something, and they ask you to wait, what could go wrong with your character when you grow up?
15. Can you develop character in a day? 
16. Can you strengthen your character in a day?
17. A person who helped their mother for one day, and a person who helped their mother for more than a year, without being forced, who is more helpful?
18. In what practical ways can you develop and strengthen your character when you are young?
19. If you cannot take care of a plant, can you take care of a human being?
20. If you cannot take care of a pet, can you take care of your children?
21. In what ways does gardening develop and strengthen your character? 
22. How does gardening teach you patience?
23. How does gardening teach you hard work?
24. How does gardening teach you discipline?
25. How does gardening teach you to be mindful of important things?
26. How does gardening teach you how to care for others?
27. In what ways does raising a pet develop and strengthen your character?
28. How does raising a pet teach you discipline?
29. How does raising a pet teach you how to care for others?
30. How does raising a pet teach you to be mindful of important things?
31. How does raising a pet teach you to be consistent?
32. Does the training for marriage begin when you are young, or when you are an adult and you have already found a partner?
33. Were the things you wanted the most as a child always the same things that you wanted the most as you grew up?
34. What is something that you wanted when you were a child, but now that you are older, you no longer want it?
35. What changed about you as you grew older?
36. Is your mind still developing?
37. Should you choose a marriage partner when you are a child or when you are an adult?
38. What could go wrong when you choose a marriage partner when you are a child and you later grow up?

parts.title: III
parts.markdown:
# Marriage III

1. Can a person be beautiful on the outside, yet ugly on the inside?
2. Can a person be ugly on the outside, yet beautiful on the inside?
3. Can you tell a person's character by their looks?
4. When the two become one Man, what is the glue that holds them together?
5. Who is the best judge of character?
6. Can you choose any partner at all to be joined together as one Man?
7. What could go wrong when you join with the wrong partner?
8. How can joining with the wrong partner affect the development of the child in the marriage?
9. How do you know that a person will make a good partner in a marriage?
10. Who is the head of the marriage?
11. Who is the best person to decide if two individuals are suitable to be joined together as one Man, in a marriage?
12. Why did Samuel go to Jesse's house? 1 Samuel 16:1-13
13. If Samuel had anointed Eliab with his oil, would Eliab have been the rightful King over Israel?
14. Was David anointed before he was chosen, or was he first chosen and then anointed?
15. Was it the oil that made David the rightful King, or God's choice, and the oil was only meant to indicate that he had been chosen?
16. Why did God choose David to be King over Israel and not his brothers?
17. Are the two partners joining together, blessed because a pastor prays and anoints them, or are they blessed because God approves of them joining together as one Man?
18. Are the two partners joining together blessed because their friends think they are great together, or are they blessed because God approves of them joining together as one Man?
19. Are the two partners joining together blessed because their parents agree that they are good together, or are they blessed because God approves of them joining together as one Man?
20. Are the two partners joining together blessed because they have signed a piece of paper, or are they blessed because God approves of them joining together as one Man?
21. Who joins together man and woman to form Man in a marriage? Mark 10:9
> Therefore what God has joined together, let no one separate.
22. What are some things that God considers before deciding that the two will make suitable partners?
23. Is God able to work in connection with his ministering angels and spiritual agencies to connect two individuals who must join together in a marriage? Genesis 24:1-7
> 24 Abraham was now very old,  and the  Lord  had blessed  him in every way.  2 He said to the senior servant  in his household, the one in charge of all that he had,  “Put your hand under my thigh.  3 I want you to swear  by the  Lord, the God of heaven  and the God of earth,  that you will not get a wife for my son  from the daughters of the Canaanites,  among whom I am living,  4 but will go to my country and my own relatives  and get a wife for my son Isaac.”
>
>5 The servant asked him, “What if the woman is unwilling to come back with me to this land?  Shall I then take your son back to the country you came from?”
>
>6 “Make sure that you do not take my son back there,”  Abraham said.  7 “The  Lord, the God of heaven,  who brought me out of my father’s household and my native land and who spoke to me and promised me on oath, saying, ‘To your offspring I will give this land’—he will send his angel before you so that you can get a wife for my son from there.
24. Who do angels take their instructions from? Psalm 91:11-12
>11 For he will command his angels  concerning you  to guard you in all your ways;  
12 they will lift you up in their hands, so that you will not strike your foot against a stone.
25. Who came up with the institution of marriage?
26. Can you possibly want marriage more than the one who came up with the idea of marriage and instituted it?
27. Can the covenant between the two, be destroyed by signing a piece of paper?
28. When you leave your partner to be joined with another partner, what sin have you committed? Matthew 19:9
> 6 So they are no longer two, but one flesh. Therefore what God has joined together, let no one separate.”
>
>7 “Why then,” they asked, “did Moses command that a man give his wife a certificate of divorce and send her away?”
>
>8 Jesus replied,  “Moses permitted you to divorce your wives because your hearts were hard. But it was not this way from the beginning.  9 I tell you that anyone who divorces his wife, except for sexual immorality, and marries another woman commits adultery.”
29. When someone cheats in an exam, do they gain an unfair advantage over their peers?  
30. When a husband or wife sleeps with another person, do they gain an unfair advantage over their spouse?  
31. Is sleeping with another partner called *cheating*, gaining an unfair advantage over your spouse, or *fornicating* and *adultery*?
32. Should the child of God allow the world to corrupt their terms and definitions?
33. Has the person who commits adultery defiled the marriage covenant?
34. Is divorce sinful?
35. If divorce is sinful, why do many Believers *so-called* practice it?
36. Can you marry a person who has been divorced? Matthew 5:32
> But I tell you that anyone who divorces his wife, except for sexual immorality, makes her the victim of adultery, and anyone who marries a divorced woman commits adultery.
37. When you are getting married with the intent that when things go wrong you will leave your partner, do you respect the marriage covenant?
38. When you are getting married with the intent that when things go wrong you will leave your partner, should you enter the marriage covenant in the first place?
39. In what ways does marriage benefit the husband and the wife?
40. In what ways does marriage benefit the child?
41. Is marriage designed for service, enjoyment, or both?
42. Pray, committing your marriage into God's hands.
43. Exercise:
	Based on what you have learned about marriage, design a blueprint for it, starting with finding a partner, meeting them, courtship, and sealing the marriage with a ceremony.
	- State the reasons for your design choices.
	- Find out about how marriage is organized by your tribe, and write about it, stating the significance of every aspect of it.

parts.title: IV
parts.markdown:
# Marriage IV

1. When you put food in your mouth and swallow it, does it travel through parts of your body that you do not even know about or directly have access to? 
2. Why has God hidden these parts of your body from everyone else, including you?
3. When a person has access to these parts of your body can they inflict serious damage on yourself? 
4. When you find food on the table in some random place and it is not covered, should you put it in your mouth and swallow it?
5. What is the reason for your answer?
6. When you are eating food or drinking with your friends, and you leave them to use the washroom, on your return, should you continue eating or drinking if you left your food or drink uncovered and unprotected?
7. What is the reason for your answer?
8. What could go wrong if you continue eating or drinking as if you never left your drink or food?
9. In what ways can other people have access to parts of your body that are hidden from everyone else, including yourself?
10. When do we say that a person is intimate with someone?
11. What is the highest form of intimacy in a marriage, between husband and wife? Genesis 4:1
> And Adam *knew* Eve his wife; and she conceived, and bare Cain, and said, I have gotten a man from the Lord.
12. Is there anything casual about sex?
13. What is the reason for your answer?
14. Is sex sacred, and only reserved for marriage?
15. When you eat food that has already been opened, and you die from it, what really killed you?
16. Is sexual intercourse the final step in joining the two as one? Matthew 1:25
> But he did not consummate their marriage until she gave birth to a son. And he gave him the name Jesus.
17. Does sex join two individuals?

parts.title: V
parts.markdown:
# Marriage V
Marriage Blueprint
1. What can you learn from this? Jeremiah 6:16
> 16 This is what the  Lord  says:
>
>“Stand at the crossroads and look;  
ask for the ancient paths,  
ask where the good way  is, and walk in it,  
and you will find rest for your souls.  
But you said, ‘We will not walk in it.’
2. Should the individual who is ready to get married first obtain permission from God to join his marriage institution?
3. Should the individual ready to get married be the one to choose their spouse?
4. What could go wrong if an individual chooses their spouse?
5. Who is most suited to choose a spouse for an individual? Genesis 2:21-23
> 21 And the  Lord  God caused a deep sleep to fall upon Adam, and he slept: and he took one of his ribs, and closed up the flesh instead thereof;
>
>22 And the rib, which the  Lord  God had taken from man, made he a woman, and brought her unto the man.
>
>23 And Adam said, This is now bone of my bones, and flesh of my flesh: she shall be called Woman, because she was taken out of Man.
6. What can *dating* achieve that *friendship* cannot?
7. If you wanted to know a person for who they really were, to be joined together in marriage, becoming one flesh, would you start by disclosing your intentions to them?
8. What is the reason for your answer?
9. What could go wrong if you disclosed your intentions to them?
10. What would be the safest way to get to know someone for who they really are?
11. List other safe ways to know a person for the institution of marriage.
12. Do feelings affect our judgment and make us not see things for what they are?
13. When you start developing feelings for the opposite sex, what is the safest thing to do?
14. Can a family member, friend, worship leader, etc. assist you in getting to know someone for who they really are and provide an unbiased report?
15. Should the child of God *date*?
16. What is the closest you should get to a person you wish to know for marriage, *friendship*, or *dating*?
17. When you are sure about a person's character and alignment, what is the safest way to approach them for marriage? 
18. What is the reason for your answer?
19. What happens to your self-esteem, and self-confidence, when you are turned down?`
20. What could go wrong when you have been turned down too many times by the same person, or different people?
21. Are you likely to think something may be wrong with you even if there wasn't?
22. When you think something is wrong with you, are you likely to settle for the next person you deem compatible, even if you may not be compatible?
23. Is it safer to let a relative, or worship leader, approach the person on your behalf?
24. When both partners have agreed to marry, should they at least get to know each other before their marriage is sealed?
25. What is the reason for your answer?
26. How should they conduct themselves during courtship?
27. Should they do things that will make them develop feelings for each other, affecting their judgment?
28. What are some actions that when repeated over time will make a person emotionally attached to another?
29. Should courtship last too long?
30. What could go wrong when courtship lasts too long?
31. What are some things that when they do will make them develop feelings and not see things for what they really are?
32. What are some important questions to ask each other during courtship?
33. How would you know that you are not about to commit any of these sexual sins with the person you are joining with, in the marriage? Leviticus  18
34. Who must witness the marriage, besides the families of both partners? Malachi 2:14
> 14 You ask, “Why?” It is because the Lord is the witness between you and the wife of your youth. You have been unfaithful to her, though she is your partner, the wife of your marriage covenant.
35. What changes would you make to your marriage blueprint?

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Our Body

1. What are the two main parts of the body?
2. Name the visible parts of the body.
3. Name the invisible parts of the body.
4. What does your mind do?
5. What does your invisible heart do?
6. What does your conscience do?
7. What happened to their conscience after they had received the knowledge of good and evil? Genesis 2:25, Genesis 3:7
> Genesis 2:25
> Adam and his wife were both naked, and they felt no shame.
> 
> Genesis 3:7
> Then the eyes of both of them were opened, and they realized they were naked; so they sewed fig leaves together and made coverings for themselves.
8. Can your conscience grow?
9. How do you make your conscience grow?
10. Can your conscience die?
11. How do you kill your conscience?
12. What happens to you when your conscience finally dies?

sections.question: What are the two main parts of the body?
Name the visible parts of the body.
Name the invisible parts of the body.
What does your mind do?
What does your invisible heart do?
What does your conscience do?
What happened to their conscience after they had received the knowledge of good and evil? Genesis 2:25, Genesis 3:7
sections.body:
> Genesis 2:25
> Adam and his wife were both naked, and they felt no shame.
> 
> Genesis 3:7
> Then the eyes of both of them were opened, and they realized they were naked; so they sewed fig leaves together and made coverings for themselves.

sections.question: Can your conscience grow?
How do you make your conscience grow?
Can your conscience die?
How do you kill your conscience?
What happens to you when your conscience finally dies?

parts.title: II
parts.markdown:
# Our Body II

1. What did God use in making your body?
2. Draw your dust body with a tree in your mind and your heart.
3. What things do you have to do to make leaves grow on the tree in your mind?
4. What happens to the leaves on the tree in your mind when you think bad thoughts?
5. What things do you have to do to make leaves grow on the tree in your heart?
6. What happens to the leaves on the tree in your heart when you sin?
7. Can you enter Heaven with your dust body?
8. How does God help you to enter Heaven?
9. Draw the spiritual body with dashed lines with a tree in your mind and your heart.
10. Why do you draw your spiritual body with dashed lines?
11. How does God create the tree in the mind of your spiritual body?
12. How does God create the tree in the heart of your spiritual body?
13. Where does your dust body go when God has finished copying the leaves from your mind and your heart?
14. Where does your spiritual body go when God has finished copying the leaves from your mind and your heart?
15. What happens to your spiritual body when God does not find anything in the heart and mind of your dust body, to copy into your spiritual body?
16. Who caused it?
17. Which body has life, the spiritual or dust bodies? John 6:63
> The Spirit gives life; the flesh counts for nothing. The words I have spoken to you—they are full of the Spirit and life.
18. What is the most beautiful thing in the whole world? 
19. Is the human soul more valuable than the whole world? Mark 8:36
> And what do you benefit if you gain the whole world but lose your own soul?
20. Is everybody around you that has a dust body alive?
21. When do you say that a person is dead?
22. When do you say that a person is sleeping?
23. If a person is alive and yet they are dead, how do you raise such a person from the dead? 
24. How can the dead bury their dead? Matthew 8:18-22
> 18 When Jesus saw the crowd around him, he gave orders to cross to the other side of the lake.  19 Then a teacher of the law came to him and said, “Teacher, I will follow you wherever you go.”
>20 Jesus replied,  “Foxes have dens and birds have nests, but the Son of Man  has no place to lay his head.”
>21 Another disciple said to him, “Lord, first let me go and bury my father.”
>22 But Jesus told him,  “Follow me,  and let the dead bury their own dead.”
25. Why does Jesus say all who draw the sword shall die by the sword? Matthew 26:52
> 48 Now the betrayer had arranged a signal with them: “The one I kiss is the man; arrest him.”  49 Going at once to Jesus, Judas said, “Greetings, Rabbi!”  and kissed him.
>50 Jesus replied,  “Do what you came for, friend.”
Then the men stepped forward, seized Jesus and arrested him.  51 With that, one of Jesus’ companions reached for his sword,  drew it out and struck the servant of the high priest, cutting off his ear.
>52 “Put your sword back in its place,”  Jesus said to him,  “for all who draw the sword will die by the sword.
26. How are the words of Christ full of the Spirit and life? In John 6:63
> The Spirit gives life; the flesh counts for nothing. The words I have spoken to you—they are full of the Spirit and life.
27. How is God the God of the living, when Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob are no longer with us? Mark 12:26-27
> 26 Now about the dead rising—have you not read in the Book of Moses, in the account of the burning bush, how God said to him, ‘I am the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’? 27 He is not the God of the dead,  but of the living. You are badly mistaken!”
28. How does what comes out of a person defile the person? Matthew 15:11
> 11 What goes into someone’s mouth does not defile them, but what comes out of their mouth, that is what defiles them.”
29. What is the nature of the person with a spiritual body? John 3:8
> The wind blows wherever it pleases. You hear its sound, but you cannot tell where it comes from or where it is going. So it is with everyone born of the Spirit.”
30. Would your life be predictable when you have been born of the Spirit?

sections.question: How is God the God of the living, when Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob are no longer with us? Mark 12:26-27
sections.body: > 26 Now about the dead rising—have you not read in the Book of Moses, in the account of the burning bush, how God said to him, ‘I am the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’? 27 He is not the God of the dead,  but of the living. You are badly mistaken!”

sections.question: How does what comes out of a person defile the person? Matthew 15:11
sections.body: > 11 What goes into someone’s mouth does not defile them, but what comes out of their mouth, that is what defiles them.”

sections.question: What is the nature of the person with a spiritual body? John 3:8
sections.body: > The wind blows wherever it pleases. You hear its sound, but you cannot tell where it comes from or where it is going. So it is with everyone born of the Spirit.”

sections.question: Would your life be predictable when you have been born of the Spirit?

parts.title: III
parts.markdown:
# Our Body III

1. How many selves or personalities do you have?
2. When you say "I," how many persons are you referring to? 
3. What are the three(3) selves or personalities?
4. What kind of mind does your **Animal** self have?
5. Is his mind limited?
6. Can his mind understand everything?
7. What kind of body does he have?
8. Can he easily fall sick?
9. When your animal self starts to do away with his animal nature and rather do the will of God, which self starts to grow in him?
10. What kind of mind does your **Higher** self have?
11. Is his mind capable of higher reason?
12. Can his mind understand everything?
13. What kind of body does he have?
14. Can he easily fall sick?
15. Who is your **Super self**?
16. What kind of mind does he have?
17. Is his mind infinite?
18. Can his mind understand everything?
19. What kind of body does he have?
20. Can your animal self communicate with your super self directly, like you would with a friend sitting in front of you?
21. How does your animal self communicate with your super self?
22. How does your super self communicate with your animal self?
23. When your animal mind cannot understand an answer to your prayer, what does your super self do?
24. Does your super self do the work of creating the spiritual copy of your higher self?
25. What happens to your higher and super selves when you arrive in paradise?
26. Did Christ sometimes speak as Man, and sometimes as God? Matthew 26:38, John 8:58-59
> Matthew 26:38
> Then he said to them, “My soul is overwhelmed with sorrow to the point of death. Stay here and keep watch with me.”
> 
> John 8:58-59
> 58 Jesus said to them,  “Truly, truly, I say to you, before Abraham was,  I am.”  59 So they picked up stones to throw at him, but Jesus hid himself and went out of the temple.

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Our Minds

1. Where is your mind?
2. Have you seen a Veronica bucket before?
3. Draw a picture of a Veronica bucket. 
4. When you pour water into a veronica bucket, and you open the tap, what will flow out of it?
5. Label the veronica bucket **Water**, and label the content flowing from the tap **Water**.
6. When you pour honey into a veronica bucket, and you open the tap, what will flow out of it?
7. Draw another Veronica bucket.
8. Label the veronica bucket **Honey**, and label the content flowing from the tap **Honey**.
9. When you pour soapy water into a veronica bucket, and you open the tap, what will flow out of it?
10. Draw another Veronica bucket.
11. Label the veronica bucket **Soapy water**, and label the content flowing from the tap **Soapy water**.
12. Do you know that your mind is like a Veronica bucket?
13. Why is your mind like a Veronica bucket?
14. When you put good songs in your mind, what will come out of your mouth when you sing?
15. When you put gossip in your mind, what will come out of your mouth when you meet your friends?
16. When you watch bad programs on tv, and you go to sleep at night, what will you dream about?
17. When you put God's Word in your mind, and you sit down to think, what will you think about?
18. Can your body do good when your mind is bad?
19. Can your body do bad when your mind is good? 
20. When you see a person who likes to insult, do they have a good mind or a bad mind?
21. When you see a person who is kind with their words, do they have a good mind or a bad mind?
22. When you see a person who likes to fight others, do they have a good mind or a bad mind?
23. How do you put things in your mind?
24. Should we listen to everything, if we wish to have a good mind?
25. Give examples of things that we should listen to if we wish to have a good mind.
26. What are some things that we should **not** listen to if we wish to have a good mind?
27. What should we do if someone is speaking bad words into our ears?
28. Should we look at everything if we wish to have a good mind and a good body?
29. What are some things that we should **not** watch if we wish to have a good mind?
30. What should we do if someone is showing us bad things?
31. What are the things that we can do to protect our ears from listening to bad words, and our eyes from seeing bad things?
32. What is the lamp of the body? Matthew 6:22-23
> 22 “The eye is the lamp of the body. If your eyes are healthy, your whole body will be full of light.  23 But if your eyes are unhealthy, your whole body will be full of darkness. If then the light within you is darkness, how great is that darkness!
34. If you use your eyes to see what is not good, are your eyes healthy?
35. Will your body be filled with light or darkness?
36. How dark will the darkness be in your body?

parts.title: II
parts.markdown:
# Our Minds II

1. Where is your mind?
2. How do things get inside your mind?
3. What does a seed do when you put it in the ground and water it?
4. Are the words you hear and the things you see also seeds?
5. When you hear an insult and spend all day thinking about it, how are you likely to react to the person who insulted you the next time you meet them?
6. When you decide to say or do something even more terrible to them, did the insult grow the more you thought about it?
7. When you hear a kind word and spend all day thinking about it, how are you likely to respond to the person who spoke the kind word to you when you meet them again?
8. When you decide to show them even greater kindness, did the act of kindness grow the more you thought about it? 
9. If the words you hear and the things you see are seeds, where do you sow them?
10. Is your mind like soil?
11. What is the reason for your answer?
12. Mention some TV shows and the seeds you sow in your mind by watching them.
13. Mention some radio programs and the seeds you sow in your mind by listening to them.
14. What *good* seeds can you sow in your mind by listening to your parents?
15. Do you sow seeds of obedience, respect, and good advice by listening to your parents?
16. What *good* seeds can you sow in your mind by *watching* and *listening* to your teachers?
17. When you sow a seed in your mind, can somebody take it from you?
18. If the seeds you sow in your mind cannot be taken from you then what kind of seeds should you sow in your mind, good or bad?
19. When you sow a seed in your mind, how do you make it grow?
20. When you do not think about it will it grow?
21. Do you want good or bad seeds to grow in your mind? 
22. Should you spend time thinking about the good seeds you have sowed in your mind, or the bad seeds?
23. What does the word of God in your mind, grow into, the more you think about it?
24. In what ways have the buildings around us become better, the more we thought about them after we had learned how to build houses?
25. In what ways have computers become better, the more we thought about them after we had learned how to build computers?
26. Name something around you and describe how it became better, or grew, the more we thought about it.
27. What happens to a person who makes God the center of their thoughts?
28. How do you make God the center of your thoughts?
29. When someone tells you something that offends you, should you make what they have said the center of your thoughts and stop making God the center of your thoughts?
30. What should you do instead?
31. Take a look around you.
32. Did everything that you see start from the mind?
33. What is the reason for your answer?
34. Does stealing start from the mind?
35. When you catch someone stealing, was it that day the person stole the item?
36. What is the reason for your answer?
37. Does showing kindness start from the mind?
38. When a person shows an act of kindness, was it that day that the person showed the act of kindness?
39. What is the reason for your answer?
40. How did the world, and all creation start from the mind?
41. Would you produce good and beautiful things if your mind is bad?
42. Name some things around you, and describe how they started from the mind.
43. Is your mind a *place*?
44. What seeds do you have to sow in your mind for it to become like a *beautiful city*?
45. Do you want your mind to become like a beautiful city?
46. What seeds do you have to sow in your mind for it to become like a *refuse dump*?
47. Do you want your mind to become like a refuse dump?
48. What seeds do you have to sow in your mind for it to become like a *desert*?
49. Do you want your mind to become like a hot, dry, desert?
50. Is the mind a powerful tool?
51. Should we protect our minds from bad seeds, at all costs?
52. What are some things that we can do to protect our minds from bad seeds?
53. Close your eyes for a minute and think about God's greatness and how he can do so many wonderful things, such as making the sun never show up late and keeping the moon always on course.
54. Pray, telling God you will make him the center of your thoughts. He should help you to do so.
