parts.title: III
parts.markdown:
# Our Minds III
Mind Functions
1. What are mind functions?
2. What are some of the functions of your mind?
3. Can your mind know *know* things?
4. Can your mind *understand* things?
5. Can your mind learn *wisdom*?
6. What is a *fact*?
7. When a raindrop falls in the ocean, and you are not aware of it, can you consider it as a fact or something that you know?
8. What is knowledge?
9. Which mind function enables you to be *aware* of facts?
10. When you are not *aware* of a fact, can you consider it as knowledge?
11. The ant knows its food and where to find them, knows the seasons, and also knows that the seasons change in a year. Give examples of knowledge that you also have.
12. What is *earned* knowledge?
13. Give examples of *earned* knowledge.
14. What is *unearned* knowledge?
15. Is unearned knowledge also called revelation?
16. Give examples of *unearned* knowledge.
17. When you hear a word, but you cannot make a connection between the word and any other thing that you are already aware of, do you understand the word?
18. When you are aware of two facts but are *not* aware of how the facts are related, or how a change in one fact affects the other, do you understand?
19. When do you say that you understand something?
20. Which mind function enables you to understand things?
21. The ant knows that food is plentiful in some seasons, whereas food is scarce in other seasons. Give examples of understanding that you also have.
22. Can you understand something that you do not know?
23. When trying to understand something and the knowledge that you have is not enough, do you stop obtaining knowledge or do you seek more knowledge?
24. Can knowledge lead to understanding when it is not *ordered*?
25. Give examples of how *ordered* knowledge leads to understanding
26. Give examples of how *unordered* knowledge makes understanding difficult or almost impossible
27. What is wisdom?
28. Which mind function enables you to learn wisdom?
29. The ant *knows* the seasons, that the seasons change, and *understands* that the seasons affect the availability of food. Wisdom tells the ant to gather a lot more food than it needs during summer and save more than it eats. Give examples of knowledge, leading to understanding, then finally leading to wisdom.
30. What are some amazing things that you can do with wisdom?
31. Does wisdom see all things at once, the end from the beginning?
32. What is the reason for your answer?
33. Give examples of how wisdom sees the end from the beginning, making God or even your parents try to stop you when you start forming certain habits.
34. Does wisdom knowing the end from the beginning mean that the end *cannot* be changed, even if you changed your habits, or what you are doing now?
35. Can you have understanding without knowledge?
36. Can you have wisdom without knowledge and understanding?
37. How are the three (3) mind functions connected?
38. In Hosea 4:6 why are God's people destroyed?
> My people are destroyed for lack of knowledge; because you have rejected knowledge, I reject you from being a priest to me. And since you have forgotten the law of your God, I also will forget your children.
39. Which mind function is crucial for the two (2) higher mind functions to do their work?
40. Man learns about creatures that are too tiny for the eyes to see. Man also learns that these creatures, when they find themselves inside the human body, can cause harm such as sicknesses and diseases. Man, therefore, decides to wash his hands before eating and bathing twice a day.
	1. In which part of this process can knowledge be found?
	2. In which part of this process can you find understanding?
	3. Where is wisdom in this process?
41. Man learns that he is not perfect. He also learns that others are not perfect and that offenses are bound to happen. Man learns that responding to an offense with violence will cause others to also respond with violence, which will in turn also lead to more violence, which will end in the destruction of everyone and everything that they had ever created. Man decides to forgive before he is even offended.
	1. In which part of this process can knowledge be found?
	2. In which part of this process can you find understanding?
	3. Where is wisdom in this process?
42. How does knowledge lead to understanding, which leads to wisdom, which says that you must first seek before you find? Matthew 7:7
> Ask and it will be given to you; seek and you will find; knock and the door will be opened to you.
43. How do the three (3) mind functions work together to make you a better version of yourself, and overcome your challenges?
44. Does learning God's laws teach you wisdom? Leviticus 19:29
> “’Do not degrade your daughter by making her a prostitute, or the land will turn to prostitution and be filled with wickedness.
45. What is the reason for your answer?
46. Read the Gospels (Matthew, Mark, Luke, John), Acts, Proverbs, and Psalms.

parts.title: IV
parts.markdown:
# Our Minds IV
Beauty Mind Function
1. Give examples of some beautiful things around you.
2. Can a human being be beautiful?
3. Can a house be beautiful?
4. Can a plant be beautiful?
5. Can a person have beautiful thoughts?
6. Can a person have a beautiful character?
7. What exactly makes something beautiful?
8. Are all things equally beautiful, or do different things differ in beauty?
9. Can you tell when one thing is better, prettier, or more beautiful than another?
10. How can you tell if one thing is better, prettier, or more beautiful than another?
11. Can you tell what makes one person more beautiful than another person?
12. Which mind function enables you to identify beauty in a thing and tell the extent to which the thing is beautiful?
13. Can something that looks beautiful to you today, look ugly after you have seen a better version of the same thing, later on?
14. Give examples of things that looked beautiful years ago, but no longer look beautiful when you look at them now.
15. In what way does the Beauty Mind Function work to advance you, or make you a better person, with time?
16. When you do not see beauty in the character of your parents, will you attempt to have the same character?
17. If you do not see beauty in the way your teacher dresses will you attempt to dress like them?
18. Does everybody have a Beauty Mind Function?
19. How can you use the Beauty Mind Function in others, to advance them, or make the people around you, better?
20. Can you change the way an entire community dresses, by dressing properly yourself? 
21. Can you change the way a whole community behaves, by showing them a better way to behave, and not utter a single word about their behavior?
22. In Acts 4:13, how were Christ's disciples advanced by their Beauty Mind Function after spending time with Christ?
>When they saw the courage of Peter and John and realized that they were unschooled, ordinary men, they were astonished and they took note that these men had been with Jesus.
23. In what ways can you improve the way that people dress in your community, through their Beauty Mind Function?
24. In what ways can you improve the way that people treat each other in your community, through their Beauty Mind Function?
25. In what ways can you improve the way that people treat strangers in your community, through their Beauty Mind Function?
26. In what ways can you improve the way that people speak with others in your community, through their Beauty Mind Function?
27. Does God love beauty, and only does exquisite things?
28. Should his children also love beauty and only do what is exquisite?

Which mind function enables you to identify beauty in a thing and tell the extent to which the thing is beautiful?
Can something that looks beautiful to you today, look ugly after you have seen a better version of the same thing, later on?
Give examples of things that looked beautiful years ago, but no longer look beautiful when you look at them now.
In what way does the Beauty Mind Function work to advance you, or make you a better person, with time?
When you do not see beauty in the character of your parents, will you attempt to have the same character?
If you do not see beauty in the way your teacher dresses will you attempt to dress like them?
Does everybody have a Beauty Mind Function?
How can you use the Beauty Mind Function in others, to advance them, or make the people around you, better?
Can you change the way an entire community dresses, by dressing properly yourself?
Can you change the way a whole community behaves, by showing them a better way to behave, and not utter a single word about their behavior?
In Acts 4:13, how were Christ's disciples advanced by their Beauty Mind Function after spending time with Christ?
sections.body: >When they saw the courage of Peter and John and realized that they were unschooled, ordinary men, they were astonished and they took note that these men had been with Jesus.

sections.question: In what ways can you improve the way that people dress in your community, through their Beauty Mind Function?
In what ways can you improve the way that people treat each other in your community, through their Beauty Mind Function?
In what ways can you improve the way that people treat strangers in your community, through their Beauty Mind Function?
In what ways can you improve the way that people speak with others in your community, through their Beauty Mind Function?
Does God love beauty, and only does exquisite things?
Should his children also love beauty and only do what is exquisite?

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Parenting Training Guide
Overview

1. **Children are arrows. An arrow is useful when:**
	- Sharpened
	- Wielded by a master marksman
	- Aimed at a specific problem
2. **Children are sharpened by:**
	- Protecting them
	- Developing Mind
	- Developing Character
	- Shaping their Will 
4. **Society is reformed through children, not adults**
	- *God reforms the whole world through Abraham's seed*
	- *God gives Isaac a special kind of civilization*
	- Polygamy to Monogamy
	- Polytheism to Monotheism
	- Marriage ideals
	- Dressing
	- How men and women treat each other
	- From *taking no prisoners* to *Mercy*
	- *Why did God make Abraham wait for so long before having Isaac?*
	- *What specific target are you raising your children for?*
5.  **The child is the prize of the marriage**
	- *You can judge the quality and usefulness of the marriage by the quality of the child in the marriage*
	- *If you lose the child, you have lost the marriage*
	- *Marriage is more than companionship, it is to raising new spirits in the image of God*
6. **You have to win the love of the child**
	- *The child is not yours by birth, you have to win them over to yourself, with love*
	- *God contends for the love of his children, and so should you*
	- Deuteronomy 6:5
	> You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, with all your soul, and with all your strength.
	
	- *Love must be reciprocated* 
	- Why did God make Abraham attempt to sacrifice his son Isaac, and then later tell him to stop when he sees that Abraham is willing to do it?
	- *How do you win the child over to yourself with love?*
	- The child must minister love to their parents
	- They do not have money, but they can share their prayers
	- *When the child does not love you in return, can you raise and establish them?*
	- *The child must reach a point in their lives where they consider the effects of their actions on their parents, before carrying them out*
	- *They must do things for their parents, not because they like it, but because it will please their parents*
	- *Did Christ obey the Father in all things because he enjoyed it?*
	- Matthew 26:39
	> He went a little farther and fell on His face, and prayed, saying, “O My Father, if it is possible,  let this cup pass from Me; nevertheless,  not as I will, but as You  _will._”
	
7. **You have to win the respect of your child**
	- *You may play with your child, but you and your child are not playmates*
	- *It matters how you dress*
	- *It matters how you speak*
	- *It matters how you behave around them*
	- *It matters how other people interact with you, eg. husband, strangers, etc*
	- *A little bent tree can only be straightened by a straight stick*
	- *Some children will struggle to tell you all their parents have said in a day because they completely disregard what they say*
8. **You have to win the trust of the child**
	- *The child cannot call you a liar, even playfully*
	- *The child must have absolute trust and respect for their parents.*
	- *Rebuke the child the moment they do this.*
9. **You cannot parent the child from a distance**
	- *The parent of the child is the one with the child.*
	- *The parent observes the child and takes steps to align them.*
	- *Unlikely parents of the child: Peers, Strangers, Influencers*
10. **Parenting is communal**
	- *You cannot parent the child alone*
	- *Example of the child who was meeting up with a rasta man to have her virginity broken, and I was the only one there to stop it*
	- *Sometimes we can assign new parents to children who are not being actively parented*
	- *Example of the girl who sits by the roadside with her legs spread apart and her panties showing for everyone to see*
11. **Parenting is a choice**
	- *You can choose to parent other people's children*
	- *You can choose to parent your children* 
	- *The person who treats the child like their own child is the parent of the child*
	- *Sometimes the parent of the child is an unlikely fellow*

parts.title: II
parts.markdown:
# Parenting Training Guide II
Protecting the child

1. **Two (2) kingdoms will fight to wield the child as arrows; Light and Darkness**
	- *God intends to reform the world, one generation at a time, through children, so that the world is progressively getting better*
	- *Satan also has a culture that he wishes to establish in the earth, hopefully through the child*
	- *Do you want your children to be shaped by the Kingdom of Darkness or the Kingdom of Light?*
2. **The child is a seed**
	- *Seeds carry potential*
	- *The child is a well of potential for solving most human problems*
	- *The seed is easier to destroy than the tree*
	- *Not all children are able to manifest their potential*
	- *What does the dragon want with an unborn child?*
	- Revelation 12:4
	> His tail drew a third of the stars of heaven and threw them to the earth. And the dragon stood before the woman who was ready to give birth, to devour her Child as soon as it was born.
	
3. **Your number one responsibility towards the child is to protect them**
	- *Not food, shelter, money, etc*
	- *Do not just protect the body of the child, but their minds as well*
	- *Christ, the saviour of the world, had to be relocated until the right time for his own safety and the safety of his assignment.*
4. **Listen to their stories after school to gather intelligence**
	- *Example of Erica's friend's attempt to introduce her to witchcraft*
	> My friend tells me that when you sleep at night, your spirit will be flying around.
	- *Example of a boy whose friend hits them on their spine when playing*
	> 	There is this boy in my school. Anytime I play with him he will hit
	> me on my spine.

5. **Sit by the beds on weekends and inquire about what is going on in their lives**
	- *This is like a blank cheque making the child bring up things they would not have shared with their parents*
	- *Their guard is also down*
6. **Establish a policy of walking in pairs (in extreme cases where there is little to no supervision)**
	- > Ama and Sewa are sisters living in the same household. Sewa, the older one, is in her teenage years.
		>
		>One evening around 9 p.m., I suddenly had a craving for fruits and decided to head into town with a friend. As we approached the junction near their home, we saw Ama and Sewa walking back from the far end of the neighborhood.
		>
		>As I usually do when I see children out late, I asked my regular question: _“Where are you coming from, and where are you going?”_  
		Sewa started to answer, but Ama quickly cut in, urging her not to lie. They admitted they had gone out with a male family friend and were just returning from the pharmacy.
		>
		>I asked, _“What did you go to the pharmacy for?”_
		>
		>Sewa hesitated. Then, with a little prompting from Ama to be honest, she finally revealed the disturbing truth. The man had planned to sleep with Sewa that night. But when he found out that the girls always went out together and never alone—partly because they feared what I might do if I ever caught them in trouble—his plan was disrupted.
		>
		>He spent the entire outing trying to separate Sewa from Ama, but failed. They went to the pharmacy to buy condoms, but fortunately, the shop had run out. Frustrated, the man gave up and let them walk home.
		>
		>I personally walked the girls back to their house that night. The next morning, I returned to speak with their grandmother. I was firm and clear: that man was never to be allowed near their home or around the children again.
		>
		>That night, their decision to never walk alone had protected them from a serious danger.
7. **Sometimes children are stolen from their parents even though they live with them**
	- *The child eats your food, drinks your water, sleeps under your roof and yet no longer belongs to you because they obey another voice*
	- *It is during a fight between parents that a grown man driving his expensive car will stop your daughter and buy them airtime worth GHS 300.00*
	- These are dead men riding in their metal coffins
	- The child loses respect for men and begins to disregard parent's instructions
	- *When parents fight each other, the children are usually the target*
	- *Sometimes, a passenger refuses to stop arguing with a driver's mate, and the driver keeps looking back in an attempt to settle the dispute while his vehicle is moving forward. The goal is to cause an accident.*
	- *When a chicken will stand against you because you approach her chicks, and you wish to steal her chicks without any resistance, which approach will you take?*
	- > Last year, her husband—who had never shown any issues with alcohol—suddenly began drinking heavily. She believes that through her persistent efforts, alongside her mother-in-law’s support, they were able to pull him back from the brink of full-blown alcoholism.
		>
		>But this year, things took another troubling turn. He abruptly gave up drinking, only to begin chasing after other women.
		>
		>Now, she’s deeply worried—afraid of losing him entirely and even more concerned about the impact on their three children. Divorce has crossed her mind, and she’s begun wondering if she needs proof of his unfaithfulness to take that step.
		>
		>But as she spends her time following his movements—either to catch him in the act or to somehow help him find his way again—one haunting question remains:
		>
		>Who is watching over her children while she’s watching him?
		Can she be certain that the children she left at home will be the same ones she returns to?

8. **Pray for your children**
	- *Sometimes God reveals some things to us that would be impossible to detect about our children*
	- > A pastor was raising his daughter in a spiritually sound environment. She rarely left the house except to run errands, and she always returned promptly. There was never any reason to suspect that something was wrong. In their home, gospel music played constantly, and a prayerful atmosphere was carefully maintained to guard against spiritual darkness.
		>
		>The daughter mostly kept to herself in her room, only occasionally stepping out to grab a snack—usually ice cream—before retreating again. Nothing in her routine seemed unusual.
		>
		>But one day, as the pastor passed by her room, he felt an unusual prompting in his spirit to take a closer look. Out of concern, he glanced through a small upper window that provided a view into her room. What he saw left him deeply disturbed. Her behavior, though subtle and previously unnoticed, had concealed a troubling secret.
		>
		>This raised two important questions:  
		What voice prompted the pastor to look that day?
		And where had his daughter been exposed to such ideas that led her down this path?
		
9. **The mind is a soil**
	- *The words you hear with your ears, the things you see with your eyes, are seeds*
	- *The seeds grow when you think about them*
	- *When your mind is good, your body will be good*
	- *When your mind is bad, your body will also be bad*
	- *Can you watch everything, and hear everything if you wish to grow?*
	- *Should the mind be protected?*
	- > A woman who sold fruits would often pass by the home of a young girl and her mother, who also sold fruits and vegetables. One day, as usual, the fruit seller stopped to greet the girl’s mother—they were friends—and began chatting.
		>
		>During the conversation, the woman turned her attention to the child and began making inappropriate remarks about her appearance. “You’re so developed, sometimes I can’t tell if you’re a child or an adult,” she said, half-jokingly.
		>
		>The girl’s mother stood there, unsure of how to respond. She felt helpless and uncomfortable as the woman continued making comments about her daughter’s body. Though she wanted to stop it, the words never came. Eventually, the fruit seller moved on, and the moment passed—or so it seemed.
		>
		>Months later, the effects of that encounter began to surface. The young girl, once carefree, had become overly conscious of her body. She began exercising obsessively, often caught trying to "fix" her figure—despite being perfectly healthy and already in great shape. What seemed like a passing comment had planted a seed of insecurity.
		
10. **Control what the child hears and sees**
	- *Control the kind of people you bring them around, especially at funerals*
	- *Shield them from certain conversations eg. public transport, adult visitors, etc.*
	- *TV should be programmed*
	- *Example of children now into chanting and invoking spirits*
	> Bertha sings a song from her village and becomes fully possessed, she has to be retrained by strong men because the spirit wants to throw her into a flame and hit her body against the walls.
	
11. **Avoid the temptation of buying smartphones for the child's homework**
	- *Their teachers should score them anything they want and it's fine*
12. **The issue with sex movies**
	- *Damages the child's mind, polluting their thoughts*
	- *It makes them filthy making them distance themselves from God and their parents*
	-  *A demon binds them, permanently trapping them sometimes well into their old age*
	- *Sex movies and romance are not what makes a marriage last and should be removed from every device that a parent owns so the child is not exposed to it*
	- Examples of lust issues

	> *Lust will be the death of me*
	> 
	> It's over for me. Lust alone will kill me. It's the same thing every
	> day. Resist lust for a day or two. And give up. Repeat, repeat,
	> repeat. Then the conviction comes and it's right back to square one.
	> I've gotten to a point where the lord no longer lingers in my mind
	> while I do these things. It's no longer conviction. This time it was
	> different. At least this time I felt shame. I wanted to post this, for
	> whatever reason. I'm not sure. I fear I’ve committed blasphemy against
	> the holy spirit. It’s over.

	> *13-year battle with lust/porn, seeking prayer and insight*
	> 
	> 25 year old male. Raised and remain as a Christian (Pentecostal). I
	> was exposed to pornography at a very young age, it has been 13 years
	> of battling the addiction (it is an addiction at this point). Lately,
	> I have been really trying to surrender to God, trying to allow the
	> Holy Spirit to live in me, trying to have a relationship with Christ.

	> *Need advice... I'm addicted to watching porn & I desperately want to*
	> *quit.*
	> 
	> Hey everyone, I (23 M) started watching porn ever since I was a kid
	> and have been struggling to quit this addiction. I am
	> 
	> ashamed of myself for being trapped in this sin. I’ve attempted to
	> quit watching it hundreds of times but never succeeded. The excessive
	> binge-watching has left me feeling empty inside. I got depressed, and
	> lazy, and ended up getting dumped over it. What should I do? Any
	> advice on how to end this porn addiction?

	> *Struggling with lust*
	> 
	> I’m currently 14, and I’ve been struggling with lust since I was 10.
	> It's become such a huge and normalized part of my life, I hate it. I
	> want to stop, but when I’m in the moment, I have no desire to stop and
	> I want to keep going. Sometimes I search for inappropriate content to
	> just 'see' it, but then it ends in something completely different. I
	> feel no remorse anymore, my heart is hardened to this sin. does anyone
	> have any advice?

	> *Can we have a real discussion?*
	> 
	> Why do I keep doing things that go against God’s will even though I am
	> saved? Wouldn’t it make sense to stop doing the things that are an
	> abomination to God? Porn and sexual immorality are not the best kind
	> of sins to fall into. Unfortunately for me, I started at a young age
	> of around 10 or 11. I’ve struggled with it all my life. It hurts my
	> relationship with God because I always try to hide after doing such
	> sins. My question is why do I always go back??? Like a dog returning
	> to his vomit.

	> *I am a 14-year-old guy and can’t stop watching porn*
	> 
	> So I am a Christian guy and love God and I want to be like him. I
	> unfortunately stumbled across porn and started watching it a lot and
	> can’t stop. Well, I can for a few weeks but always seem to come back
	> to it no matter how much I try. I don't want to go to ANYONE for help
	> so I am asking for help where people don't know who I am. Any advice
	> from people who stopped watching porn would be appreciated.

	> *Am I a bad person for being a worship leader and struggling with sin?*
	> 
	> I’m considering stepping down from worship because I struggle with
	> sin. Don’t get me wrong, I love it and I feel the presence of God
	> while ministering, but I feel like I’m a hypocrite. I’ve been praying
	> and praying but it feels like they’re hitting the roof and I don’t
	> know what to do, and now I'm second-guessing my calling. Just need
	> some advice from someone who knows more than me. I really don’t WANT
	> to stop worship leadership, but I’m conflicted.

13. **Dealing with demons and sexual addictions**
	- Matthew 12:29

	> Or again, how can anyone enter a strong man’s house and carry off his
	> possessions unless he first ties up the strong man? Then he can
	> plunder his house.
	- Mark 16:17-18

	> And these signs shall follow them that believe; In my name shall they
	> cast out devils; they shall speak with new tongues;

	- Mark 9:25

	> Jesus noticed that the crowd was closing in on them, so he gave a
	> command to the evil spirit. “Deaf and dumb spirit,” he said, “I order
	> you to come out of the boy and never go into him again!”

	- *Signs of demonic affliction:*
	- When you find yourself in a cycle of defeat
	- When the sickness comes and goes
	- When you cannot stop a habit
	- When you sometimes act out of character
	- *Many humans are bound to the spirit of lust*
	- *You have been given authority in the name, not the blood, use it*
	- *You should be able to lay hands on your child and deliver them from evil* spirits and also heal their bodies
14. **Replace smartphones with laptops**
	- *Mostly used for sex movies leading to masturbation instead of research*
	- *Enables predators to circumvent the parents and directly destroy the child*
	- *For consuming content and not producing it*
15. **Protect the innocence of the child**
	- *Certain things cannot be taught to the child when they lose their innocence*
	- *Teach them to close their legs when they sit*
	- *Wear clothes that actually cover their bodies*
	- Some men do not know the difference between a girl and a woman
	- The boy who caught his father having an affair with another woman and starts to gossip about it
	- How Joan got raped as a child
	- Do not have an affair while they are around
16. **Keep your eyes on the prize.**
	- *Avoid distractions.*
17. **There is a storm coming**
	- *You cannot outlaw everything, eg. children being gay*
	- *Many homes have been destroyed, leaving children vulnerable, and the devil is busily sowing seeds and grooming them for his warfare*
	- *We may have to take on and parent more children than our biological kids, but all children come from God*

>

Can she be certain that the children she left at home will be the same ones she returns to?

sections.question: **Pray for your children**
sections.body:
- *Sometimes God reveals some things to us that would be impossible to detect about our children*
- > A pastor was raising his daughter in a spiritually sound environment. She rarely left the house except to run errands, and she always returned promptly. There was never any reason to suspect that something was wrong. In their home, gospel music played constantly, and a prayerful atmosphere was carefully maintained to guard against spiritual darkness.
>
>The daughter mostly kept to herself in her room, only occasionally stepping out to grab a snack—usually ice cream—before retreating again. Nothing in her routine seemed unusual.
>
>But one day, as the pastor passed by her room, he felt an unusual prompting in his spirit to take a closer look. Out of concern, he glanced through a small upper window that provided a view into her room. What he saw left him deeply disturbed. Her behavior, though subtle and previously unnoticed, had concealed a troubling secret.
>
>This raised two important questions:  
What voice prompted the pastor to look that day?
And where had his daughter been exposed to such ideas that led her down this path?

sections.question: **The mind is a soil**
sections.body:
- *The words you hear with your ears, the things you see with your eyes, are seeds*
- *The seeds grow when you think about them*
- *When your mind is good, your body will be good*
- *When your mind is bad, your body will also be bad*
- *Can you watch everything, and hear everything if you wish to grow?*
- *Should the mind be protected?*
- > A woman who sold fruits would often pass by the home of a young girl and her mother, who also sold fruits and vegetables. One day, as usual, the fruit seller stopped to greet the girl’s mother—they were friends—and began chatting.
>
>During the conversation, the woman turned her attention to the child and began making inappropriate remarks about her appearance. “You’re so developed, sometimes I can’t tell if you’re a child or an adult,” she said, half-jokingly.
>
>The girl’s mother stood there, unsure of how to respond. She felt helpless and uncomfortable as the woman continued making comments about her daughter’s body. Though she wanted to stop it, the words never came. Eventually, the fruit seller moved on, and the moment passed—or so it seemed.
>
>Months later, the effects of that encounter began to surface. The young girl, once carefree, had become overly conscious of her body. She began exercising obsessively, often caught trying to "fix" her figure—despite being perfectly healthy and already in great shape. What seemed like a passing comment had planted a seed of insecurity.

sections.question: **Control what the child hears and sees**
sections.body:
- *Control the kind of people you bring them around, especially at funerals*
- *Shield them from certain conversations eg. public transport, adult visitors, etc.*
- *TV should be programmed*
- *Example of children now into chanting and invoking spirits*
> Bertha sings a song from her village and becomes fully possessed, she has to be retrained by strong men because the spirit wants to throw her into a flame and hit her body against the walls.

sections.question: **Avoid the temptation of buying smartphones for the child's homework**
sections.body: - *Their teachers should score them anything they want and it's fine*

sections.question: **The issue with sex movies**
sections.body:
- *Damages the child's mind, polluting their thoughts*
- *It makes them filthy making them distance themselves from God and their parents*
-  *A demon binds them, permanently trapping them sometimes well into their old age*
- *Sex movies and romance are not what makes a marriage last and should be removed from every device that a parent owns so the child is not exposed to it*
- Examples of lust issues

> *Lust will be the death of me*
> 
> It's over for me. Lust alone will kill me. It's the same thing every
> day. Resist lust for a day or two. And give up. Repeat, repeat,
> repeat. Then the conviction comes and it's right back to square one.
> I've gotten to a point where the lord no longer lingers in my mind
> while I do these things. It's no longer conviction. This time it was
> different. At least this time I felt shame. I wanted to post this, for
> whatever reason. I'm not sure. I fear I’ve committed blasphemy against
> the holy spirit. It’s over.

> *13-year battle with lust/porn, seeking prayer and insight*
> 
> 25 year old male. Raised and remain as a Christian (Pentecostal). I
> was exposed to pornography at a very young age, it has been 13 years
> of battling the addiction (it is an addiction at this point). Lately,
> I have been really trying to surrender to God, trying to allow the
> Holy Spirit to live in me, trying to have a relationship with Christ.

> *Need advice... I'm addicted to watching porn & I desperately want to*
> *quit.*
> 
> Hey everyone, I (23 M) started watching porn ever since I was a kid
> and have been struggling to quit this addiction. I am
> 
> ashamed of myself for being trapped in this sin. I’ve attempted to
> quit watching it hundreds of times but never succeeded. The excessive
> binge-watching has left me feeling empty inside. I got depressed, and
> lazy, and ended up getting dumped over it. What should I do? Any
> advice on how to end this porn addiction?

> *Struggling with lust*
> 
> I’m currently 14, and I’ve been struggling with lust since I was 10.
> It's become such a huge and normalized part of my life, I hate it. I
> want to stop, but when I’m in the moment, I have no desire to stop and
> I want to keep going. Sometimes I search for inappropriate content to
> just 'see' it, but then it ends in something completely different. I
> feel no remorse anymore, my heart is hardened to this sin. does anyone
> have any advice?

> *Can we have a real discussion?*
> 
> Why do I keep doing things that go against God’s will even though I am
> saved? Wouldn’t it make sense to stop doing the things that are an
> abomination to God? Porn and sexual immorality are not the best kind
> of sins to fall into. Unfortunately for me, I started at a young age
> of around 10 or 11. I’ve struggled with it all my life. It hurts my
> relationship with God because I always try to hide after doing such
> sins. My question is why do I always go back??? Like a dog returning
> to his vomit.

> *I am a 14-year-old guy and can’t stop watching porn*
> 
> So I am a Christian guy and love God and I want to be like him. I
> unfortunately stumbled across porn and started watching it a lot and
> can’t stop. Well, I can for a few weeks but always seem to come back
> to it no matter how much I try. I don't want to go to ANYONE for help
> so I am asking for help where people don't know who I am. Any advice
> from people who stopped watching porn would be appreciated.

> *Am I a bad person for being a worship leader and struggling with sin?*
> 
> I’m considering stepping down from worship because I struggle with
> sin. Don’t get me wrong, I love it and I feel the presence of God
> while ministering, but I feel like I’m a hypocrite. I’ve been praying
> and praying but it feels like they’re hitting the roof and I don’t
> know what to do, and now I'm second-guessing my calling. Just need
> some advice from someone who knows more than me. I really don’t WANT
> to stop worship leadership, but I’m conflicted.

parts.title: III
parts.markdown:
# Parenting Training Guide III
Developing Character

1. **Things the child cannot do without the foundation of character**
	- *Marriage*
	- Some women get frustrated by their children
	- Some men cannot stand the cry of a child
	- Some couples abuse each other, not because they are bad people
	- How does a woman raise a child who grows up to disrespect women?
	- *Business*
	- Selling food requires character
	- Many banks were closed because of dishonesty
	- *Governance and leadership*
	- Not everyone joins the government as a thief, but eventually ends up like one
	- *Apprentiship*
	- *Etc*.
2. **How the child develops character**
	- *Routine practice*
	- *Routine practice for a long time strengthens character*
3. **How do you know a character has been acquired?**
	- When you no longer struggle to do certain things
4. **Ways to develop the character of the child:**
	- *Gardening*:	
	- What qualities do you obtain from gardening?
	- Responsible
	- Commitment
	- Hard work
	- Consistency
	- Nurture
	- Patience
	- Build something from a humble beginning
	- *Pets*:
	- Responsible
	- Mindful
	- Caring
	- Sympathy
	- If the child can care for an animal, will they be able to care for another human?
	- The example of my friend who cares for his rabbits
	- *Join your Trade*
	- They will not grow up to despise your occupation
	- Humility
	- Obedience
	- Hard work
	- *Account for how the day/money was spent*
	- Accountability
	- If the child is not accountable to you, will they be accountable to God?
	- *Hold hands and pray for parents once a week*
	- Can you hate someone and pray for them at the same time?
	- Makes it easy for the child to love their parents
	- *Appreciate Teachers/Parents with a letter*
	- Gratitude
	- Learn how to say thank you twice(2)
	- *Self-respect*
	- Taking care of appearance
	- They should not wear clothes with holes, no rubber bands, etc
	- God does not do fashion
	- When the child loses their self-respect, there are things they will do and not think twice about it
	- No eating from polythene bags
	- No wearing pants to school
	- No speaking broken English
	- *Say sorry*
	- Humility
	- *Cooking*:
	- Patience
	- Process/Righteousness
	- Self-control
	- *Learn how to cook by following instructions*:
	- Obedience
	- Respect for instructions
	- *Chores*:
	- Diligence
	- *Older child serves younger siblings and apologizes to them*:
	- Responsibility
	- Humility
	- Patience
	- *How teachers contribute to character development*
	- Gardening
	- Prefectship
	- *Etc.*
	- *They should lift their heels when walking*
	- Prevents laziness
	- *Let your children greet strangers*
	- You cannot live in a world where people do not greet each other
	- *Regulate their sleep, especially the girl child*
	- Wake up early in the morning to sweep before everyone else is awake
	- Affects their urinating pattern, where they may grow and continue to wet their beds
	- If they sleep like they are dead, someone might sleep with them without them knowing it
	- They should sleep on a narrowly raised bed, which keeps them mindful of their sleep position even in their sleep
5. **Unsupervised training is no training**
	- Always confirm if the child has done what you have asked them to do
6. **Things to avoid when developing character**
	- *Food should be dished out for them to eat in bowls, not cooking ware*
	- You will be teaching them greed
	- *Sleeping on the floor*
	- The child should be self-aware even in their sleep
	- *They should not play with toy guns*
	- You are teaching them violence
	- *They should not jump walls*
	- They are learning to become thieves
	- *You do not study the character of a child, you develop it*
	- Be active when it comes to developing the character of the child, and not a passive observer
	- There is character and there is also strength of character
	- Example of the child whose grandpa thinks he likes God, but the boy wants nothing to do with God
	- *Be proactive, not reactive*
7. **Always giving to the child only teaches them to receive and the parent to give, even laying down their lives for their child**
	- *The child must not only receive from their parents but also learn to give in return*
	- *The least they can give back is their prayer*
	- *They must learn to share their prayer*
7. **Do not presume the child is good because they do no evil**
	- *For the child to become good, there must be some good that they are always doing*
	- *Example of the pastor's daughter*
8. **Other benefits of character:**
	-  *Universal currency, valuable even beyond mortal existence*
	- *The invisible things are everlasting*
	- *Prepares you for opportunities* 
	- *Better inheritance* 
9. **Do not be discouraged**
	- *Parenting is a warfare*
	- Sometimes children make you feel like your efforts are going nowhere
	- They make you want to give up on them
	- *Training the child does not require expensive education*
10. **The time is now**
	- *Children develop through stages*
	- Different lessons can be learned at different stages
	- The right training at the wrong time will yield disastrous results 
11. **Questions?**

parts.title: IV
parts.markdown:
# Parenting Training Guide IV
Developing Mind

1. **Enter their minds through questions**
	- *The mind thinks when asked a question*
	- Is this the right thing to do?
	- *Answers derived from careful thinking have the potential to shape the child's mind and how they think*
	- *When you can get the child thinking about a subject, you have succeeded in entering their minds*
	- *Give them time to find the answer*
	- *Example of how I get the child to stop playing with guns*
	- *Example of how I get them to stop wearing rubber bands*
	- *How my mother got me to go to church*
2. **Will this help you to grow?**
	- Will this song help you to grow?
	- Will this conversation help you to grow?
	- Will this movie help you to grow?
	- Will this conversation help you to grow?
	- If something will not help you to grow, should you continue to consume it?
	- *Helps them develop a growth mindset*
	- *Helps them steer out of dangerous places*
	- *My mum helps me to develop  a growth mindset*
3. **Teach them how to dress through questions**
	- When a person sees your nakedness, they lose respect for you
	- How do you make sure that you are not exposed?
	- When you bend down to enter a bus
	- When you jump up in excitement
	- When you climb a tree
	- When the wind blows your dress up
	- When you fall or get involved in an accident
	- When your dress gets torn when hooked by a sharp object
	- When you faint and you have to be ventilated
	- *People no longer take you seriously when they lose respect for you*
4. **The child does not have a mind of their own.**
	- *They do not have opinions about anything* 
	- *They do not know how to think about anything*
	- *Many parents do not talk with their children when walking with them*
	- *What makes a man?*
	- *What makes a woman?*
	- *What do we do with stranger?*
5. **Define everything for the child.**
	- *Don't assume anything with children.*
	- *What you do not define will be defined somewhere else, usually poorly.*
	- *Example of boys talking about girls*
	- *Example of student listening to an announcer defining what makes a man*
	- *Friendship*
	- *Dressing*
	- *Are boys superior to girls?*
	- *Etc.*	
	- *Do you want your child's definitions to come from you or from elsewhere?*
	- *Example of Aaron’s friend telling him that the bible is not the real bible*
	- *A marketing vehicle slowly drives through town, defining what makes a man, in an attempt to sell sexual enhancement drugs*
	- Genesis 3:11

	> And he said, “Who told you that you were naked? Have you eaten from
	> the tree that I commanded you not to eat from?”

6. **Define Marriage**
	-	*Who has educated their child about marriage and what did you teach them?*
	-	*Example of two(2) grown men laughing about their sexual escapade by the roadside, even though they are marriage*
	-	*Jessica Saforo now offers dating advice and coaching*
7. **Define both genders to the child**
	- What makes a girl different from a boy?
	- Are boys superior to girls?
	What makes you a man or a woman? Is it physical growth alone that makes you a man, or must there be some intentional training and initiation?
	- *Example of the woman who says that boys do not sweep*
8. **Define the child to the child**
	- *Who has defined their child to them and what did you tell them?*
	- God calls you to be different
	- You are a lady
	- You are a gentleman
	- The child may not believe you initially, but they will over time
	- Sometimes you tell the children of other parents, that they are something that they are not, in the hope that they believe what you say about them, especially when their parents accuse them of something they have done, and you know they actually did it
	- "You are a good child!"
	- "I have met many bad children, and you are not a bad child."
	- "I do not believe that you are capable of doing such a thing."
9. **Seize every opportunity that you are together to tell the child why things must be done a certain way**
	- Gardening
	- Washing
	- Walks
	- Etc.  
	- Organize activities that foster such moments
11. **Let them know what you expect from them**
	- *What you expect from them is not a house or a car, but to see what God has  put in them come out, flourish, and be used to help others*
	- *You will be disappointed to see them abort what God has put in them*
	- *God will also be disappointed*
12. **The child has a conscience**
		- *This serves as a guard and prompts the child when they are about to do that which is NOT done*
		- *But the conscience has to be taught and trained to function effectively when prompting the child*
		- *Teaching them God's laws grows their consience*
		- *Example of Kessiwa realizing that her family had conscience participated in idol worship after they had sacrificed fowl*
		- *Repeat this at least once a month*
		- Joshua 1:8

	> Keep this Book of the Law always on your lips; meditate on it day and
	> night, so that you may be careful to do everything written in it. Then
	> you will be prosperous and successful.

13. **Socialize the child**
	- *Let the child be around you while you perform certain actions*
	- *Talk while taking walks, cooking, gardening, caring for the pets*
14. **Don't get tired of speaking to the child**
	- *Children will make you feel like you are wasting your time talking*
	- *When you are not around, it is your voice that will remind them to do the right thing*
15. **A well-developed mind is an inheritance**
	- *Your treasures are in your heart and your mind*
	- Knowledge of God
	- Good advice
	- Life skills
	- Wisdom 
	- Teachings
	- Example of my mum being encouraged by seeing a woman who used farming to take her son through school to become a doctor
16. **Teach the child your process**
	- Let the child know how they became the way they are because of your process
	- Some adults think that they were born good
	- When the adults do not know the process they end up having bad children even though they are good

What makes you a man or a woman? Is it physical growth alone that makes you a man, or must there be some intentional training and initiation?

sections.question: **Define the child to the child**
sections.body:
- *Who has defined their child to them and what did you tell them?*
- God calls you to be different
- You are a lady
- You are a gentleman
- The child may not believe you initially, but they will over time
- Sometimes you tell the children of other parents, that they are something that they are not, in the hope that they believe what you say about them, especially when their parents accuse them of something they have done, and you know they actually did it
- "You are a good child!"
- "I have met many bad children, and you are not a bad child."
- "I do not believe that you are capable of doing such a thing."

sections.question: **Seize every opportunity that you are together to tell the child why things must be done a certain way**
sections.body:
- Gardening
- Washing
- Walks
- Etc.  
- Organize activities that foster such moments

sections.question: **Let them know what you expect from them**
sections.body:
- *What you expect from them is not a house or a car, but to see what God has  put in them come out, flourish, and be used to help others*
- *You will be disappointed to see them abort what God has put in them*
- *God will also be disappointed*

sections.question: **The child has a conscience**
sections.body:
- *This serves as a guard and prompts the child when they are about to do that which is NOT done*
- *But the conscience has to be taught and trained to function effectively when prompting the child*
- *Teaching them God's laws grows their consience*
- *Example of Kessiwa realizing that her family had conscience participated in idol worship after they had sacrificed fowl*
- *Repeat this at least once a month*
- Joshua 1:8

> Keep this Book of the Law always on your lips; meditate on it day and
> night, so that you may be careful to do everything written in it. Then
> you will be prosperous and successful.

sections.question: **Socialize the child**
sections.body:
- *Let the child be around you while you perform certain actions*
- *Talk while taking walks, cooking, gardening, caring for the pets*

sections.question: **Don't get tired of speaking to the child**
sections.body:
- *Children will make you feel like you are wasting your time talking*
- *When you are not around, it is your voice that will remind them to do the right thing*

sections.question: **A well-developed mind is an inheritance**
sections.body:
- *Your treasures are in your heart and your mind*
- Knowledge of God
- Good advice
- Life skills
- Wisdom 
- Teachings
- Example of my mum being encouraged by seeing a woman who used farming to take her son through school to become a doctor

sections.question: **Teach the child your process**
sections.body:
- Let the child know how they became the way they are because of your process
- Some adults think that they were born good
- When the adults do not know the process they end up having bad children even though they are good

parts.title: V
parts.markdown:
# Parenting Training Guide V
Correcting the child

1. **Use punishment to prompt the child about the seriousness of what they have done**
	 - Use caning sparingly if it is to mean something to the child
	 - What other means can you use to punish the child?
	 - The example of Sumaya
2. **Make them do the opposite of the bad they have done**
	- Speak life in place of death
	- Bless in place of cursing
	- Share in place of stealing
	- Pray for them in place of holding a grudge
	- How do you correct a child who likes to fight?
	- How do you correct a vulgar child?
3. **Which is the strongest voice when rebuking the child, soft or hard?**
	- How do you respond when you are in a place with loud noise?
	- Wake them up early in the morning and speak with them about their actions
	- You can also express disappointment
4.  **Positive affirmations**
	- Tell a stubborn child that they are obedient
	- Tell a bad child that they are good
5.  **Start correcting the child early**
	- You can use your eyes to correct the child
	- How I stopped speaking broken English
	- You can use your two fingers to slap their wrist
	- What other subtle means can you correct the child?
6. **Sometimes they just don't know that they do what is wrong**
	- You lovingly teach them

- The example of Sumaya

parts.title: VI
parts.markdown:
# Parenting Training Guide VI
Developing the will of the child

1. **The child is born with a will**
	- ***Mind** is not given at birth, but **will** is given*
	- Will is "I want, I will, etc"
2. **It is God’s will to have the will of the child aligned with his.**
	- The child’s will must grow to the extent where they will want what God wants, and reject what God rejects
	- When they arrive at this point we say that the child is now under grace, and will no longer intentionally disobey God
	- Everything they ask God shall be granted to them
3. **The child must choose God’s will each day they wake up.**
	- Luke 22:42
	> “Father, if you are willing, take this cup from me; yet not my will, but yours be done.”
	
	- While on earth, each day, Christ used his will to choose God’s will
	- It was his will that God’s will be done
	- Choosing God’s will is not an event that happens once in a person’s lifetime but something that is done each day
	- Until the child comes of age, they must accept that their Father knows what is best for them, and that the wise thing to do is to surrender their will to him
4. **Make them choose**
	- *Making deliberate choices shapes the will of the child*
	- *A child who constantly chooses to do the right thing will almost always continue to choose the right thing*
	- *Example of Kessiwa when visiting her to teach her*
5. **What kind of person do you wish to become when you grow up, good or bad?**
	- What do you have to start doing now to become that kind of person?
	- When you wish to embark on a journey, what is the first and most important question you have to answer?
	- When you know where to travel, will you board *any* car when you arrive at the station?
	- What is likely to happen when you have not decided where you are going any board any car you come across?
	- When you have decided the kind of person you wish to become, will you hang out with any kind of friends, participate in any kind of conversation, take part in any kind of activities, watch any kind of film, listen to any kind of music, etc? 
	- *Welbeck decides who he wants to become*
6. **They must choose you as their parents**
	- *Assume nothing with children*
8. **The best form of investment is investing in other humans.**
	- *God wants us to build human lives, not concrete*

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Prayer

1. What are some things that God has created?
2. Who created your body?
3. Who created the food that you eat?
4. Who created Mom and Dad?
5. Who created the trees?
6. Who created the water that you drink?
7. Draw 5 things that God has created.
8. Did God create these things for himself or you?
9. When somebody gives you something or does something for you, what do you say to the person?
10. Pray and thank God for 5 things that God has done for you.
11. What do you say to God before you eat the food that he has provided for you?
12. What do you say to God before you go to sleep at night?
13. What do you say to God when you wake up in the morning? 
14. When you finish praying should you wait for a while to hear from God, or just get up and leave? Matthew 26:36-44
> 36 Then Jesus went with his disciples to a place called Gethsemane, and he said to them, “Sit here while I go over there and pray.” 37 He took with him Peter and the two sons of Zebedee. Grief and anguish came over him, 38 and he said to them, “The sorrow in my heart is so great that it almost crushes me. Stay here and keep watch with me.”
> 
> 39 He went a little farther on, threw himself face downward on the ground, and prayed, “My Father, if it is possible, take this cup of suffering from me! Yet not what I want, but what you want.”
> 
> 40 Then he returned to the three disciples and found them asleep; and he said to Peter, “How is it that you three were not able to keep watch with me for even one hour? 41 Keep watch and pray that you will not fall into temptation. The spirit is willing, but the flesh is weak.”
> 
> 42 Once more Jesus went away and prayed, “My Father, if this cup of suffering cannot be taken away unless I drink it, your will be done.”
> 43 He returned once more and found the disciples asleep; they could not keep their eyes open.
> 
> 44 Again Jesus left them, went away, and prayed the third time, saying the same words.
15. Which is more willing to pray, your spirit or your flesh? Matthew 26:41
> “Watch and pray so that you will not fall into temptation. The spirit is willing, but the flesh is weak.”
16. Should you pray when you feel like it, or pray even when you do not feel like it?
17. Set up an alarm to remind you to pray, even when you do not feel like it.

parts.title: II
parts.markdown:
# Prayer II

1. Can you see God?
2. In what way has God made it possible for you to communicate with him when you cannot see him?
3. What makes you open your mouth to speak a word?
4. What are *motives, intents, meanings, motivating thoughts*?
5. Does God know your *motives, intents, meanings, motivating thoughts*?
6. Who hears you first when you utter a word, God or you?
7. Does God need you to speak a word before he knows your *motives, intents, meanings, motivating thoughts*?
8. If you knew what a person *meant* before they spoke, would you wait to hear what they had to say before finding out their *meaning*?
9. Do words have value in prayer?
10. If you know that your friend *intends* to give you a gift, do you go ahead and take the gift?
11. If words are valueless in prayer, why does God require you to speak when you pray, anyway?
12. If words are valueless in prayer, should you use many words when you pray to try to impress God? Matthew 6:7
> And when you pray, do not keep on babbling like pagans, for they think they will be heard because of their many words.
13. Does God answer your prayers based on your *motives, intents,  meanings, motivating thoughts*, or the words that you speak when you pray? James 4:3
> And when you ask, you do not receive it, because your motives are bad; you ask for things to use for your own pleasures.
14. Should you be sincere when you pray (say what you *mean*), or say one thing when you *mean* another? Psalm 145:18
> The  Lord  is near  to all who call on him,  
to all who call on him in truth.
15. In what ways do humans say one thing when they *mean* another?
16. In what ways can you be sincere in your prayers?
17. When you plant crops close to a river and you want the river to flow to the crops, what will you have to do?
18. Can you move the crops to the river, the river to the crops, or dig trenches from the river to the crops so that the river would flow to the crops?
19. If God was an endless, boundless river, and your body was the land, and your mind, heart, conscience, etc. were the crops, how will you be able to let God, which is the river, flow to the crops, your will, heart, mind, conscience, desires, tongue?
20. If God were an endless river flowing from within you, and you wanted him to fill all the members of your body(heart, mind, will, conscience, etc.), what would you have to do?
21. How do you fill your mind with God?
22. How do you fill your heart with God?
23. How do you fill your conscience with God?
24. How did Christ give his will to the Father? Luke 22:42
> Not my will, but yours be done 
25. What kind of things will you wish for when your heart has been filled with God? 
26. How will you think when your mind has been filled with God?
27. How will you behave the more trenches you dig in yourself for God to fill?
28. Are you more likely to do the will of God when you are filled with God?
29. Will you fall into temptations when the members of your body are filled with God? Matthew 26:41
> “Watch and pray so that you will not fall into temptation. The spirit is willing, but the flesh is weak.”
30. Are you likely to make the right choices when the members of your body have been given to God and filled with God?
31. When you have a difficult decision to make, do you ask God to fill you so that you can make the right choice, or do you worry?
32. When you are faced with challenges, should you ask God to take away the challenge, or fill yourself with God through prayer, so that you will be able to go through it?
33. When things are not going your way, should you complain to God, or fill yourself with God through prayer, so that you will know the right thing to do?
34. Is prayer for filling ourselves with God to do the will of God, or is prayer for instructing God, and telling God what to do?
35. Will you always receive a word from God when you pray?
36. When you choose God's will when you pray, is God able to naturally make you do his will and purpose for your life?
37. Pray and choose God's will for your life each day.
> Heavenly Father, I choose your will over mine, in the name of Jesus.
38. Did God create Man before creating his food, or his food before creating Man?
39. Did God wait for the Man to pray for food before providing him with his food?
40. Has God provided all your needs?
41. Should you use prayer to ask God for *things* (money, clothes, shoes, etc.)?
42. Who is the first person you must talk to when you wake up in the morning?
43. Fill yourself with God through prayer.

parts.title: III
parts.markdown:
# Prayer III

1. During creation, did God create Man's food before creating Man, or Man before his food, after Man had prayed for food?
2. Has God provided all the *things* that you will ever need in this world?
3. When you pray should you ask God for material things?
4. When building a house, what materials do you need to complete the house, and how do they add value to the house?
5. When you build a house without wisdom, what will happen to the house?
6. Can you build a house without wisdom?
7. What are values?
8. Why is patience valuable?
9. Why is the fear of God valuable?
10. Why is humility valuable?
11. Why is wisdom valuable?
12. Is wisdom a material value or spiritual value?
13. Name three(3) material values needed to build a house.
14. Name three(3) spiritual values that are needed in building a house.
15. What are the differences between spiritual values and material values?
16. Which is more important, spiritual values or material values, and why?
17. Can spiritual values be taken away from you?
18. Are spiritual values useful no matter where you find yourself, even in Heaven?
19. Do spiritual values lose their value over time?
20. Do you have all the spiritual values that you will ever need?
21. When you pray should you ask God for material things or spiritual values?
22. What are some spiritual values that you wish to have?
23. Use prayer to ask God for spiritual values.

Has God provided all the *things* that you will ever need in this world?
When you pray should you ask God for material things?

parts.title: IV
parts.markdown:
# Pray The Word, Isaiah 55

1. Prayer for the Thirsty Soul
> _Inspired by: “Come, all you who are thirsty, come to the waters...” (Isaiah 55:1)_
>
>Lord, I come to You with a thirsty soul.  
Nothing in this world satisfies the deep longing within me.  
You offer what money cannot buy—life, peace, and joy.  
Let me drink freely from the waters of Your grace.  
Quench my thirst with Your Spirit, and refresh me with Your presence.  
Amen.
2. Prayer of Willingness to Listen and Receive
> _Inspired by: “Listen, listen to Me, and eat what is good, and you will delight in the richest of fare.” (Isaiah 55:2)_
>
>Father, teach me to listen.  
So often I chase things that do not nourish my soul.  
Open my ears to Your voice, and draw me to Your truth.  
Feed me with Your Word, that I may delight in what is good.  
Help me live by every word that comes from You.  
Amen.
3. Prayer for Renewal Through God’s Covenant
> _Inspired by: “I will make an everlasting covenant with you, My faithful love promised to David.” (Isaiah 55:3)_
>
>God of Covenant,  
Thank You for Your faithful love that never fails.  
You keep Your promises through all generations.  
Renew my heart through Your everlasting covenant.  
Let me live under the covering of Your grace and truth.  
Amen.
4. Prayer of Seeking and Returning
> _Inspired by: “Seek the Lord while He may be found; call on Him while He is near.” (Isaiah 55:6)_
>
>Lord, I seek You now while You are near.  
Forgive me for the times I drifted away from You.  
I return with a heart that longs to be close again.  
Draw near to me as I draw near to You.  
Let me not miss the moment of Your mercy.  
Amen.
5. Prayer of Repentance and Surrender
> _Inspired by: “Let the wicked forsake their ways and the unrighteous their thoughts...” (Isaiah 55:7)_
>
>Merciful God,  
I lay down every thought and way that is not pleasing to You.  
Cleanse my heart, renew my mind, and lead me in the path of righteousness.  
Have compassion on me, and pour out Your pardon.  
Your mercy is abundant, and I trust in Your forgiveness.  
Amen.
6. Prayer to Embrace God’s Higher Ways
> _Inspired by: “For My thoughts are not your thoughts, neither are your ways My ways...” (Isaiah 55:8–9)_
>
>Sovereign Lord,  
Your wisdom far exceeds mine.  
Help me trust Your higher ways, even when I do not understand.  
Give me faith to walk the path You choose for me.  
Let my heart rest in the knowledge that You see what I cannot.  
Amen.
7. Prayer for the Power of God's Word to Work in Me
> _Inspired by: “So is My word that goes out from My mouth: it will not return to Me empty...” (Isaiah 55:11)_
>
>God of the Living Word,  
Let Your Word take root in my heart and accomplish its purpose.  
May it convict, heal, build, and transform me.  
Send it forth like rain, and let it bear fruit in my life.  
I yield to its power, trusting that it never returns void.  
Amen.
8. Prayer of Joyful Expectation
> _Inspired by: “You will go out in joy and be led forth in peace...” (Isaiah 55:12)_
>
>Lord of Peace,  
Lead me out of darkness and into the joy of Your presence.  
Let Your peace go before me and Your joy rise within me.  
Cause my life to echo the beauty of Your restoration.  
Make me a witness to the joy that only You can give.  
Amen.

sections.question: Prayer for the Thirsty Soul
sections.body:
> _Inspired by: “Come, all you who are thirsty, come to the waters...” (Isaiah 55:1)_
>
>Lord, I come to You with a thirsty soul.  
Nothing in this world satisfies the deep longing within me.  
You offer what money cannot buy—life, peace, and joy.  
Let me drink freely from the waters of Your grace.  
Quench my thirst with Your Spirit, and refresh me with Your presence.  
Amen.

sections.question: Prayer of Willingness to Listen and Receive
sections.body:
> _Inspired by: “Listen, listen to Me, and eat what is good, and you will delight in the richest of fare.” (Isaiah 55:2)_
>
>Father, teach me to listen.  
So often I chase things that do not nourish my soul.  
Open my ears to Your voice, and draw me to Your truth.  
Feed me with Your Word, that I may delight in what is good.  
Help me live by every word that comes from You.  
Amen.

sections.question: Prayer for Renewal Through God’s Covenant
sections.body:
> _Inspired by: “I will make an everlasting covenant with you, My faithful love promised to David.” (Isaiah 55:3)_
>
>God of Covenant,  
Thank You for Your faithful love that never fails.  
You keep Your promises through all generations.  
Renew my heart through Your everlasting covenant.  
Let me live under the covering of Your grace and truth.  
Amen.

sections.question: Prayer of Seeking and Returning
sections.body:
> _Inspired by: “Seek the Lord while He may be found; call on Him while He is near.” (Isaiah 55:6)_
>
>Lord, I seek You now while You are near.  
Forgive me for the times I drifted away from You.  
I return with a heart that longs to be close again.  
Draw near to me as I draw near to You.  
Let me not miss the moment of Your mercy.  
Amen.

sections.question: Prayer of Repentance and Surrender
sections.body:
> _Inspired by: “Let the wicked forsake their ways and the unrighteous their thoughts...” (Isaiah 55:7)_
>
>Merciful God,  
I lay down every thought and way that is not pleasing to You.  
Cleanse my heart, renew my mind, and lead me in the path of righteousness.  
Have compassion on me, and pour out Your pardon.  
Your mercy is abundant, and I trust in Your forgiveness.  
Amen.

sections.question: Prayer to Embrace God’s Higher Ways
sections.body:
> _Inspired by: “For My thoughts are not your thoughts, neither are your ways My ways...” (Isaiah 55:8–9)_
>
>Sovereign Lord,  
Your wisdom far exceeds mine.  
Help me trust Your higher ways, even when I do not understand.  
Give me faith to walk the path You choose for me.  
Let my heart rest in the knowledge that You see what I cannot.  
Amen.

sections.question: Prayer for the Power of God's Word to Work in Me
sections.body:
> _Inspired by: “So is My word that goes out from My mouth: it will not return to Me empty...” (Isaiah 55:11)_
>
>God of the Living Word,  
Let Your Word take root in my heart and accomplish its purpose.  
May it convict, heal, build, and transform me.  
Send it forth like rain, and let it bear fruit in my life.  
I yield to its power, trusting that it never returns void.  
Amen.

sections.question: Prayer of Joyful Expectation
sections.body:
> _Inspired by: “You will go out in joy and be led forth in peace...” (Isaiah 55:12)_
>
>Lord of Peace,  
Lead me out of darkness and into the joy of Your presence.  
Let Your peace go before me and Your joy rise within me.  
Cause my life to echo the beauty of Your restoration.  
Make me a witness to the joy that only You can give.  
Amen.

parts.title: V
parts.markdown:
# Pray The Word, Psalm 103

1. Prayer of Wholehearted Praise
> _Inspired by: “Bless the Lord, O my soul; and all that is within me, bless His holy name!” (Psalm 103:1)_
>
>Lord, I bless You with all that I am.  
Let every thought, desire, and word of mine bring You honor.  
You are worthy of praise, not just with my lips, but with my entire life.  
Teach my soul to rejoice in Your holy name at all times.  
Amen.
2. Prayer of Remembrance for God's Benefits
> _Inspired by: “Forget not all His benefits—who forgives all your sins and heals all your diseases...” (Psalm 103:2–3)_
>
>Gracious God,  
Thank You for forgiving my sins, healing my body, and redeeming my life.  
Help me never forget what You’ve done for me.  
Let gratitude rise in my heart each day as I remember Your goodness and mercy.  
Amen.
3. Prayer of Gratitude for Redemption and Love
> _Inspired by: “Who redeems your life from the pit and crowns you with love and compassion...” (Psalm 103:4)_
>
>Redeemer of my soul,  
You lifted me from despair and gave me new life.  
Your love surrounds me, Your compassion sustains me.  
Crown my days with Your kindness, and let me live in the light of Your redemption.  
Amen.
4. Prayer for Renewal and Strength
> _Inspired by: “Who satisfies your desires with good things so that your youth is renewed like the eagle’s.” (Psalm 103:5)_
>
>Faithful Provider,  
Satisfy my soul with good things that only You can give.  
Renew my strength, refresh my spirit, and restore my joy.  
Let me rise like the eagle, strong and confident in Your care.  
Amen.
5. Prayer for God’s Justice and Righteousness
> _Inspired by: “The Lord works righteousness and justice for all the oppressed.” (Psalm 103:6)_
>
>God of Justice,  
Defend the weak and deliver the oppressed.  
Let righteousness prevail in the land.  
Use me as an instrument of peace and fairness wherever I am.  
Amen.
6. Prayer in Awe of God's Compassion
> _Inspired by: “The Lord is compassionate and gracious, slow to anger, abounding in love.” (Psalm 103:8)_
>
>Merciful Father,  
Thank You for Your patience and abundant love.  
You do not treat me as my sins deserve, but welcome me with grace.  
Help me to show others the same compassion You’ve shown me.  
Amen.
7. Prayer of Gratitude for God’s Forgiveness
> _Inspired by: “As far as the east is from the west, so far has He removed our transgressions from us.” (Psalm 103:12)_
>
>Forgiving God,  
Thank You for removing my sin completely.  
You have given me a clean heart and a new beginning.  
Help me walk in the freedom of Your forgiveness, and extend that grace to others.  
Amen.
8. Prayer for Awareness of Human Frailty and God's Faithfulness
> _Inspired by: “As for man, his days are like grass... But from everlasting to everlasting the Lord’s love is with those who fear Him.” (Psalm 103:15–17)_
>
>Eternal God,  
Remind me how fleeting life is, so I may live each day wisely.  
Though I am frail, Your love is constant.  
Let me rest in the truth that Your faithfulness stretches beyond time.  
Amen.
9. Prayer of Surrender to God’s Rule
> _Inspired by: “The Lord has established His throne in heaven, and His kingdom rules over all.” (Psalm 103:19)_
>
>Sovereign Lord,  
You reign over all creation.  
I surrender to Your rule and trust in Your perfect plan.  
Let Your kingdom come and Your will be done in my life.  
Reign in my heart and my home today.  
Amen.

sections.body:
> _Inspired by: “Bless the Lord, O my soul; and all that is within me, bless His holy name!” (Psalm 103:1)_
>
>Lord, I bless You with all that I am.

Amen.

parts.title: VI
parts.markdown:
# Pray The Word, Psalm 109

1. Prayer for Deliverance from Slander and False Accusation
> _Inspired by: “For wicked and deceitful mouths are opened against me, speaking against me with lying tongues.” (Psalm 109:2)_
>
>Righteous God,  
You see the lies spoken against me and the words meant to harm me.  
I come to You, my Defender and my Truth.  
Silence the voice of slander and protect me from deceit.  
Let truth be my covering and integrity my shield.  
Defend my name, O Lord, for I place my reputation in Your hands.  
Amen.
2. Prayer When Betrayed by Those You Helped
> _Inspired by: “In return for my love they accuse me, but I give myself to prayer.” (Psalm 109:4)_
>
>Faithful Lord,  
Even when I showed love, I was repaid with hatred.  
Even when I gave, I was repaid with accusations.  
But I turn to You in prayer—not to seek revenge, but to find peace.  
Heal my heart and deal with those who wrong me according to Your justice.  
Teach me to keep praying, even when I’m wounded.  
Amen.
3. Prayer for God to Take Up Your Cause
> _Inspired by: “But You, Sovereign Lord, help me for Your name’s sake; out of the goodness of Your love, deliver me.” (Psalm 109:21)_
>
>Sovereign Lord,  
I call on You—not because I deserve it, but because of Your name and mercy.  
Let Your steadfast love be my rescue.  
Help me, for I am weak, and my enemies are strong.  
Take up my cause, and let my life reflect Your justice and faithfulness.  
Amen.
4. Prayer of Lament for Brokenness and Weakness
> _Inspired by: “I am poor and needy, and my heart is wounded within me.” (Psalm 109:22)_
>
>God of Compassion,  
You see my wounds and hear my sighs.  
I am weary and broken—my soul aches under the weight of grief.  
Strengthen me, Lord.  
Heal my inner wounds and lift me up with Your mercy.  
Do not let me waste away in sorrow.  
Amen.
5. Prayer for Justice Without Vengeance
> _Inspired by: “Let them know that it is Your hand, that You, O Lord, have done it.” (Psalm 109:27)_
>
>Just Judge,  
I entrust my pain to You—not seeking vengeance, but justice.  
Let it be known that when justice comes, it is from Your hand alone.  
Defend me, not so I am glorified, but so Your righteousness is revealed.  
Let others see that You care for the oppressed and betrayed.  
Amen.
6. Prayer of Praise While Under Pressure
> _Inspired by: “With my mouth I will greatly extol the Lord; in the great throng of worshipers I will praise Him.” (Psalm 109:30)_
>
>God of My Praise,  
Even when I am surrounded by opposition, I will lift my voice to You.  
I will not be silenced by fear or discouragement.  
Let my worship rise above my circumstances.  
May my praise testify that You are near to the brokenhearted and faithful to the humble.  
Amen.
7. Prayer of Confidence in God’s Advocacy
> _Inspired by: “For He stands at the right hand of the needy, to save them from those who condemn them.” (Psalm 109:31)_
>
>My Advocate and Defender,  
Thank You for standing beside me when others walk away.  
You see the silent tears, the unjust judgments, and the hidden battles.  
Stand with me in the court of life.  
Rescue me from condemnation and remind me that I am never alone.  
Amen.

sections.body:
> _Inspired by: “For wicked and deceitful mouths are opened against me, speaking against me with lying tongues.” (Psalm 109:2)_

parts.title: VII
parts.markdown:
# Pray The Word, Psalm 118

1. Prayer of Thanksgiving for God’s Mercy
> _Inspired by: “Oh give thanks to the Lord, for He is good; for His steadfast love endures forever.” (Psalm 118:1)_
>
>Gracious Father,  
I thank You for Your goodness and Your steadfast love.  
In every season, Your mercy endures.  
Even when I fail, You remain faithful.  
Let my life be a living testimony of gratitude to You.  
Amen.
2. Prayer for Confidence in God Over Man
> _Inspired by: “It is better to take refuge in the Lord than to trust in man.” (Psalm 118:8)_
>
>Lord my Refuge,  
When people fail me or circumstances shake me,  
Help me to lean fully on You.  
You are my unshakable foundation.  
Teach me to trust Your wisdom above every human voice.  
Amen.
3. Prayer for Deliverance in Trouble
> _Inspired by: “Out of my distress I called on the Lord; the Lord answered me and set me free.” (Psalm 118:5)_
>
>Delivering God,  
In my moments of distress, I call out to You.  
Answer me, Lord, and bring me into a place of peace and freedom.  
You are my Savior, and I place my burdens at Your feet.  
Set me free from all that binds me.  
Amen.
4. Prayer of Courage and Boldness
> _Inspired by: “The Lord is on my side; I will not fear. What can man do to me?” (Psalm 118:6)_
>
>Mighty Defender,  
Because You are with me, I will not be afraid.  
No opposition can overcome me while I stand in Your strength.  
Remind me daily that You are my shield and my confidence.  
Amen.
5. Prayer of Praise for Victory
> _Inspired by: “The right hand of the Lord does valiantly.” (Psalm 118:15–16)_
>
>Victorious God,  
Your mighty hand works wonders on behalf of Your people.  
Let me not boast in my own strength but in Your saving power.  
May every victory I experience bring glory to Your name.  
Amen.
6. Prayer for a New Day of Grace
> _Inspired by: “This is the day that the Lord has made; let us rejoice and be glad in it.” (Psalm 118:24)_
>
>Creator of Days,  
Thank You for the gift of this day.  
Help me rejoice in whatever comes, knowing You have made it.  
Fill my heart with joy and purpose.  
Let me use today to honor You in all I do.  
Amen.
7. Prayer for Salvation and Blessing
> _Inspired by: “Save us, we pray, O Lord! O Lord, we pray, give us success!” (Psalm 118:25)_
>
>God of Salvation,  
I cry out to You: save me, guide me, and prosper the work of my hands.  
Let Your favor rest upon me, not for my glory, but for Your name’s sake.  
Open doors I cannot open, and lead me into Your perfect will.  
Amen.
8. Prayer of Welcome for the Presence of God
> _Inspired by: “Blessed is He who comes in the name of the Lord!” (Psalm 118:26)_
>
>Holy One,  
I welcome You into my life, into my heart, and into this moment.  
Blessed is Your name, and blessed is Your coming.  
Let my home and heart be a resting place for Your presence.  
Amen.
9. Prayer of Dedication at the Altar
> _Inspired by: “Bind the festal sacrifice with cords, up to the horns of the altar!” (Psalm 118:27)_
>
>Lord of the Altar,  
I give myself fully to You, holding nothing back.  
Let my life be a living sacrifice, holy and pleasing to You.  
Tie my heart to Your purpose and Your altar forever.  
Amen.
10. Prayer of Personal Praise and Acknowledgment
> _Inspired by: “You are my God, and I will give thanks to You; You are my God; I will extol You.” (Psalm 118:28)_
>
>My God and King,  
You are not just the God of the heavens, You are my God.  
I thank You for who You are and all You’ve done.  
I lift up Your name with praise and exalt You above all things.  
Amen.

sections.body:
> _Inspired by: “Oh give thanks to the Lord, for He is good; for His steadfast love endures forever.” (Psalm 118:1)_
>
