textLessons.title: Two Kinds of Humans in This World

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Two Kinds of Humans in This World

1. What is a parable?
2. If a story does not teach a lesson is it a parable?
3. Have you seen wheat before?
4. What are some uses of wheat?
5. Have you seen a weed before?
6. Pull out a weed from around you and show it to your instructor.
7. Can you cook a weed and eat it?
8. When a weed grows around a tomato plant, will the tomato grow properly and be colorful?
9. What is the reason for your answer?
10. What do we do with weeds?
11. When a weed grows around a plant that you intend to eat, what do you do with it?
12. What is the parable of the Wheat and the Weeds? Matthew 13:24-30
> 24 Jesus told them another parable:  “The kingdom of heaven is like  a man who sowed good seed in his field.  25 But while everyone was sleeping, his enemy came and sowed weeds among the wheat, and went away.  26 When the wheat sprouted and formed heads, then the weeds also appeared.
>
>27 “The owner’s servants came to him and said, ‘Sir, didn’t you sow good seed in your field? Where then did the weeds come from?’
>
>28 “‘An enemy did this,’ he replied.
>
>“The servants asked him, ‘Do you want us to go and pull them up?’
>
>29 “‘No,’ he answered, ‘because while you are pulling the weeds, you may uproot the wheat with them.  30 Let both grow together until the harvest. At that time I will tell the harvesters: First collect the weeds and tie them in bundles to be burned; then gather the wheat and bring it into my barn.’”
13. If you plant a good seed, can it grow into a bad tree?
14. Can a tomato grow into a banana tree?
15. From the parable, how did the man know that an enemy had planted weeds in his field?
16. In verse 29, why did the man not want the servants to remove the weeds?
17. Do the weeds and the wheat look very much alike?
18. Why will the servants accidentally pull out the wheat?
19. From this parable, who is the man who planted the good seeds?
20. What are the good seeds?
21. Who are the servants?
22. Who is the enemy who planted the weeds?
23. What are the weeds?
24. What does the field represent?
25. In verse 30, what will happen to the weeds?
26. How does Christ explain the parable of the wheat and the weeds? Matthew 13:37-43
> 37 He answered,  “The one who sowed the good seed is the Son of Man.  38 The field is the world, and the good seed stands for the people of the kingdom. The weeds are the people of the evil one,  39 and the enemy who sows them is the devil. The harvest  is the end of the age,  and the harvesters are angels.
>
>40 “As the weeds are pulled up and burned in the fire, so it will be at the end of the age.  41 The Son of Man  will send out his angels,  and they will weed out of his kingdom everything that causes sin and all who do evil.  42 They will throw them into the blazing furnace, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.  43 Then the righteous will shine like the sun  in the kingdom of their Father. Whoever has ears, let them hear.
27. Is a human being a seed?
28. What is the reason for your answer?
29. From the explanation above, who is the man who planted the good seeds?
30. What are the good seeds?
31. Who are the servants?
32. Who is the enemy who planted the weeds?
33. What are the weeds?
34. What does the field represent?
35. Are all humans put here by Christ?
36. Who are the two kinds of humans in this world?
37. Do the children of the Devil and the children of God look alike at the beginning when they are born?
38. What are some things that the child of the Devil will do to expose who they are?
39. Did all the teachings of Christ stop Judas Iscariot from betraying him?
40. What are the fruits of the seeds of God, when they are fed with the word of God?
41. In the end, what will happen to every human who was not put here by Christ?
42. What will the children of the Devil attempt to do to the seeds that were put here by Christ?
43. Is life on earth going to be easy for the children of God, as long as the children of the Devil remain on earth?
44. Does being a child of God mean that you automatically accept God as your father?
45. Pray to God, accept him as your father, and ask him to take you as his child and make you what he wishes to make of you.
46. What does a sword do? Matthew 10:34
>34 “Do not think that I have come to bring peace to the earth. I have not come to bring peace, but a sword.

parts.title: II
parts.markdown:
# Two Kinds of Humans in This World II

1. Who are the two kinds of humans in this world?
2. What is the parable of the mustard seed? Matthew 13:31-32
> 31 Jesus told them another parable: “The Kingdom of heaven is like this. A man takes a mustard seed and sows it in his field. 32 It is the smallest of all seeds, but when it grows up, it is the biggest of all plants. It becomes a tree, so that birds come and make their nests in its branches.”
3. What is the meaning of the parable? 
4. When the word of God is taught to the child of the kingdom who appears little or insignificant, and they practice it, are they able to grow up to become mighty like the mustard seed, and do far better than the seeds of the enemy who may appear bigger and more intelligent in the beginning? 
5. Can the children of the devil be so transformed by the word of God that they grow to become mighty like the mustard seed?
6. When teaching the word of God, should you look down on those who are little, can barely speak up, and struggle to understand what you are teaching?
7. What is the meaning of Matthew 13:33?
> 33 Jesus told them still another parable: “The Kingdom of heaven is like this. A woman takes some yeast and mixes it with a bushel of flour until the whole batch of dough rises.”
8. What is the flour?
9. What does the yeast represent?
10. If you wish to grow as a child of God, what do you have to do?
11. How long have these things been kept secret from mankind? Matthew 13:34-35
> 34 Jesus used parables to tell all these things to the crowds; he would not say a thing to them without using a parable. 35 He did this to make come true what the prophet had said,
“I will use parables when I speak to them;  
I will tell them things unknown since the creation of the world.”
12. What is the parable of the fishing net? Matthew 13:47-50
> 47 “Also, the Kingdom of heaven is like this. Some fishermen throw their net out in the lake and catch all kinds of fish. 48 When the net is full, they pull it to shore and sit down to divide the fish: the good ones go into the buckets, the worthless ones are thrown away. 49 It will be like this at the end of the age: the angels will go out and gather up the evil people from among the good 50 and will throw them into the fiery furnace, where they will cry and gnash their teeth.
13. What is the meaning of the parable?
14. Is Christ looking for all humans or only those who belong in the kingdom?
15. When you are teaching the word of God, should you be in a hurry to separate the good seeds from the bad seeds, or first gather all the people that you can, teach them, treat them equally, and let them eventually set themselves apart?
16. What does it mean to despise a little child who belongs in the kingdom? Matthew 18:10
> 10 “See that you don't despise any of these little ones. Their angels in heaven, I tell you, are always in the presence of my Father in heaven.
17. Should you treat a little child as if they were nothing because they are little?
18. What do their angels do before the Father in his presence?
19. Are their angels able to carry out instructions from the Father on their behalf?
20. What is the parable of the lost sheep? Matthew 18:12-14
> 12 “What do you think a man does who has one hundred sheep and one of them gets lost? He will leave the other ninety-nine grazing on the hillside and go and look for the lost sheep. 13 When he finds it, I tell you, he feels far happier over this one sheep than over the ninety-nine that did not get lost. 14 In just the same way your Father in heaven does not want any of these little ones to be lost.
21. Does the shepherd go looking for a sheep that did not originally belong to them?
22. Did the children of God belong to the Father from the beginning?
23. Does the Father treat his children as numbers, or as only begotten?
24. What does it mean to be an only-begotten child, when you have many siblings?
25. When the Father loses you to the lies and deceit of the Devil, will he continue to be happy because he has many other children, or he will be sad and do whatever he can to get you back?
26. Does the Father love each of his children as if they were his only child?

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Worship

1. What are some things that you do when you worship something?
2. Do you sing songs of adoration to what you worship?
3. Do you show respect for what you worship?
4. Do you listen to and obey what you worship?
5. Do you love and admire what you worship?
6. Is worship the highest form of admiration?
7. Do you give your time and attention to what you worship?
8. When you worship a person and you like the kind of clothes that they wear, what kind of clothes will you buy when you walk into a clothing store?
9. When you worship a person and you like their hairstyle, how will you style your hair?
10. How will you speak?
11. When you dress, style your hair like the person, and speak like the person, what kind of person are you becoming?
12. What do you become when you worship something? 
13. What do you become when you worship a stone? 
14. When you worship a stone, will you grow or die? 
15. What do you become when you worship a tree?  
16. What do you become when you worship another person?  
17. What then should you worship?   
18. What do you become when you worship God?
19. Does God want you to worship him so that he will feel big?
20. Does your worship make God bigger than he is, or does your worship make the amount of God in you, grow?
21. When you worship other things apart from God, what sin have you committed?
22. How can your sickness become an idol to you?
23. How can money become an idol to you?
24. How can your stomach become an idol to you?
25. How can you become an idol to yourself?
26. If anything takes your attention from God, is it an idol?
27. What other things can become idols to you?
28.  Can you look inside a bottle with both eyes?
29. Can you worship both God and other things at the same time?
30. When God says that you shall not worship other gods besides him, does it mean there are other gods just like him?
31. What is the reason for your answer?
32. What is the only thing a human can do that other animals cannot?
33. Why does God give humans the ability to worship?
34. When you meet someone, how do you tell if they worship the right thing?
35. Can you tell if a person worships the right thing by how they treat other humans?
36. Can you tell if a person worships the right thing by their love for God?
37. In what ways will you worship God starting today?
38. Write down 10 ways you will worship God when you wake up and draw your first breath.

Write down 10 ways you will worship God when you wake up and draw your first breath.

parts.title: II
parts.markdown:
# Worship II

1. Who is God to you?
2. Read Isaiah 6:1-4
> 6 In the year that  King Uzziah died I  saw the Lord sitting upon a throne, high and lifted up; and the train of his robe filled the temple.  2 Above him stood the seraphim. Each had six wings: with two he covered his face, and with two he covered his feet, and with two he flew.  3 And one called to another and said:
> 
> “Holy, holy, holy is the  Lord  of hosts;   the whole earth is full of his glory!”
> 
> 4 And the foundations of the thresholds shook at the voice of him who called, and the house was filled with smoke.  
3. If you were prophet Isaiah and you saw this vision of God sitting on a throne, high and lifted up, what would this tell you about God?
4. Is God a king?
5. Is God Holy?
6. If God is a king then how should we conduct ourselves before him?
7. Where did the train of God's robe or garment fill?
8. Does God live in temples?
9. Is your body God's temple?
10. What is the reason for your answer?
11. How should you treat your body if it is a temple of God?
12. Should you think carelessly?
13. Should you speak anyhow?
14. Should you dress anyhow, or dress majestically like God?
15. Should you be profane?
16. In verse 5, why did prophet Isaiah feel the way he did?
> 5 And I said: “Woe is me! For I am lost; for I am a man of unclean lips, and I dwell in the midst of a people of unclean lips; for my eyes have seen the King, the Lord of hosts!”
17. In verse 6, why did the seraphim touch prophet Isaiah's mouth with the burning coal?
> 6 Then one of the seraphim flew to me, having in his hand a burning coal that he had taken with tongs from the altar.  7 And he  touched my mouth and said: “Behold, this has touched your lips; your guilt is taken away, and your sin atoned for.”
18. Was God the one who told the prophet Isaiah that he was unclean?
19. How did the prophet Isaiah know that he was unclean?
20. What happened to his guilt after his sins were atoned for?
21. When we wish to speak with God, should we go straight to the point or should we start with thanksgiving, praises, and adoration? Psalm 100:4
> Enter his gates with thanksgiving and his courts with praise; give thanks to him and praise his name.
22. Give thanks for 10 things that God has done for you. 
23. Give God praises and adoration.

parts.title: III
parts.markdown:
# Worship III

1. What does worship change the worshipper into? Jeremiah 2:5
> This is what the LORD says: “What fault did your ancestors find in me, that they strayed so far from me? They followed worthless idols and became worthless themselves.
2. Is it God's nature to share all he has, including Himself?
3. Who first had life and chose to share that life with his children?
4. In what way does God share himself with his children?
5. Who planted the Garden of Eden?
6. Is God a gardener and someone who loves nature and beautiful flowers and loves to care for them?
7. Is God gentle, sensitive, and also thoughtful? Genesis 2:21
> 21 And the Lord God caused a deep sleep to fall upon Adam, and he slept: and he took one of his ribs, and closed up the flesh instead thereof;
8. Did God create Adam before creating his food, or his food before creating Adam?
9. Is God orderly, and does he follow a process to get things done?
10. Does God like to do excellent things and pay attention to details? Exodus 31:1-5
> Then the  Lord said to Moses,  2 “See, I have chosen Bezalel son of Uri, the son of Hur,  of the tribe of Judah,  3 and I have filled him with the Spirit of God, with wisdom, with understanding, with knowledge and with all kinds of skills—  4 to make artistic designs for work in gold, silver and bronze,  5 to cut and set stones, to work in wood, and to engage in all kinds of crafts.
11. Is God majestic and also a King? 
12. Will the worshipper of God Most High also become majestic like a king, gentle, caring, sensitive, orderly, thoughtful, sharing, etc?
13. Does God want you to worship him because someone asked you to, or because you understand why you worship?
14. What is intelligent worship?
15. Are there *worshippers* and *true worshipers*? John 4:21-23
> 21 “Woman,”  Jesus replied,  “believe me, a time is coming when you will worship the Father neither on this mountain nor in Jerusalem.  22 You Samaritans worship what you do not know;  we worship what we do know, for salvation is from the Jews.  23 Yet a time is coming and has now come when the true worshipers will worship the Father in the Spirit and in truth, for they are the kind of worshipers the Father seeks.
16. Does God want to be worshipped by people who have been born in the spirit?
17. Does God want to be worshipped by people who have been born *once*, or does God want to be worshipped by people who have been born *twice*?
18. Does God want to be wirshipped as he *truly* is, or as we *think* he is?
19. Is God *big* or God is *infinite*, *limitless*?
20. If a worshipper describes God as _big_, are they not, in doing so, imposing a limit on the limitless?
21. Does true worship ask God for *things* during worship?
22. Is true worship *intelligent*?
23. Does God choose how he is to be worshipped, or does man choose how he wishes to worship God? Genesis 4:3-7
> 3 In the course of time Cain brought some of the fruits of the soil as an offering  to the  Lord.  4 And Abel also brought an offering—fat portions  from some of the firstborn of his flock.  The  Lord  looked with favor on Abel and his offering,  5 but on Cain and his offering he did not look with favor. So Cain was very angry, and his face was downcast.
>
>6 Then the  Lord  said to Cain, “Why are you angry?  Why is your face downcast?  7 If you do what is right, will you not be accepted? But if you do not do what is right, sin is crouching at your door;  it desires to have you, but you must rule over it.”
24. What kind of energy do you receive from God when you worship him with spiritual songs?
25. Does spiritual energy help you go through the difficulties of life?
26. Does spiritual energy make you sensitive to the spirit?
27. Do you know that your body is a temple and God lives in you?
28. What should you do to feel the presence of God within you?
29. Does God expect you to worship more than you pray or pray more than you worship?
30. What is the reason for your answer?
31. Name a song you can use to worship God each morning when you wake up before you start your day.
32. Close your eyes and picture God sitting on his throne, high and lifted up, worship God with the song [We Give You Glory Lord As We Honour You](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s7gvxW42K7w&pp=ygUZa2FobGVobyB5b3UgYXJlIHdvbmRlcmZ1bA%3D%3D "KALEHO - We Give You Glory Lord As We Honour You (You are Wonderful) ft. Evans Ogboi")

textLessons.title: A Better Way to Say Thank You

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# A Better Way to Say Thank You
Jesus teaches us how we can become better.

1. When you are hungry and a stranger offers you food, what do you say to them?
2. When you meet another stranger who is hungry and you have food yet you sneer at them and refuse to give them food, were you really thankful when you were offered food and you said "Thank you?"
3. When you meet a hungry stranger and you share the little food you left with them, were you really thankful when you were offered food and said "Thank you?"
4. Which is a better way to say thank you, by your lips only, or by your lips and your actions towards another person who also needs your help?
5. What is the best way to say "Thank you" to your teacher when you have been taught a lesson and meet another person who does not know that lesson and wishes to learn it? Matthew 18:21-35

sections.question: When you are hungry and a stranger offers you food, what do you say to them?
When you meet another stranger who is hungry and you have food yet you sneer at them and refuse to give them food, were you really thankful when you were offered food and you said "Thank you?"
When you meet a hungry stranger and you share the little food you left with them, were you really thankful when you were offered food and said "Thank you?"
Which is a better way to say thank you, by your lips only, or by your lips and your actions towards another person who also needs your help?
What is the best way to say "Thank you" to your teacher when you have been taught a lesson and meet another person who does not know that lesson and wishes to learn it? Matthew 18:21-35

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Automatic Responsibility

1. Who would be blamed for the child's accident?
> I was in a park with a bunch of people, both adults and kids. After a while, everyone left, and it was just me and this little kid. The kid decided to climb a tree nearby, but then he slipped and fell. He broke his arm, and I didn’t know what to do at first. Suddenly, an adult ran over to help.
2. The child was not left in my care so why will I be blamed?  
3. Who is wiser and knows better, the child or me? 
4. Does being wiser, or better at something, than someone else makes you automatically responsible for teaching or correcting them?
5. If you are the only person who knows how to read, who is automatically responsible for teaching those around you who cannot read?  
6. If you are the only well-behaved person around many people are not well-behaved, who is automatically responsible for teaching them how to be well-behaved?  
7. Is it okay for you to be the only person who does not use abusive words in your community?  
8. What other things are you automatically responsible for simply because you find yourself in someplace with a certain group of people eg. class, home, or community?
9. Can God confidently count on you to perform your automatic responsibilities towards the people around you?

The kid decided to climb a tree nearby, but then he slipped and fell. He broke his arm, and I didn’t know what to do at first. Suddenly, an adult ran over to help.

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Be Transparent

1. When do you say that something is transparent?
2. What are some transparent things?  
3. When do you say that a person is transparent?
4. How do you make yourself transparent?
5. How does being transparent with your parents help them to keep you safe?
6. How does being transparent with your parents help them to help you out of bad habits?
7. How does being transparent with God, enable him to lead you out of temptation?
8. Draw a lion. 
9. Draw a group of sheep. 
10. Draw a circle around the group of sheep. 
11. Draw another sheep who has separated himself from the group of sheep.
12. Who is the lion more likely to attack? The group of sheep, or the single sheep?  
13. What will happen to you when you separate yourself from the people practicing good?
14. What can happen to you when someone makes you think you can do it alone, without God's help or your parents?

How does being transparent with God, enable him to lead you out of temptation?

What will happen to you when you separate yourself from the people practicing good?
What can happen to you when someone makes you think you can do it alone, without God's help or your parents?

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Becoming

1. When you teach other people what you know what do you become?
2. When you help those who are in need what do you become?
3. When you heal people and make them feel better what do you become?
4. Do you become what you do?
5. What do you wish to become?
6. What do you have to do to become what you wish to become?
7. What do you have to do to become a child of God?
8. Can you become a child of God when you do not do the same things that God also does?
9. When you steal what do you become? 
10. When you insult others what do you become?
11. When you cheat others what do you become?
12. When a soup becomes rotten what do you do with it?
13. Do you know that you can also become like a rotten soup?
14. What are some things that when you do, will make you become like a rotten soup?
15. What will happen to you when you become like a rotten soup?
16. Does God create bad people?
17. Why do some people become good and others become bad?
18. Pray and tell God the kind of person that you wish to become and ask him to help you.

When you help those who are in need what do you become?
When you heal people and make them feel better what do you become?

What do you wish to become?
What do you have to do to become what you wish to become?

Pray and tell God the kind of person that you wish to become and ask him to help you.

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Fasting

1. How many kinds of food must a person eat each day? Deuteronomy 8:3
> 3 So He humbled you, allowed you to hunger, and fed you with manna which you did not know nor did your fathers know, that He might make you know that man shall not live by bread alone; but man lives by every _word_ that proceeds from the mouth of the Lord.
2. What are they?
3. What does it mean to feed on the word of God?
4. If you hear God's word and do not practice it, have you fed on the word of God?
5. What happens to your spirit when you hear God's word and practice it?
6. What is a fast?
7. When you fast, which of the two(2) kinds of food are you feeding on?
8. Should you listen to the voice of God while you fast?
9. Does fasting also humble you before God? Deuteronomy 8:3
>Deuteronomy 8:3
>3 So He humbled you, allowed you to hunger, and fed you with manna which you did not know nor did your fathers know, that He might make you know that man shall not live by bread alone; but man lives by every _word_ that proceeds from the mouth of the Lord.
10. What is the story? Daniel 10:1-12
11. In verse 12, how did Daniel humble himself?
> 12 Then he said, “Daniel, don't be afraid. God has heard your prayers ever since the first day you decided to humble yourself in order to gain understanding. I have come in answer to your prayer.
12. When fasting should we live by every word that comes from the mouth of God?
13. How are you oppressing other people by holding them in chains? Isaiah 58:6
> 6 “The kind of fasting I want is this: Remove the chains of oppression and the yoke of injustice, and let the oppressed go free.
14. Before you begin a fast should you forgive every person who has offended you and is being held a prisoner in your heart?
15. When should you begin a fast?
16. Should you feel hungry during a fast? 
17. When should you end a fast? Matthew 4:2
> After fasting forty days and forty nights, he was hungry.
18. Should you end your fast when you start feeling hungry?
19. Begin a fast according to a time of your choosing
20. Do you realize now that you can live on God's word alone?
21. Does fasting help your body to endure prayer?

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Freedom

1. Draw the picture of a person whose hands have been chained together and is not looking very happy?  
2. When do we chain somebody?  
3. Are you free when your hands have been chained?  
4. What do you have to do if you wish to remove the chains from your hands?
5. How many types of chains do we have?
6. Is the invisible chain in you or outside you?
7. What are some things that put us in invisible chains? 
8. How can the way you think, put you in invisible chains?
9. When you think that there is not enough for everyone, and because of that you always want to have everything to yourself and are worried about losing what you already have, are you free or in chains? 
10. When you think that everyone around you is bad, and you find yourself in trouble but cannot call for help, are you free or in chains? 
11. How can your character put you in invisible chains? 
12. Are you free when you are not humble, and cannot learn from anyone?
13. Are you free when you have an addiction and cannot go a day without spending money or time on it?
14. How can the words from your mouth put you in invisible chains? 
15. Are you free when you speak death, not life, and cannot grow because of it?
16. How can the things you must know, yet do not know, put you in invisible chains?
17. Are you free when you do not know how to take good care of your body and are always falling sick? 
18. How does not knowing God put you in invisible chains?
19. Are you free when you do not fear God, and everything that you do causes your own death?
20. How can a person in invisible chains, die from hunger even though they are surrounded by lots of food?
21. How can a person in invisible chains die from thirst even though there is lots of water where they live?
22. How can a person in invisible chains take 50 years to do something that should have taken them 3 days, and still not be able to finish it?
23. Do you carry your invisible chains with you everywhere you go, even when you are sleeping?
24. Can you use force to break out from your invisible chains?
25. How can you break out of your invisible chains?
26. How can you break another person out of their invisible chains?

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Friends

1. Name some of your friends
2. What do you do together when you meet your friends?
3. Why does God give us friends?
4. If friends are not making each other better, is their friendship serving its purpose?
5. In what ways can you make your friend better?
6. When you meet your friend, who is disrespecting their mother, how can you make your friend better?
7. When you meet your friend and your friend is not dressed properly, how do you make your friend better?
8. Is a friendship serving its purpose when friends make each other worse every time they meet?
9. Is a friendship serving its purpose when friends do not teach each other?
10. Is a friendship serving its purpose when friends do not help each other with their work?
11. Is a friendship serving its purpose when friends do not encourage each other when they feel like giving up?
12. When correcting someone, which is the strongest voice, loudest, or lowest?
13. Point out something that you do not like about your friend and correct them.
14. Can you make friends when you are not friendly yourself?
15. Is God able to work in connection with his ministering angels and spiritual agencies to connect two individuals who must join together in a friendship?
16. Who do angels take their instructions from? Psalm 91:11-12
> For he will command his angels  concerning you  
to guard you in all your ways;  
>12 they will lift you up in their hands,  
so that you will not strike your foot against a stone.
17. How do we show God that we appreciate the friends that he has given us?
18. Practice this with your friends: 
	- When going out with your friends, only do what you *all* agree on
	- Avoid doing anything that at least one of you disagrees with

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Garments

1. What is a garment?
2. Does God cover himself?
3. What does God cover himself with? Psalm 104:2
> The LORD wraps himself in light as with a garment; he stretches out the heavens like a tent
4. If God covers himself, should his children also cover themselves?
5. How many garments does God expect his children to wear?
6. What are they?
7. How do you wear your outer garment so you are not naked?
8. When you wear your outer garment, yet others can see through it, are you covered?
9. When you bend down to pick something up, will your nakedness be exposed?
10. When you climb a tree, will your nakedness be exposed?
11. When you receive good news, and you jump in excitement, will your nakedness be exposed?
12. What will happen to the respect people have for you when they see your nakedness?
13. What is your inner garment?
14. What are some things that make up your inner garment?
15. How do you wear your inner garment?
16. When you are wearing your outer garment, yet you are not wearing your inner garment, are you naked?
17. When you are wearing your inner garment, yet you are not wearing your outer garment, are you naked?
18. How many garments does God expect his children to wear daily?
19. Draw yourself, wearing your inner and outer garments.
20. How does another person know from your picture that you are wearing your inner garment?
21. Ask God to help you to wear your inner and outer garments.

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# God First

1. You are left in the house alone with your younger brother or sister, to take care of them. Will you want them to inform you before doing anything important, or do you want them to do it before telling you?  
2. What is the reason for your answer?  
3. You and God, who is wiser?  
4. Should you inform God before doing anything important, or should you do it, and later inform God about it?
6. What are some things that you will inform God about, before doing them?

textLessons.title: God Is Making More of Himself

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# God Is Making More of Himself

1. Where does God live?
2. What does God do in you?
3. What do you become when you do all that God teaches you to do? Matthew 5:48
 > 48 Be perfect, therefore, as your heavenly Father is perfect.
4. Does God know what you are thinking?
5. How must we think?
6. Does God hear what you say?
7. How must we speak?
8. Does God see what you do?
9. How must we behave?
10. How must we dress?
11. Does God live in other people too?
12. How must we treat other people?
13. When you become like God and become a teacher, who is really the teacher?
14. When you become like God and become a doctor, who is really the doctor?
15. Give your heart to God every day, starting today.

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Habits & Courtesy

1. What are habits?  
2. How do your habits shape your character?  
3. How do you know that a habit has become part of you?  
4. Write down 6 habits that you will like to practice every day until they have become part of you.  
5. Remember to do these every day.
6. What is courtesy?  
7. What is the difference between habit and courtesy?
8. Write down 10 of your habits.
9. How can you practice your 10 habits with courtesy?

textLessons.title: I Am a Little Bent Tree

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# I Am a Little Bent Tree

1. Have you planted a tree before?
2. What tree was it?
3. Draw a picture of a little bent tree.
4. When a tree starts to grow and become bent, how do you make it grow straight?
5. Can the stick make the tree straight when it is itself bent?
6. When the tree is already grown, and it is bent, can you make it straight?
7. When is the best time to make a tree straight?
8. When a little tree has been made straight, will it ever get bent again?
9. Do you know that you are a little bent tree?
10. When you still insult other people, are you straight?
11. When you still disobey your teachers, are you straight?
12. When you hide things from your parents, are you straight?
13. What can go wrong when you hide things from your parents?
14. In this story, why did I lose my leg?
> My mom warned me not to climb trees when I went to school. She said that if she found out I had climbed a tree, I would be punished. But as soon as I got to school, I climbed a tree anyway. The branch broke, and I fell, breaking my leg. I didn't tell my teachers or my parents about the injury and tried to hide it.
>
>After a week, my parents noticed a terrible smell in the house, like something rotting. They searched for the source of the smell and eventually discovered it was my leg, which had started to fester. They rushed me to the hospital. The doctor said if they had brought me in right after the accident, my leg could have healed. But now, they had to either cut off my leg or risk the infection spreading to the rest of my body. I decided to have my leg amputated, and the doctor performed the surgery.
15. What would be the most likely outcome of this story and what will happen to my parent's trust?
> My friend gave me a phone and asked me to hide it at my house. She told me not to tell anyone, so I didn't. A short time later, the police came knocking at my door, asking about a stolen phone. My parents, trusting that I wouldn't do anything like that, kept insisting that I hadn't hidden any phone in the house. The police insisted on searching the house anyway, and it didn't take long for them to find the phone.
16. Why do you hide things from your parents and teachers?
17. When is the best time for you to become straight?
18. If you are the little bent tree, who is the stick working to make you straight?
19. Can the people who work to make you straight, succeed when they are not straight themselves?
20. Write down 4 ways God works to make you straight.
21. Write down 4 ways your parents work to make you straight.
22. Write down 4 ways your teachers work to make you straight.
23. What will happen to you when you do not allow yourself to be made straight by God, your teachers, parents, etc.?
24. Every weekend, hold your mother's hands and pray for her.
25. Repeat the same for your father.
26. Start your Quiet Time. Each morning you wake up earlier than you usually do, and do a few things:
	- Sing a worship song to God. Singing worship songs transforms you from the inside, makes you spiritually sensitive, and allows you to feel God's presence in you.
	-  You say a prayer
	- Read a portion of scripture. You can start with the gospels (Matthew, Mark, Luke, John) before reading Proverbs, Psalms, and the others.
	-  Meditate on what you have read and think about ways in which you can apply it. For instance, if Christ said that we shall be judged by every single word that we speak, I will start by repenting from every foul word I have ever spoken and be determined to speak only good words from now on.
	- God will begin to speak with you. Do as he says.
	- God loves consistency
27. Share with your parents and teachers, everything you have been hiding from them.

>After a week, my parents noticed a terrible smell in the house, like something rotting. parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Popular but Not Correct

1. What are some things that are popular but God does not approve of them, or consider them to be right?  
2. Write down 10 things that are popular or common around you, but are not correct
3. How does God correct the things that are popular, but not correct?
4. How does God correct the things that are popular, but not correct, through children?  
5. What were some things that were popular in the time of Abraham, but God did not approve of them? Joshua 24:2
> 2 Joshua said to all the people, “This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says: ‘Long ago your ancestors, including Terah the father of Abraham and Nahor, lived beyond the Euphrates River and worshiped other gods.
6. How did God plan to renew the earth through Abrahams's children?
7. As a child, should you learn only the good and beautiful, only the ugly, or both?
8. What will God do when you refuse to learn everything that God teaches you as a child?

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Rest In God

1. When do you say that a person is resting?
2. Are you resting when you are sitting down and doing nothing, but in your mind, you are worried about where your next food will come from?
3. Are you resting when you are too busy to do the things that will help you to grow?
4. Does God bring a child into the world without knowing what to do with the child?
5. Does God bring a child into the world before planning what to do with the child?
6. Does God plan your life before bringing you into the world?
7. When you come into the world, and you decide to live by your own plan, are you resting in God?
8. When you make every decision all by yourself, without God, are you resting in God?
9. When you choose your next school without God are you resting in God?
10. When you choose your next job without God are you resting in God? 
11. What can go wrong when you live by your plan and not God's?
12. Can you see the end of the choices that you make, from the beginning? 
13. When do you say that a person is resting in God?
14. Will your life be like every other person's when you choose to rest in God?
15. Will you be anxious about every single thing in life when you choose to rest in God?
16. Will you be flexible and accept whatever God gives you when you choose to rest in God?
17. Will you always be in a hurry when you choose to rest in God?
18. When you rest in God, will God be able to achieve his purpose for your life?
19. Do you choose to rest in God?
20. When you are alone with God, pray and let him know the choice you have made

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Stages of Man

1. How many stages must every Man go through in their lifetime?
2. What are the stages?
3. How do they behave in the **Animal** stage?
4. Are they selfish?
5. Do they have animal fear?
6. Are they happy when others fail?
7. Do they practice good hygiene?
8. Do they care if they are naked?
9. How do they dress?
10. Are they polite?
11. Are they able to control themselves?
12. Do they settle disagreements with force or reason and wise words?
13. Do they value spiritual things like the Word of God?
14. How do you make them human?
15. How do you remove the animal from them?
16. If the animal is not removed from them, and they grow up, what will they become?
17. When the animal is taken out of them what do they become?
18. Is everyone that you come across, human?
19. What is the reason for your answer?
20. How do they behave when they reach the **Human** stage?
21. How do they dress?
22. How do they speak?
23. Do they treat others like they treat themselves?
24. Are they selfish?
25. Do they practice good hygiene?
26. Do they have animal fear?
27. Do they forgive?
28. Are they polite?
29. Are they able to control themselves?
30. Do they settle disagreements with force or with reason and wise words?
31. Do they feel the pain of others, and try to offer a helping hand?
32. Do they value spiritual things like prayer and worship?
33. Are they perfect?
34. How do they become perfect, like God? Matthew 5:48
> Be perfect, therefore, as your heavenly Father is perfect.
35. How do they behave when they reach the **God** stage?
36. Are they selfish?
37. How do they think?
38. How do they speak?
39. Do they speak the truth?
40. Do they enjoy the pain of others?
41. Are they perfect?
42. Which stage are you now, and why?
43. How will you get to the next stage?
44. Who is the dog? Matthew 15:25-26
> 25 At this the woman came and fell at his feet. “Help me, sir!” she said.
> 
> 26 Jesus answered, “It isn't right to take the children's food and throw it to the dogs.”
45. Who are the dogs and pigs, and what will they do when given the Word of God? Matthew 7:6
> “Do not give dogs what is sacred; do not throw your pearls to pigs. If you do, they may trample them under their feet, and turn and tear you to pieces.
46. Is God concerned with the stage you are in now or the stage you wish to be?
47. If you wish to become perfect like God, is God perfect and capable of making you perfect too? 
48. Give your heart to God, asking him to perfect you and everything concerning you.
49. Give your heart to God each day.

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# The Lord's Prayer
Matthew 6:9-13

*9 In this  manner, therefore, pray:*

1. *Our Father in Heaven...*
	- Do you have a Father in Heaven who gave you to your earthly parents?
	- Do your earthly parents have a piece of themselves in you?
	- Does your Heavenly Father also have a piece of himself in you?
	- Does your Heavenly Fathe also live in you?
	- Pray to thank God for being your Father, telling him that you accept his Fatherhood
2. *Hallowed be Your name...*
	- Does God have a name on earth, apart from his real name?
	- When a person is always making trouble, do they get to be called a Trouble-maker?
	- Can your name in your class be likened to your reputation in the class?
	- At the mention of your name, what comes to the minds of others?
	- What name are you making for yourself?
	- At the mention of God's name what comes to your mind?
	- Does God intend to have a good name among his people? Ezekiel 36:20
	> And wherever they went among the nations they profaned my holy name, for it was said of them, ‘These are the Lord’s people, and yet they had to leave his land.’
	
	- What does it mean for something to be hallowed?
	- What are some things that you can do that will make people no longer hallow God's name?
	- What are some things that you can do that will make others hallow God's name?
	- Pray telling God to help you hallow his name as long as you live
3. *Your kingdom come...*
	- Is God a King and does he have a kingdom?
	- When God rules over your heart, have you entered God's kingdom?
	- Is God's kingdom something you can see with your eyes or does God's kingdom dwell in you and cannot be seen? Luke 17:20-21
	> 20 Some Pharisees asked Jesus when the Kingdom of God would come. His answer was, “The Kingdom of God does not come in such a way as to be seen. 21 No one will say, ‘Look, here it is!’ or, ‘There it is!’; because the Kingdom of God is within you.”
	
	- Does God's kingdom rule in Heaven?
	- Does God's kingdom rule on the earth, or does it rule alongside Satan's kingdom?
	- Do you want God to rule over the earth in the hearts of men?
	- Pray and give your heart to God
4. *Your will be done*  
*On earth as  _it is_  in heaven...* 
	- Does God have a will?
	- Does God have his way of life, thinking, and doing things?
	- Is God's will, his way of life, thinking, doing things?
	- Does God want his ways to be adopted in the earth?
	- How does God expect you to respond when someone offends you? Luke 6:28-30
	> 28 bless those who curse you,  pray for those who abuse you.  29 To one who strikes you on the cheek, offer the other also, and from one who takes away your cloak do not withhold your tunic either.  30 Give to everyone who begs from you, and from one who takes away your goods do not demand them back. 
	
	- Is God's will what is done in Heaven?
	- Do you want God's will to be done on earth?
	- Pray asking God to let his will be done in you and on earth
5. *Give us this day our daily bread...*  
	- Is your daily bread food that you eat into your stomach which is gone by the day's end?
	- Is your daily bread knowing God's will and doing it, making your spirit grow?
	- You eat your bread, daily, weekly, or monthly?
	- What is Jesus' special food? John 4:30-33
	> 30 They went out of the town and were coming to him.
	>
	>31 Meanwhile the disciples were urging him, saying,  “Rabbi, eat.”  32 But he said to them,  “I have food to eat that you do not know about.”  33 So the disciples said to one another,  “Has anyone brought him something to eat?”
	
	- Pray asking God to give you your bread for the day
6. *And  forgive us our debts,  
As we forgive our debtors...*  
	- When you choose not to forgive others, are you holding them prisoners?
	- When you do not lose the bonds of your prisoners, will God also lose you from your guilt?
	- Pray mentioning the names of everyone who has offended you saying that you forgive them
	- Should you let the people you have forgiven know that they have been forgiven?
	- What is the reason for your answer?
	- Pray asking God to forgive all your sins
7. *And do not lead us into temptation,  
But deliver us from the evil one...*  
	- Are there temptations in this world, so much so that you may end up falling away from God despite having good intentions to only serve his will and purpose for your life?
	- What are some ways the devil tempts us from the love of God and we find ourselves doing the things we resolved never to do?
	- Are you willing to pray to ask God to take away anything from you that will lead you away from him, even if you greatly desired that thing?
	- If you answer yes, pray asking God to deliver you from every temptation even if you greatly desire it.
8. *For Yours is the kingdom and the power and the glory forever. Amen.*
	- When God reveals his will to you, gives you your daily bread and you eat it by doing it, and your spirit grows, does God get the glory?
	- Does the glory of God constantly go through a cycle that starts with God revealing his will to the children of the kingdom, and when they act on it, the glory goes back to God?
	- Give glory to God

sections.question: *Our Father in Heaven...*
sections.body:
- Do you have a Father in Heaven who gave you to your earthly parents?
- Do your earthly parents have a piece of themselves in you?
- Does your Heavenly Father also have a piece of himself in you?
- Does your Heavenly Fathe also live in you?
- Pray to thank God for being your Father, telling him that you accept his Fatherhood

sections.question: *Hallowed be Your name...*
sections.body:
- Does God have a name on earth, apart from his real name?
- When a person is always making trouble, do they get to be called a Trouble-maker?
- Can your name in your class be likened to your reputation in the class?
- At the mention of your name, what comes to the minds of others?
- What name are you making for yourself?
- At the mention of God's name what comes to your mind?
- Does God intend to have a good name among his people? Ezekiel 36:20
> And wherever they went among the nations they profaned my holy name, for it was said of them, ‘These are the Lord’s people, and yet they had to leave his land.’

- What does it mean for something to be hallowed?
- What are some things that you can do that will make people no longer hallow God's name?
- What are some things that you can do that will make others hallow God's name?
- Pray telling God to help you hallow his name as long as you live

sections.question: *Your kingdom come...*
sections.body:
- Is God a King and does he have a kingdom?
- When God rules over your heart, have you entered God's kingdom?
- Is God's kingdom something you can see with your eyes or does God's kingdom dwell in you and cannot be seen? Luke 17:20-21
> 20 Some Pharisees asked Jesus when the Kingdom of God would come. His answer was, “The Kingdom of God does not come in such a way as to be seen. 21 No one will say, ‘Look, here it is!’ or, ‘There it is!’; because the Kingdom of God is within you.”

- Does God's kingdom rule in Heaven?
- Does God's kingdom rule on the earth, or does it rule alongside Satan's kingdom?
- Do you want God to rule over the earth in the hearts of men?
- Pray and give your heart to God

sections.question: *Your will be done*
sections.body:
*On earth as  _it is_  in heaven...* 
- Does God have a will?
- Does God have his way of life, thinking, and doing things?
- Is God's will, his way of life, thinking, doing things?
- Does God want his ways to be adopted in the earth?
- How does God expect you to respond when someone offends you? Luke 6:28-30
> 28 bless those who curse you,  pray for those who abuse you.  29 To one who strikes you on the cheek, offer the other also, and from one who takes away your cloak do not withhold your tunic either.  30 Give to everyone who begs from you, and from one who takes away your goods do not demand them back. 

- Is God's will what is done in Heaven?
- Do you want God's will to be done on earth?
- Pray asking God to let his will be done in you and on earth

sections.question: *Give us this day our daily bread...*
sections.body:
- Is your daily bread food that you eat into your stomach which is gone by the day's end?
- Is your daily bread knowing God's will and doing it, making your spirit grow?
- You eat your bread, daily, weekly, or monthly?
- What is Jesus' special food? John 4:30-33
> 30 They went out of the town and were coming to him.
>
>31 Meanwhile the disciples were urging him, saying,  “Rabbi, eat.”  32 But he said to them,  “I have food to eat that you do not know about.”  33 So the disciples said to one another,  “Has anyone brought him something to eat?”

- Pray asking God to give you your bread for the day

sections.question: *And  forgive us our debts,
sections.body:
As we forgive our debtors...*  
- When you choose not to forgive others, are you holding them prisoners?
- When you do not lose the bonds of your prisoners, will God also lose you from your guilt?
- Pray mentioning the names of everyone who has offended you saying that you forgive them
- Should you let the people you have forgiven know that they have been forgiven?
- What is the reason for your answer?
- Pray asking God to forgive all your sins

sections.body:
But deliver us from the evil one...*  
- Are there temptations in this world, so much so that you may end up falling away from God despite having good intentions to only serve his will and purpose for your life?
- What are some ways the devil tempts us from the love of God and we find ourselves doing the things we resolved never to do?
- Are you willing to pray to ask God to take away anything from you that will lead you away from him, even if you greatly desired that thing?
- If you answer yes, pray asking God to deliver you from every temptation even if you greatly desire it.

sections.body:
- When God reveals his will to you, gives you your daily bread and you eat it by doing it, and your spirit grows, does God get the glory?
- Does the glory of God constantly go through a cycle that starts with God revealing his will to the children of the kingdom, and when they act on it, the glory goes back to God?
- Give glory to God

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# The Path of the Unrighteous
1. Repeat three times: 
> The path of the unrighteous is hard
2. Who is an unrighteous person?
3. When you choose to live a life of unrighteousness, will your father help you?
4. Will your mother help you?
5. Will God help you?
6. Will the angels help you?
7. Will your path in life be easy or hard?
8. Who is a righteous person?
9. When you choose to live a life of righteousness, will your father help you?
10. Will your mother help you?
11. Will God help you?
12. Will the angels help you?
13. Will your path in life be easy or hard?
14. Do you want to live a life of righteousness or unrighteousness?
15. What righteous thing do you want to start doing today?

sections.question: Repeat three times:
sections.body: > The path of the unrighteous is hard

sections.question: Who is an unrighteous person?
When you choose to live a life of unrighteousness, will your father help you?
Will your mother help you?
Will God help you?
Will the angels help you?
Will your path in life be easy or hard?
Who is a righteous person?
When you choose to live a life of righteousness, will your father help you?
Will your mother help you?
Will God help you?
Will the angels help you?
Will your path in life be easy or hard?
Do you want to live a life of righteousness or unrighteousness?
What righteous thing do you want to start doing today?

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# The Promised Land

1. What do you remember from the story of Moses, the children of Israel, and the promised land?
2. What did Moses tell the children of Israel about the promised land? Exodus 3:8
> 8 So I have come down to rescue them from the hand of the Egyptians and to bring them up out of that land into a good and spacious land, a land flowing with milk and honey—the home of the Canaanites, Hittites, Amorites, Perizzites, Hivites and Jebusites.
3. Have you seen a piece of land that is flowing with milk and honey?
4. Will arriving at a specific location make your life better?
5. What did Moses teach the children of Israel every day, on their way to the promised land?
6. Did the children of Israel complain?
7. What did they complain about?
8. Did they learn the lessons that Moses taught them?
9. Did they obey God's instructions?
10. What is the nearest city around you?
11. If you were traveling by foot to the nearest city, how long would it take you to arrive?
12. How long did the children of Israel travel in the wilderness?
13. Did they make it to the promised land? Joshua 5:6
>  For the children of Israel walked forty years in the wilderness till all the people who were men of war, who came out of Egypt, were consumed because they obeyed not the voice of the Lord. Unto these the Lord swore that He would not show them the land which the Lord swore unto their fathers that He would give us, a land that floweth with milk and honey.
14. If you were alone in the house with plenty of foodstuffs but no food, and you were feeling hungry but did not know how to cook, will you starve or not?
15. Will you starve because there is no foodstuff in the house?
16. Why will you starve?
17. Is the promised land a physical location?
18. Is the promised land in you or outside you?
19. If the promised land is in you, who are the Canaanites, Hittites, Amorites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites?
20. Can your legs take you to the promised land?
21. What will happen to you when you try to go to the promised land on foot?
22. How do you arrive at the promised land?
23. How did Moses intend to take the children of Israel to the promised land?
24. Why did the children of Israel fail to make it to the promised land?
25. Can you reach the promised land without changing the way you think?
26. Can you reach the promised land without changing your attitude?
27. Does God want to give you himself, or all the food in the world?
28. Does God want to give you himself, or all the lands of the world?
29. If you do not *think* like God, are you at the promised land?
30. If you do not *speak* like God are you at the promised land?
31. If you do not *act* like God, are you at the promised land?
32. How will you know when you have arrived at the promised land?
33. Will you lack when you reach the promised land?
34. Will you make the wrong choices when you reach the promised land?
35. When you have reached the promised land, will you succeed no matter where you find yourself?
36. When you do not allow God to take you to the promised land, in what ways can a task that should take you a day, take you 40 years, and you will still not be able to complete it?
37. Are you at the promised land?
38. How will you get to the promised land?

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# The Purpose of Childhood

1. Why do humans come into the world, not as adults, but as little children?  
2. Write down 5 things that you are learning now as a child, that you think will help you when you grow up.

sections.question: Why do humans come into the world, not as adults, but as little children?
Write down 5 things that you are learning now as a child, that you think will help you when you grow up.

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# They Take No Prisoners



In the days before mercy was ever spoken of, men lived by the law of blood and vengeance. If one tribe wronged another, the answer was simple: gather the strongest warriors, sharpen the spears, and march at dawn. They would burn huts, slay men, take women, and crush every sign that the other tribe ever existed. No survivors. No prisoners. Mercy was a word unborn.

To them, justice was destruction — swift, total, unquestioned. The old songs celebrated it. Warriors were praised not for their restraint, but for how thoroughly they erased their enemies. When rage filled their hearts, it became a river that drowned reason. The smoke that rose from burnt villages was their victory song.

Then, somewhere between the ashes of vengeance and the bones of the fallen, a man appeared. He was not a warrior, nor did he carry a sword. He carried only words — words about a God who forgave. A God who, even when wronged, opened His hand instead of His fist.

“Blessed are the merciful,” he said, “for they shall obtain mercy.”

The people laughed at first. What warrior wanted to be blessed for sparing his enemy? What tribe wanted to leave survivors who might one day return for revenge? But his words began to spread, soft as wind yet heavy with truth.

He told stories of a Father who forgives His enemies, who restrains His power though He could destroy with a word. He said strength is not in killing, but in sparing. To fight when provoked is natural; to forgive when wounded is divine. Slowly, those words found soil in human hearts.

Centuries passed. The world changed. Nations rose and fell, and the idea of mercy began to shape them. Taking prisoners, once unthinkable, became a sign of progress — a mark of civilization. Wars still came, but some enemies were now fed, not slaughtered. The greatest victory was no longer total annihilation, but restraint.

Still, the old instinct sometimes stirs. I saw it one afternoon while teaching children about God in a dusty community classroom. Two girls quarreled over a skipping rope. One raised her fist and struck the other again and again — wild, relentless, and **without even looking at her opponent**. Her eyes were fixed somewhere beyond the moment, clouded with blind anger. She didn’t care if the other girl was hurt, bleeding, or crying. She kept swinging, refusing to even _see_ the one she was hurting. Mercy had left the room.

For a moment, I saw in that small fight the echo of ancient wars — how easily the heart returns to the law of destruction. Rage blinds; it silences compassion.

When I separated them, the furious girl stood panting, tears streaking her face. I asked her, “Why didn’t you stop when she said sorry?”

She looked confused, almost startled, as if she hadn’t heard me. In her silence, I saw how natural vengeance feels to the human heart — and how unnatural mercy must be taught, again and again.

Taking prisoners — the act of stopping before total destruction — is more than a political practice. It’s a moral awakening. It means recognizing that even when you have the power to destroy, you choose not to. That choice, repeated through history, has kept humanity from consuming itself.

The tribes of old took no prisoners because they saw no value in mercy. But we, who have heard of mercy and still refuse it, are worse. Civilization is not the absence of war — it’s the presence of restraint.

When you take no prisoners, you destroy your enemy.  
When you take prisoners, you save yourself.

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Time

1. How old is the sun?  
2. How old are you?  
3. What is the longest that you think you will ever live?  
4. Subtract that from the age of the sun.  
5. Do you see that your time on Earth, compared to the sun is like a blink of an eye?  
6. What is a blink of an eye?  
7. How should you spend your blink of an eye on Earth? 
8. Should you spend it doing useful things?  
9. What is the best way to spend your blink of an eye on earth?
10. If you had a car, and you were given only one gallon of fuel, will you decide where you are going, before you start your journey, or you will start your journey before deciding where you are going?  
11. Draw the picture of a winding path with many branches, that finally ends with God. 
12. If you have a fixed amount of time, can you choose to branch to other paths (gossip, stealing, insult) which do not lead to your destination, before finally making your way to God?  
13. Is your time not running out as you try other branches that do not lead to God?
14. Have you decided what you wish to do with your blink of an eye on earth?
15. Speak to God about it and ask him to help you arrive at your destination.

Subtract that from the age of the sun.

What is a blink of an eye?
How should you spend your blink of an eye on Earth?
Should you spend it doing useful things?
What is the best way to spend your blink of an eye on earth?

Draw the picture of a winding path with many branches, that finally ends with God.

Is your time not running out as you try other branches that do not lead to God?
Have you decided what you wish to do with your blink of an eye on earth?
Speak to God about it and ask him to help you arrive at your destination.

textLessons.title: Treasures in a Jar of Clay

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Treasures in a Jar of Clay

1. What is something that belongs to you?
2. When do you say that something belongs to you?
3. Can what belongs to you, be taken away from you?
4. Can you defend what belongs to you, against *anyone* who will try to take it away from you?
5. Does it belong to you, forever?
6. If what belongs to you, does not belong to you forever, and a person who was stronger than you could take it away from you, does it *truly* belong to you?
7. What are some things that belong to you that can be taken away from you, and do not belong to you forever?
8. What are some things that belong to you forever, and cannot be taken away from you, even if the person was more powerful than you?
9. What is the story of Jesus, Mary, and Martha? Luke 10:38-42
>38 As Jesus and his disciples were on their way, he came to a village where a woman named Martha opened her home to him.  39 She had a sister called Mary,  who sat at the Lord’s feet listening to what he said.  40 But Martha was distracted by all the preparations that had to be made. She came to him and asked, “Lord, don’t you care that my sister has left me to do the work by myself? Tell her to help me!”
>41 “Martha, Martha,”  the Lord answered,  “you are worried and upset about many things,  42 but few things are needed—or indeed only one. Mary has chosen what is better, and it will not be taken away from her.”
10. What was the reason for Christ's answer to Martha? Luke 10:42
> ...but few things are needed—or indeed only one. Mary has chosen what is better, and it will not be taken away from her.
11. When do you say that something truly belongs to you?
12. Can your knowledge of God be taken away from you?
13. Can your valuable memories be taken away from you?
14. Can the content of your Character, which is Godlike, be taken away from you?
15. Can your Godlike personality be taken away from you?
16. Which is more important, the things that belong to you that can be taken away from you, or the things that belong to you that *cannot* be taken away from you?
17. Do you keep the things that cannot be taken away from you, in you, or outside you?
18. Are the things that cannot be taken away from you, visible or invisible?
19. Which is more important, the things that belong to you that cannot be seen, or the things that belong to you that can be seen? 
20. Which is more important, the things that belong to you that are in you, or the things that belong to you that are outside you? 
21. Who protects the treasures in you from the people who will try to take them away from you?
22. What is a treasure?
23. What are some things that people treasure in this world? 
24. Can these treasures be taken away from them or not?
25. Which kind of treasures should you spend every day of your life finding and collecting?
26. If your treasures are the contents of your mind that have eternal value, the Godly content of your heart, then what is the jar of clay?
27. Which treasures do you wish to collect into your jar of clay?
28. How do you collect treasures into your jar of clay?
29. If your life is not measured by how much you own, then what is your life measured by? Luke 12:15
> Beware! Guard against every kind of greed. Life is not measured by how much you own.
30. Can you be rich yet poor? Revelation 3:17
> You say, ‘I am rich; I have acquired wealth and do not need a thing.’ But you do not realize that you are wretched, pitiful, poor, blind and naked.
31. How can you be rich yet poor?
32. Can you be clothed, yet naked?
33. How can you be clothed, yet naked?
34. Can you be healthy, yet sick?
35. How can you be healthy, yet sick?
36. Why did Christ call the rich man a fool? Luke 12:13-21
> 13 A man in the crowd said to Jesus, “Teacher, tell my brother to divide with me the property our father left us.”
>
>14 Jesus answered him, “Friend, who gave me the right to judge or to divide the property between you two?” 15 And he went on to say to them all, “Watch out and guard yourselves from every kind of greed; because your true life is not made up of the things you own, no matter how rich you may be.”
>
>16 Then Jesus told them this parable: “There was once a rich man who had land which bore good crops. 17 He began to think to himself, ‘I don't have a place to keep all my crops. What can I do? 18 This is what I will do,’ he told himself; ‘I will tear down my barns and build bigger ones, where I will store the grain and all my other goods. 19 Then I will say to myself, Lucky man! You have all the good things you need for many years. Take life easy, eat, drink, and enjoy yourself!’ 20 But God said to him, ‘You fool! This very night you will have to give up your life; then who will get all these things you have kept for yourself?’”
>
>21 And Jesus concluded, “This is how it is with those who pile up riches for themselves but are not rich in God's sight.”
37. What will God do when your jar of clay is full of good treasures?

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# You Are a Nation

1. What nations do you know of?
2. How many people usually live in a nation?
3. Do you know that you are a nation?  
4. How many friends do you have?  
5. Do you know that your friends also have friends?  
6. Do you know that there are also people around you who learn from you without letting you know about it?  
7. Draw a picture of a tree of people learning from you, directly and indirectly, using only two people at a time.
8. Based on the tree you have drawn, how many people do you really need to change an entire nation?
9. When you teach one person, how many people are you really teaching?
10. What is the reason for your answer? 
11. When you hear gossip, and you share the gossip with another person, how many people are you really sharing the gossip with?
12. What is the reason for your answer? 
13. When you show kindness to one person, how many people are you really showing kindness to?
14. What is the reason for your answer?
15. When you make one person angry, how many people are you really making angry?
16. What is the reason for your answer?
17. How should you conduct yourself before others, now that you know that you are a nation?
18. What is the reason for your answer?
19. What can you say to another nation when you meet them, that will benefit the people of that nation?  
20. What can you teach another nation when you meet them, that will benefit the people of that nation?  
21. Why did God say that Abraham would be the father of many nations even though he had no children? Genesis 17:5
> 5 Your name will no longer be Abram, but Abraham, because I am making you the ancestor of many nations.
22. Is God concerned with merely having many children, or is God concerned with what you pass down to your children? Genesis 18:19
> For I have chosen him, so that he will direct his children and his household after him to keep the way of the LORD by doing what is right and just, so that the LORD will bring about for Abraham what he has promised him.”
23. How did God intend to bless all the nations of the world through Abrahama's offspring? Genesis 22:17-18
> 17 I will surely bless you and make your descendants as numerous as the stars in the sky  and as the sand on the seashore.  Your descendants will take possession of the cities of their enemies,  18 and through your offspring all nations on earth will be blessed, because you have obeyed me.”
24. Why did God make Abraham grow incredibly old before giving him the offspring through whom the nations of the world would be blessed?
25. How many children were in the womb of Rebecca? Genesis 25:20-23
> 20 Isaac was forty years old when he married Rebecca, the daughter of Bethuel (an Aramean from Mesopotamia) and sister of Laban. 21 Because Rebecca had no children, Isaac prayed to the  Lord for her. The  Lord answered his prayer, and Rebecca became pregnant. 22 She was going to have twins, and before they were born, they struggled against each other in her womb. She said, “Why should something like this happen to me?” So she went to ask the  Lord for an answer.
> 
> 23 The  Lord  said to her,
>
>“Two nations are within you;  
You will give birth to two rival peoples.  
One will be stronger than the other;  
The older will serve the younger.”
26. How much salt do you need to make a soup taste good?
27. Are you enough to change your nation?
28. Draw the flag of your nation.
29. Would anybody like to visit your nation?
30. Activity: Demonstrate how the nations of the world came to practice greetings.
